editorialDecl.p: EEBO-TCP is a partnership between the Universities of Michigan and Oxford and the publisher ProQuest to create accurately transcribed and encoded texts based on the image sets published by ProQuest via their Early English Books Online (EEBO) database (http://eebo.chadwyck.com). The general aim of EEBO-TCP is to encode one copy (usually the first edition) of every monographic English-language title published between 1473 and 1700 available in EEBO.

EEBO-TCP aimed to produce large quantities of textual data within the usual project restraints of time and funding, and therefore chose to create diplomatic transcriptions (as opposed to critical editions) with light-touch, mainly structural encoding based on the Text Encoding Initiative (http://www.tei-c.org).

The EEBO-TCP project was divided into two phases. The 25,363 texts created during Phase 1 of the project have been released into the public domain as of 1 January 2015. Anyone can now take and use these texts for their own purposes, but we respectfully request that due credit and attribution is given to their original source.
Users should be aware of the process of creating the TCP texts, and therefore of any assumptions that can be made about the data.

Text selection was based on the New Cambridge Bibliography of English Literature (NCBEL). If an author (or for an anonymous work, the title) appears in NCBEL, then their works are eligible for inclusion. Selection was intended to range over a wide variety of subject areas, to reflect the true nature of the print record of the period. In general, first editions of a works in English were prioritized, although there are a number of works in other languages, notably Latin and Welsh, included and sometimes a second or later edition of a work was chosen if there was a compelling reason to do so.

Image sets were sent to external keying companies for transcription and basic encoding. Quality assurance was then carried out by editorial teams in Oxford and Michigan. 5% (or 5 pages, whichever is the greater) of each text was proofread for accuracy and those which did not meet QA standards were returned to the keyers to be redone. After proofreading, the encoding was enhanced and/or corrected and characters marked as illegible were corrected where possible up to a limit of 100 instances per text. Any remaining illegibles were encoded as <gap>s. Understanding these processes should make clear that, while the overall quality of TCP data is very good, some errors will remain and some readable characters will be marked as illegible. Users should bear in mind that in all likelihood such instances will never have been looked at by a TCP editor.
The texts were encoded and linked to page images in accordance with level 4 of the TEI in Libraries guidelines.

Copies of the texts have been issued variously as SGML (TCP schema; ASCII text with mnemonic sdata character entities); displayable XML (TCP schema; characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or text strings within braces); or lossless XML (TEI P5, characters represented either as UTF-8 Unicode or TEI g elements).

Full documentation of the original data capture process is available from the Text Creation Partnership web site. All versions of the texts are now archived and freely available for download. See the TCP Download FAQ for detailed information. The TEI P5 versions are also freely available from the TCP Github repository.

div.p: THE PRINCES PRAYERS.
THE FIRST AND second Part.
CONTAYNING CHRIstian and zealous Meditations for euery Day in the Weeke, Morning and Euening.

p.hi: The second Edition, corrected, enlarged, and much more perfected then before.

div.p: LONDON Imprinted by Iohn Windet, for Ieffrie Chorleton. 1610.

div.head: TO THE HIGH AND mighty Prince HENRY, eldest Sonne to the Kings most excellent Maiestie: Prince of great Britaine and Ireland, Duke of Cornwall, &c. and Knight of the most Noble Order of the Garter.
div.p:
OVT of the deare and duteous affection, which
both by the Lawes of God, iustice of nature, and vnreproueable rule of rightfull obedience, I owe vnto your most royall Father, my dread Soueraigne, and next vnto your Princely self; I offer to your gracious acceptance this poore and homely present, more rich in substance, then in outward appearance, & yet farre more highly dignified, if it be b • t deigned your royall fauo • r. I haue beene so bold, (by aduise of good iudgement, and in regard of some small merit,
which these Prayers and Meditations are thought to carrie) to entitle them, The Princes Prayers. Not presuming to square you a method for meditating, or imagining them any way worthie your vse, but onely, as another small Treatise of like nature, which hath long time beene extant, vnder name of The Kings Psalmes and The Queenes Prayers, haue had happy passage in the world, & (no doubt) done much good: Euen so, your Princely name, but gracing
these religious exercises, and they bearing your countenance to future cōtinuance, more profit may arise (by thē) then can be rashly promised, and renown your vertues beside, to endlesse remembrance.

I must confesse (and am the more sorrie for it) that the Book comes not in such seemely maner, as I could haue wished, or as befitted so Princelie a Patrones view, both in regard of mine owne slender abilitie, to performe matter of such moment, with
aunswerable stile and phrase; as also the Printers too many imperfections, which although they haue vnwillingly (I dare say) escaped, yet might haue beene farre better respected. But if your Grace shall please to burie both our defects, in the truely royall affabilitie of your Princely minde, and in place of all wants, to let good will supplie the roome; I haue what I desire, and which I will endeuour also hereafter much better to deserue. Remaining now & euer
in hearty prayer, for your health and happinesse: That no foule heart or hand at any time come neare you; no annoyance disturbe you, or euill thought offend you; but the hand of heauen for euer to blesse you, and this land of Great Britaine long to enioy you.

closer.signed: Your Graces louing Seruant, desirous as yet to passe (publikely) vnnamed, till better meanes may make him worthy.

div.head: THE PRINCES PRAYERS.
Our Lords Prayer, with a briefe Paraphrase thereon.
div.p:
OVr Father which art in Heauen: that is to say: Gracious, good and Almightie Father, thou art euery where with vs, albeit thy Maiesty doth most principally declare it selfe to bee in Heauen. Thou hast created nourished, maintained
and defended vs: Thou hast commanded vs to pray and beg of thee, and hast likewise most benignly promised vs assistance, succour and deliuerance in all our necessities.

Hallowed bee thy name: As much to say, As, do thou cause, that thy blessed name and thy selfe may be rightlie knowne, euen according as thou hast manifested the same in thy holy worde. That thou maiest also be esteemed, valued and honoured: according as thou oughtest to bee, both in our words and works, as also in our holy and Christian conuersation.

Thy Kindome come Herein wee say, Grant Lord vnto vs, that thy sacred word may be in perfect efficacie among vs: so that we may receiue it, cleaue fast vnto it, and encrease dayly in the
knowledge of those things, which therein are reuealed vnto vs. Graunt likewise, that others (yet wandring) may agree and ioyne themselues thereto, and that it may haue a powerfull passage, thorough the world: yea in such sort that all may bee reduced to the Kingdome of thy grace, to bee truely partakers of their redemption and • aluation.

Thy will bee done in earth as it is in Heauen: That is to say: Let thy will onelie bee done, and not the wi • l of the deuill, or of thy other enemies: that exalt themselues against thy worde, to hinder or oppresse the power thereof. Bee thou the meanes, that wee may daylie imploie our selues, to doe what then wouldst haue vs to doe: according as the Angels, and other celestial creatures, doe
euermore readily addict thēselues thereto. And that (by patience) wee may either suppresse, surpasse, or ouercome, whatsoeuer we are to suffer vnder the same.

Giue vs this day our daylie bread: Herein we desire that it would please thee (as thou doest for the soule) so likewise to prouide for the bodie, all such things as are necessarily belonging therto. As, in giuing vs nourishment, cloathing, peace, direction, good fame, wholsome seasons, and all other gratious blessings, for maintenance of this life.

Forgiue vs our trespasses, as wee forgiue them that trespasse against vs: Hereby wee intreate thee that thou wilt take no note of those faults, errours or transgressions, which euery instant is to be found in vs: but rather to
take pittie and compassion vpon vs, and to giue vs (by thy grace) remission of our sinnes, promised and assured vnto vs in thy holy Gospell. Assist vs also (O Lord) that (after thine example) euery one of vs may willingly, and from the bottome of our hearts, pardon all such as haue offended against vs.

Leade vs not into temptation. Hereby we vnderstand that during this life, we are ordinarily to bee assailed by our owne flesh, and many other wicked sinfull desires, whereunto wee are by nature inclined. Wee are likewise oftentimes sollicited to such offences, both by euill company, and lewd examples: For the world takes delight to heate our blood, firing vs with impatience, and prouoking vs to bad
actions. The deuill also (as a busie intermedler) casts his impoisoned arrowes amongst vs, and by them he wounds vs very often. Hee labours to get Faith, hope and Charitie from vs, and to throwe vs headlong into incredulitie, desperation, blasphemie, denying of God and such like detestable iniquities. Wherefore (deare Father) most humbly wee beseech thee, that thou wilt neuer suffer vs to fall by any of these temptations.
But deliuer vs from euil: As much to say. As, doe thou (Lord) aide and assist vs, for no way else can wee escape all those euill inconueniences, whereinto our aduersaries labour to deiect vs.

For thine is the kingdom, the power and the glorie, for euer and euer: Amen. Heereby (Lord) wee truely know,
that all power is only thine and therefore thou hast both power and will to helpe vs: For thine authoritie is ouer all things. Thou art mercifull, and hast promised to heare vs. Wee doe then assure our selues, and neuer will doubt of in, but thou wilt grant vs any thing, which thou dost know (much better then we) to be needful for vs.

div.head: A Prayer at entrance into Church.
div.p:
ALmighty God & heauenly Father, trusting in the multitude of thy mercies, dutifully doe I enter into this thy house, and (in thy feare) doe I prostrate my selfe in the Pallace of thy holinesse. Oh thou that art Eternall, conduct me in thy
righteousnes: prepare thy way, and make it perfect before mee: leade me in the path of thy holy ordinances: For thou art my God, and the Lord of my saluation. I loue thy house and gladly desire to bee in the assembly of thy Saints, such as confesse and sing thy praises. Oh Lord God o • hosts, how amiable are thy tabernacles and dwellings? my soule is earnestly couetous, to bee but in the Porch of any one of them.

Come then let vs altogether worship and fall down before the Lorde that hath made vs. For hee is our God, and wee are his people, yea the sheepe of his pasture. Exalte the name of the Eternall, our God, and let vs prostrate our selues before his foot-stoole, for he is holy. O my God, in the
assembly of thy Saints, here doe I present my petitions vnto thee, in the time of thy good pleasure, heare me: according to thine owne great goodnesse, and the fidelitie I doe constantly repose in thy succour. So bee it.

div.head: For Assistance of the blessed Spirit of Grace, to make our prayers effectuall.
div.p:
ETernall and most mercifull God in regarde wee neineither know, or can comprehend, what wee ought to demaund, or how we should direct our prayers vnto thee, because thou art alwaies readie to giue vs much more, then wee vnderstand how either to deserue or desire: Wee humbly beseech thee, that (according to thine owne promises)
it would please thee to ouerspread vs (at this instant) with thy good spirite of grace and prayer, to the end, that, with vnspeakeable sighes and groanes, it may make intercession to thee for vs: and so enable vs, that in true zeale, both with our hearts & mouths wee may call vpon thee, offering thee the sacrifice of praise and prayer, which is most pleasing and acceptable vnto thee.

Lord, open thou our lips, and then our mouthes shall sound foorth thy praise. Awake our dull soules, that we may not presume to approch neere thee, with vaine lippe-labour, or sole honor of the mouth, our harts being too farre off from thee. But giue vs the grace, that wee may call vpon thee as true worshippers do in spirit
and truth, vsing all the parts of our affection, vnderstanding and thoughts, without any appetite to hypocrisie or vaineglory. Let our desires bee such, as are conformable to thy heauenly will, the illustration of thy glorie, and for the saluation of our owne soules.

Grant also (good Father) that our faith in praying may bee firme, not any way wauering or doubtfull, but that wee shall effectually obtain from thy bounty, whatsoeuer (in dutie) wee can desire of thee. Let not vs (Lorde) prescribe thee anie times, or meanes for attention to vs: but at all seasons and in all occasions, in firme hope, patience and humility of heart, wee may submit our selues to thy good pleasure, which euermore best becommeth true Christians.

Giue vs grace that in presenting our supplications to thee, we neither build nor put any confidence in our owne righteousnes: but in thy boundlesse compassions and the name of thy beloued Sonne Iesus Christ, thorough whom, we haue boldnesse to present our selues before thy throne, and in the confidence of children, dare call thee our Father, So confirme vs, deare Father, that our vnworthines, nor any other sinfull considerations, whatsoeuer, be any hindrance or impediment to our prayers.

Assist vs O most louing God in such sort, that we (in all places) lifting vp vnpolluted hands to thee, without bread or distrust: and (insisting vpon prayers, supplications and thanksgiuing for all men) may (according to
thy promises) receiue from thy benignitie, al good gifts whatsoeuer, both spirituall and corporall. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for the morning.
div.p:
EVerliuing lord God,Sunday. heauenly Father, thy great and Almighty name be euermore blessed, thy goodnes and mercy endlesly praised, thy wisedom and truth eternally honored: For thou (with thy hand) hast couered vs this perillous night past, suffering vs to rest and sleepe safely vnder the shadow of thy wings Thou hast fatherly preserued vs from all the snares of the wicked enemy: wherefore we laude thy name, for the goodnes and meruailes which thou workest for the
children of men.

Wee will praise thee in the congregation, and thy worthinesse shall bee euermore in our mouthes. Our soules shall blesse thee (O Lord) & al that is within vs shall celebrate thy name: neuer forgetting or beeing vnmindfull of the good which thou hast done daylie for vs. Let then this sacrifice of praise and thanksgiuing, deliuered from our mouthes, and which wee present vnto thee this morning in true simplicitie of our hearts, bee gracious and acceptable in thy sight.

Wee cry vnto thee with all our might, that thou wouldest likewise this day defend vs, from all dangers both of our bodies & soules Giue charge to thy holy Angels, that they may keep vs in all our waies. Couer
vs with thy buckler of sauing health, and guide vs in the paths of thy commandements: that wee may bee vnreprooueable in thy seruice according to thy will, and walke as becommeth the children of light.

Keepe farre off from vs spiritual deceiuings, & al the scandalls of ye world, strēgthening vs in such sorte: as they may get no victory ouer vs, to make vs wilfully sinne against thee, or vrge thy displ • asure by our iniquities. Direct vs by thy holie Spirit, to the end that wee may neuer vndertake, doo, thinke, or speake anie thing, but what may be pleasing • o thee, and answereable to the glorie of thy great Maiesty.

Beholde (O our Lorde God) heere doe we commit and offer our selues vnto thy
will, our soules, our bodies, with all their power and faculties inward or outward: Let vs bee to thee (dear Father) liuing, holy and pleasing sacrifices, rendring vnto thee such seruice as is reasonable and acceptable in thy sight. Suffer vs (O Lord) to be thine owne inheritance: and so gouerne our hearts, soules, and spirits, that (aboue all things) wee may onely know thee.

Now carely in the morning listen to our cryes, frō the breake of day, haue wee waited and attended on thee Wee wil celebrate thy praises euery morning, and neuer cease vntill the euening, Giue vs grace (O thou that art eternall) to perform this duety dayly. So be it.

div.head: Thanksgiuing for our Creation.
div.p:
OMnipotent God and heauenly father, that wast not created nor borne, but hadst thy beeing from all eternity euen before there was anie beginning at all: we adore laude, and glorifie thee, rendring thee thanks from the bottome of our hearts, for all thy great blessings and benefits. More especially, in that (by thy diuine word and power) thou hast made the heauens, the earth, the Sun, the Moone and al creatures whatsoeuer that hath life or being, maintaining and ordering them by thy greate wisedome, wee giue thee thankes also (eternall Father) because by thy goodnesse
and mercie, thou hast ordered & diuided the earth with al creatures breathing thereon, making them serue for the vse of man.

But yet more principally wee praise thee our Creator and Lord God, that we being thy creatures thou hast endued vs with reason, and hast formed vs after thine owne Image and fashion, giuing vs bodies and souls and all the members beseeming the bodie, beside vnderstanding, iudgement and all the senses, which hitherto thou hast and dost most graciously maintaine in vs.

Thy goodnes is very admirable, and greate on our behalfe, for when wee were inclosed within our mothers wombes, euen there thou didst preserue and nourish vs. When it pleased thee to fetch vs thence, in grace
thou lokedst on vs and hast not made vs blind, deafe, dumbe, impotent, or imperfect. In thy meere mercie, thou wouldst not suffer vs to be bruite beastes, destitute and depriued of reason. But what is hee that can declare the merueilous workes of the Almighty, or sufficiently extoll his gratious goodnes? who shall recite his worthie praises? There is no one that can recount his wonderfull blessings.

Now albeit wee our selues are poore and wretched sinners, and cannot so sufficientlie praise thee, as either wee ought to doe, or as thou worthely deseruest: yet will we not be silent, or hold our peace, but perpetually applaud thy holy name, and (to our vttermost) expresse thy great mercies. We will proclaime thy Iustice,
louing kindnesse, and limitlesse compassion, so long as wee shall liue: and neuer will wee forget thy many blessinges bestowed on vs, while any iote of breath remaineth within vs. Our mouthes shall recount dayly, thy gratious deliuerances, albeit wee are not able to number them or name them: And these tongues which thou hast created in vs, shall bee imployed to publish continualy thy great glory, saying.

Wee will giue thanks to our Lord God in his holie place, we will praise him in his outstretched power, we will laud his name in his wonderfull works, and (according to the height of his Maiestie) let all things that doe breath, praise the Lord. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for the remission of our sinnes.
div.p:
MOst Mercifull God and louing Father, our sins are grieuous, our iniquities are multiplied, growing very powerfull, and our transgressions are not to be numbred. For from our youth, all our thoughts and cogitations haue beene inclined to euill, and who is hee (Lord) that can count how oftentimes hee hath offended? Wee know our own iniquities, and our sinnes are euermore before vs. Chiefly against thee haue wee transgressed, and done that which hath beene displeasing in thy fight: That thou mightest bee knowne for iust, when thou speakest
and found cleare, when thou iudgest or giuest correction.

But wee beseech thee (O our Lord God) for thy great mercies sake, that thou wilt not enter into iudgement with vs thy poore seruants, for (before thee) no man liuing can be found righteous If thou that art eternal, haue an eye to our misdeeds, who is able to endure it? And if thou contend with wretched man of a thousand Articles who can answer poore one? For the very iustest of al our actions whatsoeuer, in thy sight are like to a foule sullyed cloth, Take pittie therefore vpon vs, according to thy owne benignity, and in the multitude of thy mercies wipe out our iniquities. O Lord heale our fainting sick soules, dying: because wee haue so grieuously sinned against thee. Bee mindfull
〈2 pages missing〉
our Lord and Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: For the prosperous estate of Gods Church.
div.p:
FAther of all mercie, that assemblest and maintainest heere vpon earth, a sanctified congregation or church, by thy word and blessed spirit: wee pray vnto thee for thy poore and little flocke, which (by thy gra • e) hath receiued, embraced, honored, and aduanced thy word, And that it would please thee, daily to continue it firm and constant vnto thee, with pure, sound and wholsome doctrine: as also the true vsage of thy Sacraments, euen against the gates of hell the fury and outrages of the Deuill, and the malice or tyranny
of this wicked world.

Preserue thy little Ship, and all thy faithful seruants sayling in the midst of this tempestuous Sea: blesse it as it floates on the raging billowes, that it sinke not, perish not, nor bee ouerwhelmed. Let thy Church continue constant and immooueable vpon that foundation whereon shee is builded. Oh God of Hosts, returne wee beseech thee, looke downe from Heauen, see and visite thy Vine: making dayly those grafts to prosper which thy right hand hath planted, and those to spread fairely, which thou hast elected: that their branches may extend foorth both in length and strength.

Engirt it round about
with thy shield of defence, and receiue vs (a parcell of thy poore flocke) into thy protection, that none may make spoile of vs, or take vs out of thy handes. Preserue vs from all them that labour to tread downe thy truth of doctrine, therby to establish and confirme their own abhominable Idolatries.

The light of thy diuine worde, whereby at this instant our steps are so brightly directed: O bee thou our soule and safe defence, that it may neuer bee suppressed or extinguished. Thy arme being so strong and powerfull, extend it foorth so farre in thy Churches behalfe, that in the midst of so many troubles and temptations, which it suffers heere beneath and amongst vs: yet thine owne chosen may euer
know thee, & religiously seru thee to the honor, worship, and glorie of thy holy name. Lord deale not with vs according to our sinnes deseruing, for thou hast oftē heretofore pardoned the iniquities of thy people, thou hast withdrawne thy great conceiued displeasure, and moderatelie abated thy iust anger.

Oh God, in whom alone consisteth the saluation of vs all, appease thy furie, and come and comforte vs. Defend thy poore Christian flocke, whose dependance is onely vpon thee, and who hath no other support or protection but thee. Wee beseech thee then (O euerliuing Father) that for the sake of thy dearely beloued Sonne Iesus Christ, it may please thee to lend attention to our prayers and not to be
silent when wee complaine vnto thee: that thy blessed name may neuer be blamed, or the wicked say: Where is now their God? So bee it.

div.head: For the Ministers of Gods word.
div.p:
ALmighty God, who by thy best beloued Sonne Iesus Christ, hast commaunded vs to pray vnto thee, that thou wouldest send workemen into thy Haruest and also hast most benignly promised to heare vs: wee beseech thee for thy deare Sonnes sake, that it would please thee to bestow vppon thy Church a bountifull number of faithfull Ministers and Preachers of thy word. Make them wise and skilfull in the sacred Scriptures,
endue them with thy sanctified Spirit: enrich them with true vnderstanding of thy word, to the end that they may expound the Scriptures without corruption, instructing vs in the true way to eternall life, and admonishing vs how to beware of false religion, and traditions of men, with all other venemous poysons of the soule, that wee may continue safely in the soundnes of true doctrine and faith.

For otherwise how should wee beleeue, what we neuer heard before? and how should we heare, but by thy Preachers? and how should they preach, except they bee sent? Ordaine then (deare Father) such Bishops in thy Church, as may bee taught of thee, good Doctors and Preachers of sound doctrine, faithful pastours, who
beeing instructed effectually by thy blessed Spirit, may maintain thy Church which thy Sonne hath dearely bought with his most pretious bloud. Let them publish and proclaime thy truth with effectuall fructifying, for the glorie of thy holy name, and aduancement of the Gospell, which is thy faithfull and most worthy word.

Let them giue assurance and consolation to distressed consciences against all the temptations of Sathan, and this wicked world. Make them (Oh God) powerfull in exhorting by sound doctrine, and vanquishing the gaine-sayers, to stoppe the mouthes of thy aduersaries, and vtterly to ruinate, conquer, & ouercome the kingdome of the deuill. Let them likewise giue good example
to the Church, by their owne honest conuersation: that all scandall may bee auoided, and no person may receiue occasion, to fall off from faith, by the badde life or lewde behauiour of anie one.

Mercifull God let vs neuer be afflicted with famine or scarcitie of thy word, and suffer vs neuer to be vnprouided of sincere Preachers. Let not thy truth bee taken from vs by our ingratitude and preserue vs from false teachers, vnfaithfull hirelings, and all such as come of themselues, without thy sending. Heare vs O heauenly Father, in the name of thy Sonne Iesus Christ. So be it.

div.head: For such as are hearers of gods word.
div.p: GReat God, and most louing Father in meere bounty and charitie, hast thou cleerely manifested and giuen vnto vs thy diuine word, the wholesome doctrine of the Gospell: which is the spirituall sustenance of our soules, and a powerfull or heauenly vertue for the saluation of al beleeuers For thy Sonne himselfe saith: Blessed are they which heare the worde of God, and keepe it. Also, If any one keep my word, hee shall neuer see death.

Wee pray vnto thee then (Oh God) for all the hearers of thy holie Gospell. Open both our hearts and
eares, that they and we may with profit, listen vnto thy word: and hauing heedfull regard thereunto: wee may diligently apprehend and retaine, whatsoeuer is therin required of vs, for the confirmation of our faith, and amendment of our sinfull lines.

Make thou thy worde to dwell plenteously in vs, with all wisedom, and giue strength (by thy blessed Spirit) to the preaching of thy Gospel: that we may receiue the doctrine thereof, not as meerly from men but as being thy sanctified word. And so walke worthily heereafter as best becommeth thy deare children, and maketh most for the glorie of thy holy name.

O Lord our God, make the seede of thy sauing Doctrine, to take deepe roote in
our hearts, and plentifully to bring foorth fruite. Chase away and bridle the deuill. that he steale not this liuing seede out of our hearts: neither suffer vs not to bee as forgetfull hearers therof, but that we may effectually put thy word to the proofe. Let vs neuer be incōstant, waxe weake, denie or forsake our faith in the times of temptation, aduersitie, or persecution: but giue vs thy gracious assistance, that this sanctified seed of thy heauenly word may not bee choakt or smothered vp, by the solicitudes treasures or voluptuousnes of this life.

Preserue vs so (good God) that we may neuer be found in the company of contemners or mockers: who walke securely after their owne concupiscences, and listen vnto thy worde
with peruerted hearts, and stiffenecked vnderstanding, euen for their owne proper ruine and condemnation. Eternall Father, giue vs grace to receiue with ioy, zeale and good deuotion, all sound Doctrines, admonitions or faithfull reprehensions, tending to our liues amendment: laying them vp in a good & honest heart and bringing forth the fruits thereof in hope and patience.

Lorde, let vs perseuere therein, euen vnto the end, that wee throwing off all the soile and superfluitie of sinfull wretchednes: may entertaine the sweetnesse of thy worde, and haue it soundly planted in vs, which onelie can saue our soules in Iesus Christ our Lord.

div.head: Against sects and false doctrine.
div.p: MErcifull God, thou hast carefully admonished vs, to take heede of false Prophets, which come vnto vs in sheepes cloathing, and yet are inwardly rauenous woolues. Thou hast likewise tolde vs, that in the latter daies, (wherein wee now liue) there shall bee troublous times: Sathan transforming himselfe into an Angell of light, and false teachers, (workers of deceipt, making semblance to bee the Apostles of Christ) shall haue an outward appearance of piety, and yet denie the mighty power thereof.

Thou didst also foretell
vs, that there shall bee a reuolt and apostasie from pure Doctrine, and that the man of sinne, the sonne of perdition, namely Antichrist, shall then be reuealed. Assist vs therefore (Oh eternall God) that wee (embracing the direction of thy trueth) may shunne and escape all lying Spirts, the efficacie of falsehood and foule error, whatsoeuer apparance it shew it selfe vnto vs in. That wee neuer turning from true faith, or drawne from that soule aime of our saluation, may constantly continue in thy word vnto the ende, and not suffer our selues to bee seduced by any one, either by signes, vertues or lying miracles, or any other trains and deuiles alluring to iniquity.

Grant (O Lord and father of lights,) that we may
neuer be led by euery wind of Doctrine, the subtilties of men, and cunning crafte in false seducing: but roundcircle thine elect in this wicked world, that they may neuer be induced to errour. Shorten the sinfull daies of these perillous times, and (by the breath of thy mouth) destroy lying Antichrist, the Authour of deceite and seducing and make an ende of all, by the comming of thy best beloued Sonne.

Defend vs also from those spirits, which raise vp sects an diuisions, those blood-thirsting woolues, that make no spare of thy flocke, those dispersers of false Doctrine, that drawe disciples after them? who being of a broken and confused sense, doe raise vp nothing but scandals
and diuisions. Deliuer vs from the Darnell, which the enemy soweth, and from all theeues, or murderers of soules.

Aide vs in such sort, that wee listning onely to thy voice, and pursuing the same in heart, with true faith and sincere obedience: thy word may be our certain rule, our touchstone to trie and approue all Doctrines by, that we auoyding all strangers voices, may beare no affection to any other, or shake handes with iniquitie Graunt vs (deare Father) good courage to the end, and in the end, and when Iesus Christ our Lord shall come at the last day, strengthen vs, and let vs neuer be confounded. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for the Euening.
div.p: ETernall God and most gratious father we lift vp our hands to thee, as an euening sacrifice, praysing, blessing, and yeelding thee thanks with our harts, because thou hast so louingly preserued vs this day, and all the whole time of our liues hitherto, by the ministry of thy holy Angels, frō all harmes and annoyances, of bad and wicked spirits.

Wee humbly beseech thee to pardon al our sinnes, and whatsoeuer we haue cōmitted against thy diuine will: that thy blessed Angels abiding this night and euermore by vs: may pitch their campe about vs, watching for vs and our security shielding
mee from the snares, ginnes and deceites of euill spirits, and (wee thy poore creatures) may euer bee defended by thy goodnesse and mercy.

Preserue vs by thy power, for in the night season, will we call vpon thee with our soules, and our spirits shall waite and watch continually for thee. Constantly doe we attend on thy goodnesse, and our soules put their trust in thee the liuing God, because thou art our refuge and faithfull Sauiour.

Behold Lord, whether we wake or sleepe, wee are only thine, whether wee liue or dye, thou art euermore our God, and hee that hath made vs: Therefore we cry vnto thee, desiring that thy grace may neuer be farre off from vs, but that thy buckler
of defence, may alwaies protect vs: be gracious vnto vs, yt we may lie down quietly, sleepe sweetly, & wake againe healthfully. In the euill times, withdraw vs into thy secret dwelling, keepe vs securely within thy Pauilion, and lift vs vp vpon thy rocke, that wee may not bee afraide of any thing.

And although we walke in the vale and shadow of death, yet will wee not feare any mischance: For thou art with vs, thy rod and Shepheards crooke doth continually comfort vs. Giue vs grace, that though our bodies (by sleepe) doe take their naturall rest, that our soules may euermore watch with thee, retaining thee daily in our hearts, and neuer parting from thee in our spirits. Deliuer vs frō
lewde & dishonest dreames, from vnquiet and turbulent slumbers, from vaine cares and cogitations, from dread full & displeasing thoughts and such like offensiue torments. Oh Lord God, into thy holy protection, we commit both our soules and bodies, our Children, Bretheren, Sisters, and all our kindred, alliance, friends and acquaintance. Shaddow vs all this night with thy benignity, inuiron vs round about with thy grace, and in thy mercy so protect vs: that our soules and bodies may be safe, and free from al dangers. So be it.

div.head: Munday.
A Prayer for the Morning.
div.p:
MOst louing GOD and heauenly father, by thy holy Law yu hast appointed to thy people, that euery morning they should offer sacrifice vnto thee, thanking thee for their safe protection. Now therefore at this instant, wee present thee our Sacrifice of Prayse and thankesgiuing
that is to say, the fruite of our lips and hearts together, blessing thy holy name because (by thy great mercy) thou hast preserued vs this night past, from all inconueniences and mischances.

Thou hast kept our soules and bodies, and most Fatherly hast defended them, against the wicked spirit our deadly enemie: For if thou hadst not beene our shield and soule preseruer, infinite mishaps had laide hold vpon vs, and neuer could wee haue risen in safety. By good right therefore ought we to giue thee thankes, for thy most gracious and louing protection.

Againe doe wee cry vnto thee deare Father, euen frō the bottome of our hearts, and present our prayers and supplications vnto thee this morning, humbly intreating
thee, that this day also and euermore hereafter, thou wilt defend vs together with all that are appertaining to vs, from the crafty and subtil policies of Sathan: Deliuering vs from sinne, shame, & dishonour, and al euils whatsoeuer.

Go thou before vs (by thy grace) this morning, for (without thee) wee are able to doe nothing. Assist vs (O Lord God) that this day we may happily begin, and Christianly finish all our actions in thy name, for the glory of thy Diuine Maiestie, and sauing health of our neighbours.

Safe keepe (wee beseech thee) our soules, our spirits, our senses & our thoughts, and so order whatsoeuer we shall doe, or leaue vndone, that the Deuill may haue no power to endanger vs. Deliuer
vs from that euill which offendeth people at mid-day, and preserue vs from all our enemies visible and inuisible: that neither publiquely or priuately they hurte or indanger vs, by their craft, subtilty, coniurations, treacheries, or any other wicked power and mischiefe.

O Lord God, Father and Master of our liues, defend vs also from shamelesse and immodest regards, and destroy in vs al wicked desires not suffering vs to fall either into gluttony, or drunkennesse, theft, or such like sinnes, nor let our hearts be proud or vainely puft vp. Assist vs, that we may plucke out and cast from vs our offensiue eyes, and all those members that would scandalize vs: rooting vp all euill and dishonest desires
out of our hearts, and banishing far from vs, whatsoeuer is to thee displeasing, or to our selues preiudiciall. And grant vs grace, to doe what thou wouldest haue vs doe, and is most behouefull for vs, to the ende that we may serue thee in true faith and feare.

Beholde (O Lord God) here we surrender and commit our selues this day wholly vnto thee, to order and guide our steps by thy will and direction: let vs be to thee an acceptable sacrifice, and our seruice answerable in Iesus Christ our onely Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: A thankesgiuing for our Redemption.
div.p:
LORD Iesus Christ, Sonne of the euer liuing God, that art the
bright splendore of thy Father, and the true stampe of his person engrauen in thee. Thou wert neither made nor created, but begotten of him before all worlds: hauing the same essence and likenesse, in maiesty and glory with him We adore, laud, praise, and honor thee, yeelding thee most humble thanks for all thy blessings: but more especially, because in the fulnesse of time (according to thine owne good will) in the vnity of thy person, thou didst please to take humane nature vpon thee, and wert borne of the euer blessed Virgin Marie.

Oh our deare Lord, when we were lost and condemned, euen then didst thou buy, saue and deliuer vs from sinne, death, and the power of the Diuell: not by any price of gold or siluer
but with thy most holy and precious blood, yea, by thy passion and most innocent death. All which thou didst meerely in charity, fauour & mercy, without any worth or merit at all remaining in vs.

Oh Lord our God, how great was thy loue vnto mankinde, that thou being iust, wouldest die for the wicked and vniust? What charity can bee greater, then for a man to lay downe his life for his friends? But much more didst thou manifest thy most perfect and vnspeakeable loue vnto vs, because thou diedst not, whē we were thy friends: but euen then when wee were wretched sinners and thy mortall enemies.

By thy death didst thou make reconciliation with thy Father, thou diddest appease
his iust anger, and hast cancelled the heauie scrole written against vs. Whatsoeuer consisted in seuere ordinances, and made quite against vs, thou didst fasten to thy Crosse and there vtterly deface it.

Thou didst dispoile the principalities and powers of darkenes, & (as triumphall Trophees therof) didst bring them forth to apparant sight. By thy glorious resurrection from the dead, thou didst also bring backe true righteousnes, innocency, saluation, and eternall life, for vs, and for all such as in their hearts do stedfastly beleeue in thee.

Oh most faithfull Sauiour, suffer not thy dolorous passion to be indignified, or vnworthily regarded, by most poore and miserable sinners: but assist vs with
thy grace, that henceforth wee liue not more to our selues then to thee, that didst suffer so sharpe death and rose againe for vs.

Let vs rise also from our sinnes, to liue onely in thee and for thee. Let vs liue vnder thee in thy kingdome, & serue thee in eternall righteousnes: for thou art ascended vp into heauen, and sittest at the right hand of thy Father, world without end Amen.

div.head: To obtaine true faith.
div.p:
LOrd God most mightie, Father of lights, with whom there is no variation or shaddowe of change at all, from whom also euery good and perfect gift descendeth
downe vpon vs: We humbly beseech thee, (considering that faith consisteth not of all things,) that it would please thee by thy blessed • pirit, to plant and preserue in our hearts, the true knowledge of thy Sonne Iesus Christ, and so to encrease it day by day, that being replenished with the knowledge of thy will, in all wisedome and spirituall vnderstanding: we may walke worthily as it becommeth vs and growe fruitfull in euery good worke, encreasing in faith, being so strengthned by the same, yt it may worke in vs thy glory, in all milde sufferance and patience of spirit.

Giue vs grace answerable to the richnesse of thy goodnesse, that we may bee powerfully fortified in the inward man, and that Christ
may dwell in our hearts by faith. In regard also (O good God) that no man knoweth the Sonne but by thee, and no one can know thee (deare Father) but by the Son, and such vnto whom thou doest reueale him: we humbly intreate thee, that thou wilt draw vs to him, that thereby he may conduct vs to thee: so to obtaine the knowledge of saluation, which (in him) is the full remission of our sinnes.

Strengthen in our faith, whatsoeuer is infirme, though it be much lesse then a graine of mustard seede: make thou it so to increase, that thereby we may be rooted and builded in thee, there to remaine safe without any shaking.

O Lord our God, who hast kindled in vs the sparkes of faith, and there
hast begunne so gracious a good worke, wee cry vnto thee, that it would please thee to perfect & supply the same vnto the end, that wee waxing more and more enriched in all knowledge and experience, and continuing pure, without any reproch: may be filled with the fruits of righteousnes, vnt • ll the day of Christ.
Aduance and maintaine the worke thou hast begun in vs, that our faith may neuer faile in any afflictions or temptations.

But make vs constant in the true christian confession, thereby to attaine to the proposed end o • eternall saluation. Preserue vs (O Lord God) that amidst so many errours, partialities and heresies as are in the world, our soules may neuer be seduced.

Keepe vs from Idolatry supersticion, all false seruice, and likewise from falling into errour, or doubt of any point or Article of our faith. Graunt vs the grace also that the same may neuer die in vs, without workes and vertues: that they being neuer idle, but working and declaring themselues by charitie, we may finally obtaine the true end of faith: namely the saluation of our soules. So be it.

div.head: For the kingdome of God.
div.p:
MErcifull God, all good & most wise, who hast instructed and commanded vs before all other thinges, to seeke thy Kingdome, & the righteousnes thereof: we beseech thee grant vs the grace yt thy sacred word may be sincerely
preached through the whole world. Also that our naturall reasō, may be led as prisner by obedience to faith: in regard, we ought to liue holily as thy children, so that thy Kingdome may come, to be aduanced in and amongst vs, and that many other which as yet, likewise doe not belieue in thy word, may be wonne thereto by our sanctified conuersation.

For we haue beene freely deliuered from the power of darkenes, and brought to the Kingdome of thy beloued Sonne Iesus Christ: in him wee haue redemption by his bloud, and free forgiuenesse of al our sinnes Assist vs therefore (O good God) that wee may euermore abide in thy kingdome by perseuering constantly in pure and sound Doctrine, & walking as becommeth the
〈4 pages missing〉
right equally distributed to euery one: and wee (abiding in safe protection) all things may redound to thy honour and glory, the vtility and prosperity of vs that are Subiects, in all ciuill manners, goodnesse and honesty, and the aduancement and flowrishing estate of the weale publique. So that whatsoeuer we possesse or enioy, may be in safety and assurance, and wee leade a peaceable life in all piety and vertue.

But because the heart of the King, and of all men beside, is in thy hand, to order and dispose them, as best pleaseth thee: we beseech thee (Oh most good and gracious God) that (in mercy) thou wouldest benignely alter the hearts of terrible outragious Tyrants, and inhumaine gouernors. So soften
and asswage them, that they may vndertake no vnnecessary warres: whereby the passage of thy Gospell may be impeached, and peace impaired or distroyed.

Let them neuer torment the poore or miserable, or afflict them by any vniust charges: but giue them consideration, that they themselues haue also a Lord in heauen, who makes no regarde of mens outward apparance, And that they shall one day come to yeeld him an account, of whatsoeuer they haue done heere vpon earth. Assist them O King of Kings, and (in the fauour of thy Sonne Iesus Christ, who is iudge both of the dead and liuing) giue them grace, to be mindfull of thee in all things. So be it.

div.head: For Subiects.
div.p: GOD and most louing Father thou hast apointed to all Subiects, that euery one should obey the Magistrate, that hath command or authority ouer him: cosidering, they doe it not onely for the preuention of punishments, but also for the keeping of a good conscience.

Most heartily wee beseech thee, to giue grace to vs and al subiects, in the true knowledge of this thine owne ordenance, let vs so vnderstand it, that each one of vs (in simplicitie of heart) may be obedient to his ordinary Magistrate, in al things that are not cōtrary to thy word. Let vs honor him, as being holily appointed and placed by thee. Let vs
pray for him, giuing him readily and willingly, whatsoeuer in dutie we stand bound to doo.

Eternall God assist vs, that none of vs either misprise our superiours, or speake euill of them in our heartes: for thou hast named them gods, and placed them thy Lieuetenants, to rule and gouerne vnder thee vpon earth. Therefore all such as rebell against them, doe bring a heauie condemnation on themselues, because therein they resist against thy diuine ordinance.

Giue grace likewise vnto all poore subiects, that they may not bee charged with new exactions, or hard seruitudes, neither oppressed, ouer constrained or dispoiled of their poore meanes, by any violence, extortion or tyranny. But if there be any, that
are afflicted by their Gouernours, either with vniust exactions, or ouer strict commandes: Giue patience (good father) to those poore subiects, and let them support that crosse, as a proofe of their faith and obedience to thee.

Heare Lord their cries and prayers, iudge their cause, and mercifully looke vpon them: euen as sometimes thou hadst like care of the miserable calamitie, and grieuous oppression of the children of Israel, and deliueredst them (at length) by thy owne strong hand, from the most cruell seruitude of hard hearted Pharao.

Mercifull God, preserue vs from Pagane and vnchristian Magistrates, and suffer vs neuer to be subiect vnto strangers, Infidels or Idolaters: that may bee a
scandall to thee, to vs or our posterity, and so procure vs to fall off from thy true religion.

Defend vs also from euery sinfull yoake, that we applie not our members to the seruice of iniquitie, or suffer sinne to haue any rule in our mortall bodies, thereby to haue both body and soule ouercharged: But be thou our fortresse of defence in all our necessities, thorough Iesus Christ our Lord and Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: Against the enemies of Christian Faith.
div.p:
LOrd God, wherefore are the wicked growne furious without any cause? And why doe the mighty mutinie, consulting together
against thee, and thy Sonne Iesus, whom thou hast annointed: O thou that art eternall, how are our enemies encreased? Many lift vp themselues against thy word, to abase and oppresse it (and in stead therof) to aduance their owne abhominable and false Doctrine, euen in thy Church.

They inuent craftie deuises, to confound them that confesse thy truth, their thoughts are set vpon euill doing, they growe great with this trauell: But doe thou disappoint them in their birth-bringing forth, and set them neuer see the end of theie hellish enterprises.

They looke dayly vppon vs as Lyons after their prey, and are desirous to entrappe our soules, they open their
throats like a gaping graue, seeking dayly to swallow vs vp. But Lord doe thou deliuer bs from their intentions: For this peruerse company say in their hearts, that thou hast forgotten vs, and hidest thy countenance from vs, purposing neuer more to looke vpon vs.

Lift vp therefore (Lord) thy powerfull hand, and bee not vnmindfull of thy poore people. Awaken thy selfe, why doest thou sleepe? Come and be present with vs: Oh delay not so long, why shouldest thou turne away thy face, as forgetfull of our miseries and heauie oppressions?

Vp Lord vp, helpe and deliuer vs for thy goodnesse sake, let not our enemies haue any power to hurt vs, nor the wicked any meanes whereby to endanger vs.
Defend vs out of strangers hands, whose religion is vaine, and their workes meerely false: For they will not listen to any instruction, whereby to doe good, and they refuse to respect thee, who art Lord ouer all, neither make they any account of the workes of thy hands. Lord God of Hostes, fight against our offenders, graunt our christian Magistrats victory against the aduersaries of thy name. For conquest commeth from on high, and is not to be wonne by might or multitude: in regard that thou canst saue and defende with a few, when others repose their trust in many Breake therefore the arme of the vngodly, ouerthrowe their enterprises, that they may execute nothing without confusion.

It is meete and conuenient,
that such as hate thee, & hope to exterminate thy heauenly word: should fall backward in their attempts, and flie as chaffe before the winde, thy holy Angell shal smite them a far off, because they shall not glory against thee saying: This our hand and power hath done.
Bee thou therefore (Oh Lord) onely honored vpon earth, and send vs alwaies succor for thine own names sake, least it should bee blamed or blasphemed. So bee it.

div.head: A Prayer for the Euening
div.p:
ALmighty God, the euer-liueing Father of Iesus Christ, we render thee most hartie thankes, because by thy most gracious protection,
thou hast louingly preserued vs all this day past, from any damage, distresse or danger. That fire hath had no power to offend vs nor the waues of water any strength to swallow vs: Sauage beasts haue not deuoured or torne vs, keen-edged weapons haue not wounded or smitten vs, our enemies haue not slaine vs, nor wicked people hurt vs. On the way, theeues and robbers haue not assaulted vs, neither hath sudden death or any euill preuailed against vs.

In briefe, it is by thy great mercy and goodnes, that wee haue escaped all perils of life and body. And therefore (of dutie) wee ought to giue thee most humble thankes, for it is thou that hast kept vs in all our wayes. In
confession of these vnspeakeable graces, wee are bold (deare Lord) to pray vnto thee, that it would please thee, to pardon all our iniquities, whereby in thought, deede or word all this day wee haue sinned against thee. This night likewise and all the time of our liues, defend vs vnder thy mercifull fauour, with all our children kindred friends, and acquaintance: Keep them, and vs from the deceits, and subtilties of Sathan, whereby night and day he labors to entrap vs. Defend vs from the dangerous plagu which walketh in darkenes, and preserue vs from the enemies snares, that follow swiftly to surprise our soules.

Blesse vs from horrid visions, dreadfull dreames
and gastly appaitions, with all other euilles of soule or bodie: For thou hast beene our powerfull defender, our only strength our shade against heate, our feete-guide from falling, our suport and protection from all inconueniences. In briefe, the assurance of me and of vs all consists onely in thee.
Be thou then (O faithfull God) the watchman ouer vs, circle vs with thy safegarde, that the deuill gaine no meanes to endamage vs: For wee haue none other but thou that can saue vs.

Wee lift vp our eyes, only vnto thee, for thence commeth our saluation, our helpe consisteth in the Lord of life, who hath made both heauen and earth. And euen as the eyes of seruants,
doe waite on the hands of their masters, or those of the handmaide, on them of her mistresse, euen so (O eternall God) doe and shall our eyes attend vpon thee, vntill such time as thou please to take pitty vpon vs.

Come neere vnto vs then (deare Lord) in thy compassion, for wee are poore, wretched and miserable: Shew the brightnes of thy louing countenance vpon vs, and lighten our darkenesse, that wee sleepe not in death, or any other danger of body or soule. So be it.

div.head: Tuesday.
A Prayer for the Morning.
div.p:
PRaised be thou (O God) Creator of heauen and earth, blessed be thou (Eternall Father) that onely workest wonders, for euer be thy name sanctified and celebrated. For thou (in thy wisedome) hast Created and distinguished day from night, yea, thou hast ordayned, that so much as the earth containeth, no part thereof shall faile or
perish, because man may safely in the night season receiue his rest, and rise the next day to his labour againe.

Oh omnipotent wisedome, how wonderfull are thy workes? in thy discretion all things are made, & the earth is full of thy rich bounty. Wee ought therefore to render thee most harty thankes (euen from before the Sunne rising) for all thy gratious blessings, and to present our selues before thee, so soone as day light begins to shew it selfe. In regard whereof, at this instant, we magnifie thy holy name because this night thou hast suffered vs to rest and sleepe securely, and hast wakened vs againe with ioy & sound health. Thou hast fatherly defended vs
from the power and malice of the enemie: Now therefore wee beseech thee to imbrace and hugge our soules within thine owne hands, keepe our bodies in good health, according to thy gracious pleasure, preserue vs from all annoyance and damage, and protect vs as the signet vpon thine owne finger.

O our good God, since the houer is now come, and time calleth vs to awake out of the slumber of sinne and all other iniquities, signifying saluation to bee neare vs, the night now past, and cleare day approching: Assist vs now deare Father, that wee may cast aside the workes of darkenesse, and cloath our selues with the armor of light, walking honestly as fitteth day time Not in drunkennesse,
or surfetting, not in dissolutens or chambering, notin dissent • on & enmitie: but as newly reu • sted with faith, and a sanctified conuersation in Iesus Christ our Sauiour.
Lord doe thou awake vs euery morning, open our eares, that with a beleeuing heart, we may listen to thy word, and keepe it in continuall memorie.

Let them also be inclined and attentiue, to the cries and complaints of the poore afflicted, and neuer to for sake them in their necessities. Heare likewise (O God) the voice of our supplications, when we cry vnto thee in all our anguishes, and misconceit not our sighings, in the extremity of our liues.

Let our prayers come before thee early in the morning,
and fill vs with thy graces by the breake of day so shall we reioyce and bee glad in thee all our life time, thorough thy Sonne Iesus Christ our Lord and Sauiour.

div.head: Thankesgiuing for our sactification.
div.p:
O God the holy Ghost, which proceedest frō the Father and the Sonne, being vnited with them in the selfe-same eternitie, power and diuine essence: we praise, adore, laud, gloryfie and thanke thee, from the bottome of our hearts, for all thy great blessings. And principally, because thou hast called and conducted vs, (by thy grace) to be true members of the
Christian faith. Thou hast Communicated thy selfe vnto our soules in holy Baptisme, and pursuest still to compleat thine own good worke in vs: because by the power of our owne proper reason, wee could haue no meanes how to belieue in Iesus Christ, or abilitie else to come vnto him.

We humbly beseech thee that it may please thee to instruct and guide vs in al truth. Nourish and augment firme faith in vs, and grant vs the right vnderstanding of thy word: Sanctifye vs in calling vpon and belieuing in thee granting vs the inward peace of conscience, with a setled consolation, courage and perseuerance.

And because thou art the finger of God, write
thou Iesus Christ within our hearts, assuring vs by thine owne testimony, that thou art our comfort against the feares and infirmities of the flesh. Faithfully defend vs against all accusations of the euill spirit, and confirme vs so against dispaire, that (thorow thy gracious promises) we may be fortified in in faith, because thou art our onely earnest, for inheriting redemption.
Grant vs also true deuotion and zeale in praying, so that in the full assurance and confidence of children, we may cry and call to thee, saying: Abba deare Father.

And because at the Baptisme of our Lord Iesus Christ in Iordane, thou didest shew thy selfe in the forme of a Doue:
Grant vs in heart the true simplicity of Doues, without any gaule or bitternesse, that so receiuing thy holy vnction, the fire of ardent charity may be kindled in vs, euen as in the likenesse of fiery tongues, thou didest descend vpon thine holy Apostels. Renue vs in the inward Man, and make thy word and Sacraments of such efficacie in vs, that wee beeing newly regenerate, may be preserued from all idolatrie, false doctrine, error and heresie.

Clense the impuritie of our vnderstanding, kill and quench in vs all disordinate desires of the flesh, suffer not the affections of sinne to raigne in our bodies: But making thine owne abiding in vs, doe thou beare sway in all our
members, and guide vs to thy true eternall inheritance. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for the obtaining of firme Hope.
div.p: O Lord our God, Creator of heauen and earth, in thee haue we put our trust, let vs neuer bee confounded.

Thou hast beene our hope and confidence from our youth, from our Mothers wombe haue we put our assurance in thee. Fill thou our hearts with ioy and peace in beleeuing, that in the vertue of thy sanctified Spirit (by patience and consolation in the Scriptures) we may plenteously abound in hope, & therin be so surely setled: that no despaire shall take
hold on vs in miseries or afflictions, but we to continue still feruent in Spirit, ioyfull in hope, and patient in all tribulations whatsoeuer.

Let thy word be our sole guide, to the end wee may liue, and neuer see confusion in the least part of our hope. Strengthen vs therin (O Lord) more & more, that continually wee may take delight in thy saluation: For thou art gracious to him that dependeth vpon thee, and to the Soule that longeth after thee.
It is a most precious thing to bee patient, and constantly confident in the Almighties assistance: for he is neuer vnmindfull of the poore, and the hope of the afflicted shall not be lost for euer.

Our forefathers did put
their trust in thee, & were alwayes deliuered, when they called vpon thee, their assurance was in thee, and they were not confounded. Therefore shall our hope bee also in thee, and come life or death, we will neuer flie from thee. Whatsoeuer is in our hearts, wee will declare vnto thee, for thou art the GOD of our hope, there is mercie and redemption in aboundance with thee.

Thy hand is not yet shortned, but of infinite power in assisting: wherefore it is good to trust in the Eternall, and neuer to put any confidence in men. Mischiefe waites on them that trust not in God, or doubts of his certaintie, and on the wicked, that haue no hope at all.

Wretchednesse followes
false and faint hearts, for they doe not beleeue, and therefore they cannot bee comforted. Miserie swallowes vp such as make Shipwracke of patience, for what else in the end shal become of them, but death? Cursed is hee that trusteth in man, yea, in any other Creature, or any of his owne workes: for the hope of the Hipocrite shall perish, his assurance shall be frustrated, and his confidence quaile like the Spiders webbe. O Lord our God, let it be our resolution, that thou only art mercifull, and let our hearts reioyce in nothing else, but that thou wilt euer gladly helpe vs

Confirme this in vs, that we obtaining the hope proposed for vs, and cleauing therto as the sole Anker-hold
of our Soules: Our assurance may rest in thee, perfectly purified, as thou thy selfe art, and finally to receiue in full possession, that which we haue altogether hoped for here. Sobeit.

div.head: To haue true humilitie.
div.p: ALmightie God, the proud hart is an abhomination to thee, and cannot long escape vnpunished: for pride goeth before perdition, and height of spirit runnes before ruine.

O Lord of Hosts, thou hast alwaies reprooued, and finally confounded the proud and arrogant. Thou dispersest the proud in the thoughts of their owne
harts: but giuest grace to the humble, and liftest vp the lowly out of the dust.

Therfore we beseech thee, to giue vs true christian humility, that wee may learne to bee humble, and meek in heart, after the example of our Sauiour Iesus Christ: who being in the forme of God, thought it no robbery to be equall with God, and yet notwithstanding, hee abased himselfe, and tooke vpon him the shape of a seruant.

He was thus deiected to lift vs vp into eternal life, and to leaue vs an example of humiliation: wherefore preserue vs (O God) from all carnall and spirituall pride let it neuer ouer master our hearts, or words, because it is the beginning of all euill.

Arrogancie neuer did any
good, there can nothing but wickednes come thereby, and whosoeuer is addicted thereto, must needs commit many abhominations. O giue vs grace therefore to haue alwaies in remembrance, that wee are but earth: then why should dust and ashes proudly exalt it self? What profit is there in pride, or what auaileth the vanity of riches? they doe all passe away euen as a shadow. Keep vs therefore (O our God) from spirituall pride and presumption, which neuer did good to any one, but hath caused many mischiefes one after another.

Let not vs grow arrogant, or be puffed vp by any of thy blessings bestowed vpon vs, to the end wee abuse them not, or blame them in others. For
we haue nothing as of our selues, but whatsoeuer we enioy, proceedeth from thee. Let no man then grow proud of that, which he hath but receiued.

Assist vs therefore deare Father, that wee may not presume further then wee ought to doe, but shewing our selues modest, we may acknowledge our sinnes, hauing humble, contrite and lowly hearts, which thou neuer didst or wilt dispise.

Preserue vs also from the arrogant, that we may neuer bee the mockery of vainglorious men, or our soules sullied with the despisings of the high minded. But being deliuered from their oppressions, both we and all other may so humble our selues vnder thy mighty hand, that
thou maist exalt vs when thou thinkst it meet time. So be it.

div.head: For such as are M • ried.
div.p: ALmighty god and most mercifull Father, thou hast instituted and ordained mariage, and takest delight, when husband and wife doe loue each other, dwell peaceably together, and (by generation of children) doe increase the world, for enlargement of thy Church, that thy blessed name may be eternally praised.

Therefore wee beseech thee, in regard that Satan is contrary to all thy holie ordinances, opposing himself powerfully against
that sanctified estate, euer pursuing to ouerthrow it: That it would please thee to giue grace to all maried Christians, to take knowledge, that thou art the author of their condition, and to bee also assured in their consciences, that they liue in a good estate, which is acceptable to thee. Also, that therein they may doe thee good seruice, and bee saued, when they cheerfully performe what is required of them, and willingly follow the vocation appointed to them.

Let them alwaies feare thee, and (in concord and kind amity) liue christianly together: that eating their bread in the sweat of their browes, they may bring vp their children in all piety, and support (with equall patience) such afflictions,
as vsually keepe company with that estate. Bridle thou (O Lord) the enemy to mariage, that he endaunger not or destroy this thine own ordinance: by making the married to hate or contemn their condition: or by catching them in his nets thorow incredulity: or by sowing his seed of dissension and enmity between them, when any vnkindnes or crosse accidents happen vnto them, moouing them then to commit adultery, or forsake one another.

Let him not seduce them, to fall into any deadly sin, disgrace or foule offence, or to liue in any dissolute sort, against God and a good conscience, either in quarrels, hatreds or contentions: whereby praier, and other good exercises of piety
may be impeached, thy Church scandalised, and thy holy Spirit displeased.

But mercifull God, let all maried couples, dissenting or disagreeing, be reconciled in thy name, pardoning one another from the bottome of their harts, calling to remembrance, the league and promise which they made before thee, when they contracted holy mariage.

Let them liue together in loue and true loyaltie, hauing thy word in due honor, and diligently to liue thereafter. Let them alwaies hope and trust in thee, whensoeuer they are afflicted, euer honoring and praising thee by their conuersation and praiers: that (according to thy will) they may alwaies be found here in thy seruice, and after
this transitory lifes conclusion, be accompanied in thy kingdome, with all the faithfull that liued in mariage. So be it.

div.head: For Children and Youth.
div.p: MErcifull God and euerliuing Father, thou louest children, and didst command them to be brought into thy presence: because out of the mouthes of babes and sucklings, thou preparest the accomplishment of thine owne praises.

Thou hast also (for the same occasion) commanded, that Children should be brought vp in thy feare and knowledge, a matter no way to bee neglected.
Wherefore in fauour of thine owne deare Sonne, who (for our good) was borne a yong infant, and shedde his most pretious blood on the tree of the Crosse, as well for the least as for the greatest: we beseech thee giue grace to all Fathers and mothers of families, Masters and Mistresses of Schooles or otherwise, to bring vp their children, youth and household carefully, in sound doctrine and knowledge of thy wil, to teach them good sciences all vertue and honesty, for the glory of thy diuine Maiesty, and saluation of their soules. So that euen from their infancy they may learn to know thee their Creator and Redeemer, to feare thee with all their harts, to trust in thee, and to liue according
to thy holy commandements.

Suffer not youth to bee seduced by false doctrine, or seruice that is contrary to thy will, neither by anie vnchristian conuersation: Preserue them from euill companies, drunkennesse, slothfulnesse and vncleannesse, and let them not bee scandalized by lewd examples.

Giue grace to all children and youth, to learne, and be obedient to their fathers, Mothers, Superiors, and Teachers: to receiue instruction from them in simplicity of hart, that they may grow wise in the feare of God.

And because the heart of man is in such sort peruerted, by the fall of our first parents, that the imaginations and thoughts of our
harts, are vile and wicked euen from our very youth: May it please thee, to pluck vp those sinfull weeds in the hearts of youth, that they giue not the bridle ouer boldly to originall sin and corruption, whereby their wills doe wax wandring, giddy and obstinate.

Oh good God, plant in the harts of youth, a reuerend feare of thy name, and that the sanctifying Spirit (which they receiued in holy Baptisme) may guide and lead them to all good: And learning thy word, law, and commandements euen by heart (as it were) like pretious ornaments, they may weare them about their necks, seruing thee in true faith and christian obedience here beneath, till thou take them vp into all eternity. So be it.

div.head: Against the Kingdom of Sathan.
div.p:
LORD Iesus Christ, GOD most gracious, in regard, that the Diu • ll is the Prince of this world, hath a mightie Army for defence of his dwelling, and augments or fortifies his kingdome continually by false doctrine, Idolatry, lies and all other kinds of contagious sins: we beseech thee therefore dere Father, (because thou art stronger then he, and hast vanquished that infernall Goliah, taking his weapons feom him, bringing away his spoiles, and vtterlye weakning his kingdom of darknesse) that henceforth it would likewise please thee, by thine
omnipotent and diuine power, to destroy all the workes of the Diuell, and to keep vs from his cruell kingdome, wherein there is nothing but darknesse, incredulity, vices, sinnes, and all sorts of abhominations.

Lord Iesus Christ, Son of God, that art our true Sampson, our puissant and victorious Prince, by thy death thou hast swallowed vp eternall death in victory, taken his sting from him, destroied hell, deliuered them that were bound in the chaines of darknesse, and hast gotten from the enemy all power and authority.

Giue vs grace wee beseech thee, that we may by true faith continue in thy kingdome, and euen as when wee receiued holy
Baptisme, we bound our selues by oth and obligation, to thee and thy sacred Gospell, renouncing then, & denying the Deuill with all his workes: So strengthen vs to continue still constant in that bond of assurance, for if thou by thy vertue (O God) doe support vs, we shall stand vpright, but if thou withdraw thy hand from vs, wee fall downe flat.

Thou therefore, that camest into the world to saue thy people from their sins: wee call onely vpon thee, for vs and all them, for whom thou hast paied thy most precious bloud: Oh let vs neuer see condemnation. Root vp whatsoeuer sinfull nature first planted and hath since perished in vs, and new stocke the ground againe, with thy
vndecaying graces.

Oh suffer not sinne to raigne in our mortall bodies, thereby to obey his couetous desires, or make our members instruments of iniquitie, so to bee sould as vassailes and slaues to sinne: But let our hearts be vtter enemies to all vnrighteousnesse, that flying from it as from hell, wee may offer our selues wholy to thee, O our God, and bee altogether dedicated to thy diuine seruice. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for the Euening.
div.p:
O Lord and most gracious God holy Father, since day began haue we lifted vp our voices vnto thee calling on thee onely when
we are in any distresse. And now at night also wee remember thy fauour and fidelitie, whereof we haue al day tasted very bounteously.

But at this instant (as best becommeth vs) wee magnifie thy most glorious name, because in thy meere goodnesse, without any deseruing or merit in vs, thou hast fatherly defended vs this day past, from an infinite number of damages and dangers, whereinto we might haue falne, but onely by thee.

For it comes from thine owne most louing kindnesse, that Sathan hath not smiton vs, with sudden and vnprouided death, that we haue not beene consumed by tempests, stormes, thunder and lightnings: that great gustes of whirle
windes haue not torne vs, that the subtill enemie hath not deceiued and destroyed vs, by mingling poysons in our meats and drinkes, or by his other infinite trecheries: But that wee remaine safe in soule and bodie. For all which great graces, now and at all times else we most humbly thanke thee, & pray thee in ye dolorous passion of Iesus Christ, to pardon vs all the faults which wee this day committed against thee and all the whole time of our liues hetherto.

Continue the like care ouer vs (good father) this night and euermore, blesse vs from our deadly aduersary the Deuill, from all terrors and dreadfull accidents of this night, and let vs not be troubled with vain dreames or delusions

Keepe our persons, and all appertaining vnto vs, from all mischances of fire or water, & from all other euills, either of soule or body. Suffer vs to sleepe peacefully, without solicitude or vexation: And that euen in the middest of the most horrid darkenesse, with the eyes of our soules we may dscerne the bright splendor of thy grace clearely shining vpon vs, for thou art the true and very light indeede, clearing all obscurities that can engirt vs.

Lord God, thou art with vs, thou art our Rocke, our Castell, our Protector and Sauiour, of whom alwaies wee remaine assured: yea, thou art our shielde, the horne of our saluation, and our only defence.
Oh euerliuing God, this night we lift vp our hands vnto thee, hast thee to succour and preserue vs that our soule sleepe not in sinne, nor any casualtie happen to our bodies.

Wake vs in time conuenient, that (according to thy good pleasure) in safety wee may see to morrow morning: For thou art hee that keepest our life, and fillest vs, with euery happy blessing, through Iesus Christ our Lord and sole Redeemer. So be it.

div.head: Wednesday.
A Prayer for the Morning.
div.p: OMnipotent & most gracious God, all creatures ought continually to celebrate thy name, and the fethered Foules of the ayre (in their flying vnder heauen) doe that way imploy their paines, singing melodiously euery morning (according to their maner & language) the prayses of thee their Lord and Creator.

We hartily pray thee by the glorious resurrection of Iesus Christ from the dead, that thou wilt yet further defend vs, with all our children kindred & friends from any disaster or euill whatsoeuer. Replenish also our soules this morning with thy mercy, that wee may passe this day in honest contentation, without contradicting thy commandements or falling into any deadly sinne.

Shew vs thy gratious countenance, as a faire cloude in the morning, or like a fresh spreading Rose that throwes his sweete verdure vpon the earth Spread thou likewise on vs the sweete semblance of thy goodnesse, refreshing and chearing our soules when they sit fainting, that wee may willingly and
with courage accomplish thy will. Gouerne vs by thy sanctified spirit, to serue thee, with a good heart, in true righteousnesse and holinesse, which alwaies are most pleasing to thee.
So order and direct vs, that this day wee sinne not presumptuously against thee, neither soile our soules, with carnall couetousnesse, which holdes a shrewde combate against the conscience.
Keepe our lips from euill, and our tongues from talking false or fraudulently: because fond and foolish wordes are vnfitting for Christians, and therefore let them bee farre enough from vs.

Assist vs good Father, that we neither scandalize, blame, iudge, or condemne any person by our wordes
for gladly would we haue a watch before our mouths and a locke of wisedome fastened on our lipps, leas • they should make vs fall suddenly, and our tongue proue to be our ouerthrow.
Giue vs grace (Eternall God) to acknoledge and condemne our owne imperfections, least thou take occasion to iudge vs or display thy rigorous vengeance against vs.
These and all other things, which thy wisdome knowes to be more needefull for vs then wee can either deserue or desire graunt them for thy Sons sake, Iesus Christ our Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: Thankesgiuing for our knowledge in Christ.
div.p:
FAther of Heauen and earth, wee giue thee harty thankes, that not with standing we are poore and contemptible: yet thou hast reuealed thy holy word, and precious Gospel vnto vs, for in them all the riches of wisedome and knowledge is contained, which was hidden from the skilfull and wise men of this world, according to thine owne good will and pleasure. For which and all other thy benefits, continually will I praise thee. Beside deare father thou hast made vs to bee borne of christian parents whereby (next to thine
owne assistance) wee haue beene brought vp in the true faith.

Thou hast lightned the darknesse of our hearts, by the blessed brightnesse of thy glory, thou hast deliuered vs from all false doctrine and idolatry, thereby to make vs sonnes and heires of the promise in Iesus Christ, by his holy Gospell. Where the incomprehensible treasures of thy grace is contained, and laid down as an apparant euidence before vs, imparting plainly that misterious secret, which to former ages was hid and concealed.

Thou hast bestowed on vs all spirituall blessings, in those heauenly benefits which we enioy by Christ: For thou didst respect vs all in him, before the
worlds foundation was laid, and gauest vs knowledge of thy secret will, according to thine own good pleasure, directing it before by him, to the end it might now bee preached, that the time is accomplished.
By him wee heare the word of truth, the sacred Gospell of our saluation, and we haue boldnesse and firme confidence, thorow faith which we enioye in him.

For there is no saluation in any other, or any other name giuen to men, wherby to be saued, but the name of Iesus: who is the way, the truth and life, the doore and entrance into the kingdome of heauen, which he purchased for vs, without any merite or worke in vs, by the sacrifice
of his own body, which (without spot or blemish) is our eternall redemption.

Thou didst rise againe from the dead, and sittest on thy Fathers right hand in heauen, whereby all principalities, power, might, dominion, and whatsoeuer else can be named in the world, remaineth in thee that art once more to come.

Wherfore we beseech thee (O Father of lights) that thou wouldst continue vs euermore, in this true faith and sauing knowledge: For, to know thee aright, and vnderstand thy vertue or power, is the direct rule of eternall life. So be it.

div.head: A Praier to obtaine true Charity.
div.p: LOrd Iesus Christ Sonne of the euer liuing God: mirror bright resplendance of the diuine Maiesty: thou hast loued vs euen to the end, and in most zealous charity didst suffer sharpe death for vs poore sinners vppon the Crosse, by which meanes thou deliueredst vs from eternall death, and gauest vs an example of sincere charity which we ought to exercise one toward another.

We entreat thee (by thine own faithfull promi • es) to warme our heartes with the fire of thy diuine loue: that we may loue thee aboue all things and with
our whole hearts: as being true God with the Father and holy Ghost in one eternall and indiuisible essence. That we keeping thy word and cordially louing one another according to thy new commandement and example: may thereby testifie that we are truly thy disciples, and good Christians, regenerated, not by any corruptible seed, but incorruptible, namely thy liuing word, which abideth eternally.
Let euery faithfull man employ himselfe for others in brotherly charity, and harty faithfulnesse as being members all of one and the same body.

Let this charity in vs be true, without fraud, cunning or hypocrisie: that we loue not one another in tongue and words onely,
but in effectuall workes and truth. Enflame our heartes by thy holy spirit, that imitating thine example, we may loue our very enemies, and doe good, to such as hate or persecute vs, committing (patiently) reuenge of all wrongs into thy hands. O Sonne of God, put farre off from vs all hatred, enuie, rancour, all bitternesse and dishonesty, that the bond of perfection bee not vntied or broken by vs.
Lend vs thy holy helpe, that we may pardon one another, as thou hast pardoned vs and suffer not the Sunne to set on our anger, neither let vs giue any place to the backbiter or slanderer.

Graciously aide vs to serue thee in true faith, which working by charity,
we may remaine alwaies in thee, and thou in vs in such powerfull sort: As neither life nor death, nor Angels, nor principalities, nor powers, nor height, nor depth or any other creature whatsoeuer, may seperate vs from our loue in thee. So be it.

div.head: For the fruits of the Earth.
div.p:
