LORD God Almighty King of Heauen and earth, thou (by thy incomprehensible bountye and goodnesse) dost adorne and fill the earth with all kinds of fruits, for the nourishment both of men and beasts. Wee humbly beseech thee, that (in mercie) it may please thee, to blesse our land the better to
make her bring foorth her fruits.

For of our selues (O Lord) we cannot cause it to yeeld one small graine of any thing, or adde any strength thereto except first thou bestow thy blessing theron. Send vs then such seasons, as are aptest for our fruits, that they may increase and grow to good. Preserue them from haile, tempests, destruction of foules or beasts, or any other annoiances.

Suffer not our grounds to rest in thy displeasure, thereby to continue desert or vnfruitful. Shut not vp the heauens in thine anger, by reason of our sins, that they should appeare as yron towards vs, and the earth be as brasse: But gratiously send vs the euening and mornings raine,
with all other prosperous and fertile seasons, that thou visiting the earth, it may grow great in goodnesse, and be amply euery where inriched.

Lord let wheat and all other graine thriue and prosper: For it is thou that preparest the earth, waterest her hard knots, playnest and laiest euen our fields, and by thy gentle showers, dost loften and giuest successe to our seed.

Crowne this yeer with thy blessings, and let fruitfulnesse attend on thy footsteps: so shall the desertest dwelling yeeld plenty of grasse, and all our coasts bee ingirt with gladnesse: The fields shall be newly apparelled with fayre flocks, and our very vallies couered with wheat, so that euery one shall sing
and reioice.

Gratious God, we commit all our seeds into thy safe keeping, and all the fruits of the earth beside, preserue them from colds, frosts, hailes, yces, snows, winds, heats, droughts, fierce raines, and all other hurtfull times, to the end they may not bee spild or spoild. Keep vs from barrennesse, famine, dearth and such like afflictions. Wee confesse our sinnes before thee, in compunction of heart, wee cry vnto thee (O God) that thou wouldest heare vs from heauen and the place of thy abiding, to pardon the iniquities of thy people.

Oh suffer vs neuer to be vnfurnished of bodilye sustenance, but still bestow thy blessings vpon vs: So in all things (with thanksgiuing)
shall we acknowledge thy power and mercy: yea, we wil sing praises incessantly vnto thee, because thou hast plentifully fed vs both in soule and body, for the maintenance of this life, and that which is euerlasting. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for Sinners.
div.p:
ALmighty God and most gracious Father, that delightest not in the death of a sinner, but rather that he should return from his wicked waies and liue. We pray vnto thee for all those whom the Diuell hath blinded, holding them as captiues in his kingdome, and there liuing in all sorts of sinnes. They are drunke with the fleshly
pleasures of this world, their vnderstanding is filled with darknesse, they are addicted to whoredom and wickednesse, and ouerwhelmed in all kind of filthinesse. Grant them grace that (being withdrawne from the snares of Satan, and reduced to the knowledge of thy heauenly will in those things which concerne the saluation of their soules:) they may confesse their own blindnesse, and the ouer-great iniquities wherewith they were entangled, declaring true and harty repentance therfore.

Eternall God, take from among vs, & vtterly cease idolatry, sorceries, blasphemies, vain and rash othes, and all offences to thy sacred name: as also cōtempt of thy word, disobedience, murders, hatreds, enuying
enmities, adulteries, thefts immodesty, bribery, auarice, vsury, lying, deceiuing, defaming, pride, scorning, gluttony, drunkennesse, and such like wicked sinnes, wherby thy blessed name is blasphemed, yong and simple people scandalized or seduced. Root vp obstinacie out of mens hearts, and such as are stony, soften them by thy sanctifying Spirit.

Giue grace vnto vs all, to sigh and sorrow in soule for our sinnes, that thereby we may come to the true knowledge of our selues, and of thy infinite mercies, which (in meer grace) thou offerest and extendest, to all such as conuert and turne to thee.

Assist vs, (O Lord) that wee (casting off the old man, concerning our present
conuersation, which cannot but bee corrupted, by those couetous desires that daily seduce vs) may contrariwise bee renewed in the spirit of our vnderstanding, and cloathed with the new man, created according to thee (O eternall God) in holinesse and true righteousnes.

Let all vs (deare Father) bee free from lying and falshood, euery one speakeing the truth to his neighbour, because we are members of one another Let him that did steale, steale no more, but rather labor honestly, and performe some good actions with his hands, to the end he may impart thereof to him that hath need. Deare Father, graunt vs these things, and whatsoeuer is profitable, wholsome or
seruing to edification, for our Lord Iesus Christs sake: who liueth and reigneth with thee, in vnitie of the holy spirit true God, world without end. So be it.

div.head: For such as are sicke and diseased.
div.p: GOD, strong & most mighty thy vertue perfects it selfe by infirmitie. Thou art also the strength of all them that put their trust in thee, and an assured defence for all necessities in time conuenient.

Wherefore we pray vnto thee, for all such among vs, as are sicke, who being charged with bodily infirmities, are daily in danger of death. May it it plese thee
therefore, to make thy holy will knowne vnto them, and graunt them grace. to receiue, support and suffer all with patience.

Let thy blessed Spirite cherish and comfort them on their sick beds, and giue ease to those diseases wherwith they are afflicted. According to thy great goodnes, take compassion on them, and in fauour of that dolorous passion which thy deare sonne Iesus Christ endured: pardon all the transgressions, whereby they haue offended thee, and (perhaps) may bee some occasion of this their sickenesse.

Releeue, heale and raise them againe in soule and body, if it be not contrary to thy will or preiudiciall to their eternall saluation, for if thou wilt thou canst
wipe away al their iniquities, because thou art our good Phisition, our Soueraigne assurance: and euen then most willingly helpest, when humaine meanes doe faile and are weakest.

Looke downe from heauen, and consider the miserable condition of all sicke persons, take pitty on them, by thy diuine wisedome, enable them with d • rection and lawfull meanes, for their speediest recouerie.

Aide them with thy strong arme, and restore them to health. But such for whom it is more necessary (according to thy good pleasure) to depart from these miseries, then longer to saile on this vast sea of afflictions: Call them home vnto thee, and continuing
them firme in faith, and constant in holy hope, by a happy ending, bring them to ioy without ending.

Let thy sanctifying Spirite bee neearest to them, when the houre of departing drawes most vpon them, giue them then grace well and willingly to prepare for death: That being prouided of those thinges which thou hast ordained for confirmation of their faith, they may be desirous to dislodge, and to be with thee in company of thine elected children.
Shorten their sufferances and distresses, aid them to ouercome all the anguishes of death, passing thorow them with a christian courage, and then to bee possessed of life euerlasting.

Change their griefe into
such gladn • s, as shall neuer be taken from them. Let earth take their earthly bodies, but receiue thou their soules into thy hands because thou didst create and redeeme them, in Iesus Christ our Lord and Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: Against the temptations of the deuill.
div.p: GOod God & heauenly father we are admonished by thy blessed word, that the olde dragon and subtill Serpent, our aduersary the deuill, runnes about vs like a roaring Lyon, daily seeking to deuour some of vs.

He vseth all his sleights against our soules, with an
infinite number of hellish stratagemes, to make vs fal into sinne or dispaire.

He practiseth to surprise vs: by riches, by pouerty, by voluptuous and wanton pleasure, by greedy desire after honor and worldly dignities, by coueting earthly goodes and possessions: by care for the belly, and prouision therefore, with al other vnrighteous and sinfull affections.

Hee cunningly casts abroad his ginnes & snares, to entangle vs night and day in our wordes or workes: So that wake we or sleepe we, hee is before, or behinde vs, with a wide open throate seeking to swallow vs.

Lord who can escape? for he is continually watching and neuer at rest. We are likewise so fainted by our
owne sinful flesh, as (without thy succour) wee can make no resistance.

Open thou our eyes, that we may comprehend, how mighty and crafty our enemie is. For we are not to •• ght against flesh & blood, • ut against Sathan, who is the Prince of this world therefore (O faithfull God) take pitty vpon vs.
Make vs strong in the power of thine owne strength, put vpon vs thy defensiue armour, to resist manfully against the ambuscadoes, & tantelous deuises of the Deuill.

Giue vs thy weapons, gird our raines with the girdle of truth, put on our brests the brest plates of righteousnes, let our feete be shod with Euangelicall peace, and (aboue all things) let our heartes bee
defended with the shield of faith: So shall we bee sure to quench al the fiery darts of the Diuill. Alwaies prouided, that our heads be couered with the Helmet of saluation, and our handes hold fast the sword of the Spirit, which is thy most holy and neuer failing word.
By these meanes wee shall be enabled to doe any thing, and valiantly (through thy aide) vanquish the Deuill our aduersarie: For (in thy very name) wee shall strongly withstand him.

Bee thou but our succour, and no feare can assault vs, stand thou but by vs, and though the world should bee ouer-whelmed, and the Mountaines tumbled into the middest of the Sea, yet safety shall circle
vs, for thou art our assistance, that liuest and raignest eternally. Amen.

div.head: A Prayer for the Euening.
div.p: BLessed Trinitye, Father, Sonne, and holy Ghost, thou art our life, sauing health, and euerlasting comfort: we praise and render thanks to thee, both with mouth and heart, because (all this day) thou hast in mercy most louingly neuer left vs.

Let vs entreat thee, in thine vnspeakable goodnesse, to couer all our iniquities: more especially those which this day wee haue committed against thee and thy holy commandements: either by
our tongues, in vttering vaine and offensiue speeches against our neighbors or transgressing in any other sinfull manner.

May it please thee to preserue vs this night en • uing from all damage and danger bodily or ghostly: For our confidence is only in thee, thou art our Lord and God, we commit both body and soule into thy hands.

That thy diuine Maiesty may blesse vs, the holy Trinity defend vs, the eternall vnity sustaine vs, thy infinite mercie preserue vs, thine vnspeakable benignity blesse vs, thine endlesse sweetnesse support vs, the high truth of God shadow vs, the bottomlesse knowledge of Christ strengthen vs, and the incomprehensible goodnesse
of the Lord keep vs. That the grace of the Father may gouerne vs, the wisedome of the Sonne restore vs, the vertue of the holy Ghost lighten vs: our Creator still to assist vs: our Redeemer to saue vs: and our holy comforter neuer to forsake vs.
Eternall God, let thy louing contenance shine vpon vs: thy good graces be alwaies with vs: thy peace be propitious for vs: and thy louing kindnesse euer liue with vs.

Let this our inuocation vpon thee the only and euerliuing God, stand between vs and our aduersaries visible and inuisible: that they neuer may come neere vs, or haue any power to hurt or offend vs. Be thou a wall of fire, seperating vs from all our
enemies, to keep them off from touching vs: euen as the piller of the cloude did set it selfe in the wildernes betweene the Egyptians army and the campe of the Israelites, to the end they might not come neere one another, nor the children of Israel be any way endangered.

Protect vs also at the ending of our daies, when our eies can see no more, our eares heare, our tongues speake, our hands feele, nor our feet walke: Assist vs then O sacred Trinity that the diuel our enemy neuer preuaile against vs. So be it.

div.head: Thursday.
A Prayer for the Morning.
div.p: LORD Iesus Christ that art the true eternal light: ouercomming the nights darknesse: and the shadowes of death: wee laud thy name, celebrate and yeeld thee most harty thanks, because thou hast so blessedly kept vs this night, and hast brought vs thorow darknesse to behold bright day.

Thou hast preserued vs
from the terrors of the night: from the fearefull threatnings and illusions of Sathan: from the dangerous pestilence which walkes in the shades and darknesse of night, and from many other contagious diseases, wherewith we might haue been assailed and surprised.

Thy shield hath round ingirt our soules, and thou hast watched ouer vs as a good shepheard doth ouer his flocke: thy great mercy also hath preserued safe and sound all that we doe possesse. Thy name for euer be praised honored and exalted, not only for so louingly defending vs, but for infinite other benefits beside, which wee day by day doe receiue from thy liberall bounty. We will speake of thy power, and
magnifie thy mercy euery mouring: for thou art our principall assurance, our inuincible fortresse, our strong defender and our faithfull. God in whom we only put our trust: thou fillest our harts with gladnesse and makest vs to haue a cheerefull countenance.

We beseech thee (O Son of God) by thy holy natiuity, and because it pleased thee, to receiue our humane nature in the vnity of thy person: that thou wouldst let thy mercy lighten on vs this day as the dawning of the morning, when it begins to appeare bright and cleere, and rain down thy blessings vpon vs, like the spring-time showers. Illuminate our blinded nature with thy splendor and our darkned
vnderstanding with thy bright beames of mercy: that thou maiest shine in our soules like the cleere morning starre, and the light that leades men into eternall life.

Protect vs this day from all euill whatsoeuer and Lord be fauourable vn to vs, for wee rely vpon none but thee, our soules waite on thee this morning and alwaies as our onely deliuerer and defender in all times of tribulation.

Preserue our bodies and soules that no euill come neere vs, or any wounds light vpon vs. Keepe the infernall fiend far off from vs, let not the wicked touch vs. Stand betweene vs and the euill doers and let our enemies haue no dominion ouer vs.

O Lord our God, prosper
the workes of our hands, teach our hearts thy obedience, and our fingers thy commandements that this day wee fall into no sin against thee. Graunt vs these graces for thy mercies sake, which is perpetuall and neuer hath ending. So be it.

div.head: Thankesgiuing for the nourishment of our bodies.
div.p: KING of glory Lord of heauen and earth, wee humbly thanke thee, because most fatherly thou hast fed vs from our infancy, euen vntill this time, aboundantly furnishing vs euery day with meates, drinkes, garments and whasoeuer is necessary for the maintenance of this life.
For wee issued forth of our mothers wombs, and came starke naked into the world, miserable and full of many necessities, but thou didst prouide vs all things needfull.

O Lord our God, great are thy maruailes, none is like vnto thee: We will declare and speake of thy workes, although they are not to be numbred. Wee ought not to bee silent, or conceale thy praises, but to recount thy goodnesse to our Childrens Children, and to speake of thy faithfulnes to such as shall succeede vs, euen so long as the world shall endure.

Wee beseech thee that hereafter thou wilt not forsake vs, but giue vs bread to feed vs, and raiment to couer vs, for thou knowest what need we haue of thy
blessings, for maintenance of our liues, considering, that of our selues, we haue nothing. But when thou giuest we receiue them, and when thou openest thy hands, euery thing liuing is filled with thy blessings. Giue vs grace, that by sin we misu • e not thy giftes, that wee attempt not beyond measure, nor suffer our hearts to bee charged with gluttony, drunkenes, and the cares of this life: And so become slaues to ritches, fall headlong into the snares & temptations of sathan, with many other dangerous desires, that plunge men suddenly into perdition.

Keepe vs from couetousnes, the roote of all euill, let vs hold firme footing, and neuer fall from thy faith, so to bee shut vp in
endlesse sorrowes.

O good God, assist vs, that wee may cast all our care vpon thee, and haue recourie to thee in all necessities: As to our louing Father, which art in heauen, from whence thou giuest vs our dayly bread, and all thy other good blessings beside, thorough Iesus Christ our Lord and Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: To haue vnitie in Faith.
div.p:
MErcifull God, thou hast called • s to an especi
• ll hope of our vocation. For as there is no other but one Lord, one faith, one Bapt • sme, one God and Father of vs all, euen as thou art (O Father) one
with thy deare Sonne and the holy Ghost: so ought we all to be vnited in thee.

Wherefore we pray vnto thee to knit together the hearts of all the faithfull, that they may be all of one affection in thee, and feele one comfort among them from thee in Iesus Christ, and in the vnion of true faith. Maintaine vs in true vnderstanding of the holy Scriptures, that wee may nourish no opinions or partialities: but vse the same words in the same sense: being of one consent and carefull to keep the vnity of the spirit, by the bond of peace: that thereby our harts may meete in charity, euen vntill we all meete together in the last vnity of perfect faith and finall knowledge of thy dearely beloued Sonne,
who is the only head of the Church.

It is also hee that assembles all bodies in one, that (as his liuing members) we should cleaue one to another, euery one lending a hand to his neighbour, to doe him seruice, according to the gifts and graces which haue been done vnto vs.

Suffer not among vs, a diuersity in opinion and vnderstāding of thy word, thereby to raise pernitious sects and diuisions: Neither let vs do any thing for priuate contention, or vain glory, as despisers and haters one of another.

Put far off from vs all carnall zeale, enuy, malice, pride and curiosity in foolish and vnprofitable questions: which engender nothing but debates, and
giue occasion also of cont • ntio • s, whereby wee grow to back biting, and euen eating vp (as it were) one of •• other. Hinder the 〈◊〉 power, and all the po ••• ies of th • pe • uerse, which desire to breake the bonds of concord.

O Lord our God, grant that all such as are wanderers from the truth, and are of a broken sense or vnderstanding, being led by errors, diuisions and heresies: may attaine to knowledge and returne to the right way.
Keepe vs from confused and troublesome spirits, that thy Church may not be offended, and simple innocents scandalised or seduced by sweet speeches of the proud and arrogant.

Aide vs O God, Father of our Lord Iesus Christ,
to praise, loue and laude thee, with one consent both of mouth and mind. Amen.

div.head: For Peace.
div.p: GRatious God and mercifull Father, thou art the God of peace, thou louest it, and from thee commeth all concord: Therefore we pray vnto thee, to blesse, maintaine and defend all Christendome against thy enemies and blood-thirsting people, that it being preserued in peace and quietnes, we may alwaies serue thee in safety, ioy, purenesse of doctrine, and holy conuersation.

Giue grace, that all the Potentates and Rulers of Christendome, may liue
peacefully together in piety and honesty: So that good maners, order and ciuill policie bee not impeached or peruerted, Churches and Schooles of learning ruined, and Kingdomes destroied, or made miserably desolate.

Let euery one be contented with his own, and suffer not any to couer or desire countries and people, which no way appertaine vnto them: either thorow auarice, pride, appetite of vaine glory, curiosity, enmity, enuy, or by any such like causes, to raise wars, troubles or seditions in their owne Kingdomes. Preserue vs from dissentions and effusiōs of blood, ouerthrow all euill counsells and malecontented medlers, whose harts can fasten vpon no goodnesse:
Let confusion follow their enterprises, their consultations begin in sorow, and end in feare and shame.
Let thy arme be aduanced in our defence, seeing thy name is honored among vs, and suffer not thy heritage to be wasted.

Assist thy faithfull that put their trust in thee, and call earnestly vpon thee. Answer vs in the day of our distresse, and let thy name be our support: send succor from thy holy place, and euermore strengthen vs.

Be good to countries and Citties wherein thy blessed word is embraced: Let peace dwell within their walls, prosperity and plenty within their palaces. O good God, encline the harts of all men to loue peace and vnity, chiefely
those, whom thou hast called by thy word and Gospell.

If there doe happen any trouble or dissention among any people: do thou so prouide, that (by good meanes) it may be quickly appeased, for the glorie of thy names sake, the aduancement of thy word, and the saluation of all Christians. So that poore countries may reioyce in thee, and glorifie thy name: Because thou art hee that onely workest wonders, and dost manifest thy power vpon all nations. So be it.

div.head: For Infidels and wanderers from faith.
div.p: LOrd and Father euerlasting, wee pray vnto thee in thy dearely beloued Sonnes name Iesus Christ our Sauiour, that it would please thee to take compassion on al Infidels and vnbeleeuers, in what place, or of what condition soeuer they be, that wander as yet in darknes without any light of thy holy Gospell.

The Diuell hath smitten them with blindnes, detaining them (with hardned har • s) in obscurity, through ignoraunce remaining in them, they are meer strangers to life, which life (O Eternall God) thou thy selfe art. They run after
dumb Idolls, euen according as they are ledde, and (thorow their misbeliefe) blame and blaspheme thy deare Sonne Christ Iesus the only throne of grace.

Wherefore O faithfull God, take away from vnbeleeuing Iewes, the couerture that lies vpon their hearts, making them to offend against the stumbling stone, and rocke of contempt. Illuminat their eyes, that they may see and acknowledge the true Messias, the Sauiour of the whole world.

Call home all Paganes and Infidels to thy true sheepefolde. Such as holde thy word for folly, assemble them with Christians, and the communion of thy Saints: That they may honour, praise, and pray with vs and all the faithful
to the Father and Sonne, and to the Sonne with the Father and holy Ghost, one true God and Lord euerlasting.
Open the vnderstanding of all them, that repose not confidence for their saluation, vpon the true foundation & corner stone Iesus Christ.

Let them know him whom thou hast sent, and (in firme faith and beliefe) receiue him for th • ir Lord and redeemer: Who by his obedience fulfilled the law, and by most greeuous death, purchased our eternall redemption.

Let it please thee also good Father, to bring back into the way of thy true word, al such as haue straied from Christian faith, erring in some certaine points, by being possessed
with false Doctrine. Most merciful God, take pitty on them that are not in true religion, but doe sit in the shaddow of death, and walke euill waies, according to the blindnesse of their sense.
Seeke them that are lost, gather them that haue straied, lighten them that are in darkenesse. Open the eares of the deaffe, the mouthes of the dumbe, and al such as haue not knowne thee.

Strengthen them that stand, restore such as haue falne, seeke all the scattered, and assemble the dispersed: Finally, in this life make vs all of one faith, and fellowes of one inheritance in the Kingdome of Heauen. So be it,

div.head: For our Benefactours
div.p:
O Lord our god because wee vnderstand by thy holy word that thou holdest all ingratitude in detestation, and punishment shall neuer depart from the house of the vnthankefull. In regard also, that the hope of the ingrate, shall suddenly melt it selfe, like yee before the beames of the Sunne, and glide away like water, that bringes no profit with it: We humbly beseech thee, to grant vs grace, that at al • times, and from the depth of our hearts, wee may acknowledge and thanke th • e for all thy benefits: and that wee may neuer be vnthankefull toward
such as haue done vs any good, least we fall into thy iudgement and iust vengeance. Wee render thee thankes (O Lord and omnipotent Father) for thou art most benigne, thy mercy endureth for euer, thou art faithfull and keepest promise to a thousand generations. To thee O God, King eternal, immortall inuisible, and onely wise, be al honour and glory for euermore.

We direct our prayers also vnto thee, for all those that haue holpen, nourished or brought vs vp, from our infancy, that haue taught, corrected, instructed, and done good to vs, either by wordes or works.

More especially wee pray to thee for all those for whom wee stand most
obliged to entreate thee, of whom (very well) thou knowest the names, and their condition. O good God, we humbly commend them all vnto thee, to blesse them in body and soule, while they abide heere beneath, and afterward to crowne them in thine eternall Kingdome.

Assist vs with thy grace and blessings, that (in due time) we may some way recompence their good turnes. If not to them, yet to their children. And that, as we haue receiued benefits, so we may likewise (to our power) bee beneficiall and seruiceable to others: that our leaues do not wither, or our selues be pluck • vp like vnprofitable trees, which carries no fruit, and fittes nothing but the fire.
Let not the ingratitude of others be hurtfull to vs, thereby to become slothfull and negligent, in doing good to all men, but especially to the houshold of faith.

And because thou art so gracious, O heauenly Father, as to let thy Sunne shine both on good and bad, and the raine to fall both on iust and vniust: Giue vs grace, to imitate this thine example of mildnesse: thereby to testifie, that we are truely thy children, and in our dooing good, we may stoppe the mouthes of ignorant and foolish men.

And that it may bee done in such sort, as thy sacred name shall neuer bee prophaned, but sanctified by vs and ours: For thou liuest and raignest our true
Omnipotent God, world without end So be it.

div.head: Against the temptations of the world.
div.p: ETernall GOD and heauenly father, there is (alas) no thing 〈…〉 no in this world, whatsoeuer is therein, is nothing else but desire of the flesh, concupiscence of the eyes, and pride of life: the whole world is swallowed vp in wickednes, and is filled with sinnes or scandalls.

Wherefore wee pray thee, to turne vs from all earthly occasions, and let our desires be onely to thee that we be not abused by the world, nor lincked in affection thereto or any thing therein: because the
world and whatsoeuer it containes must passe away.

Assist vs that wee bee not offended by the wicked examples of the peruerse, which it grieues vs dayly to behold: neither let vs enter at the wide gate, or walke the broad way, whereby the world marcheth, which leadeth to eternall ruine and distruction.

O gracious God, thou hast raised and seuered vs from the world, to the end, that our affections should not dwell on earth. But rather the conuersation of our spirit to be in heauen, seeking those things which are aboue, and not here belowe on earth. Giue vs grace, neuer to conforme ourselues to this world, or walke after his steps: But that we may bee changed,
by the renuing of our vnderstanding, to approue intirely & perfectly, what thy heauenly will is, and so become agreeable therto with our whole heart, walking on wisely redeeming the time.

Let vs neuer bee sundred from thee, by loue or hatred, fauour or disfauour of the world: but let the world bee crucified to vs, and we also to the world, that renouncing and abstayning from all the desires and filthinesse thereof, wee may be thoroughly dead thereto. When the world doth hate or persecute vs, lift vs vp (O God) with thy right hand, that we be not discouraged, or become impatient, For the world held thy deare Sonne Iesus Christ in hatred, long before vs, therefore
let his example comfort vs, and settle our assurance neuer to bee of this world.

Mercifull God, helpe vs altogether, that we forsaking incredulitie & worldly affections: may liue soberly, iustly, and religiously, attending in blessed hope, the glorious comming of our Lord and Sauiour Iesus Christ: who gaue himselfe for vs, that we might be redeemed and purified from all iniquitie, and be a peculiar people to himselfe, and carefull in the accomplishing of all good workes. So be it.

div.head: A prayer for the Euening.
div.p: PRaysed be God the Father, by Iesus Christ with the holy Ghost, the only true eternall God, who of his great goodnesse, notwithstanding we are poore miserable sinners, hath most louingly preserued vs this whole day, from al the fiery darts of the Diuell, wherewith continually he wanders about. Also hee hath kept vs from all contagious diseases, which destroy at mid-day, from sudden death and all other inconueniences.

Thou art mercifull, and all thy workes are worthy to be praysed, therfore (most gracious God)
we beseech thee to forget and forgiue, whatsoeuer we haue this day committed against thee, in workes wordes or thoughts.

Stretch forth thy mercy againe ouer vs, and graunt vs quiet rest and sleepe this night approching: that we may neuer be forsaken of thee, because thou art the euerlasting rest. By faith then let vs abide in thee, and remaine in assurance vnder thy protection, that the wicked spirit haue no power to come nea • e vs, or presume any way to feare or affright vs.

Eternall God thou art our continuall light and saluation, what then shall we doubt? Thou art the strength of our life, who then shall dismay vs? Our hearts repose themselues
on thee, and dreades no danger, for thou art our comfort, and alone defender. Confirme thy grace in vs, let thy right hand holde vs, and thy strong arme for euer bee our refuge.

Beholde O our God, early in the morning did we crie vnto thee, and thou didst answere, now at night also will wee not cease, but lift vp our voices for thou wilt heare vs, when we lay vs downe in our heds, we are mindfull of thee, and when wee awake, we speake in heart to thee: because thou art our aide, and vnder the shadow of thy wings will wee reioyce. Our soules draw neere vnto thee, thy right hand holds vs from falling, and when the dark night shall ouer-shadow
vs, yet thou (being Eternall) art the light of our saluation.

O good God grant vs grace, that when the houre of our departing approcheth, and we must be laide in the bed of death, for euerlasting repose: that yet (through thine assistance) we may happilie sleepe in true and firme faith, and wake againe afterward to life eternall. In the meane while, bee mercifull vnto vs, that wee may bee alwaies watchfull, liuing modestly and soberly, in a true Christian preparation because we know not whē the houre of thy comming will be, or when thou wilt take vs henceto thee. Make vs then worthy to stand before thy Sonne, and in iudgement let vs neuer be confounded. So be it.

div.head: Fryday.
A Prayer for the Morning.
div.p:
PRaise be giuen to thee, O God our Creator, Sauiour and comforter, that giuest vs life, health and benediction. Thou art our support and protector, thou hast preserued vs this passed night by thy great mercy, from many secret attempts of Satan, & sound, and safely hast brought vs to behold this day. Heauenly Father, wee beseech
thee by those bitter anguishes, wherein the very sweat of Iesus Christ thy deare Sonne, falling on the ground, became like knotted clods of earth: that this day thou wilt receiue vs into thy safeguard, defending vs both without and within, that no maner of euill happen vnto vs.

For into thy hands, both now and euer, wee commend and commit our poore soules, our miserable bodies, our life subiected to many necessities, our senses, our reason, our vnderstanding, our enterprises, our thoughts, words and works. In briefe, all our affaires, our entrance and issue, our going foorth and returning back again, our disposing of any thing, either walking, sitting, or lying downe, our will,
counsell, deliberation, faith confession, and whatsoeuer is within or without vs, the ending of our life, the day and hour of our death: yea, our death and resurrection, O our Lord God, doe thou with vs in all these, euen as thou wilt, knowing them best for thine owne honour, and our saluation.

Keepe vs in thy faith, feare and true knowledge, presetue vs from the workes of iniquity. And if (thorow infirmity) we fall into sinne: yet do not thou withdraw thy mercy from vs, or turne away thy comfortable countenance, least we perish: by being vnprouided of thine assistance.

For there is no other God and Sauiour but thou, there was none before
thee, neither shall bee any after thee, thou art the first and the last, the beginning and ending: Therefore we cry and call onely to thee, to haue thy blessed spirit alwaies with vs.

Guide thou our feete in thy right pathes, least wee walke after the counsell of the wicked, or tread in the waies of sinners, or sit in the chaire of the scornefull. Let our delight be only in thy word and commandements, therein to exercise our selues day and night, thorow our Lord Iesus Christ. So be it.

div.head: Thanksgiuing for the Passion of Christ.
div.p:
LOrd Iesus Christ true GOD and man, we render thee most hearty
thanks, that wee beeing poore wretched sinners, and subiected to damnation: yet it pleased thee in mercy (without any work, worth, or merit in vs) to redeeme vs by thy blessed passion, death, and bloodshedding.
O Lord Iesus, thy sufferings were most grieuous thy paines intollerable, thy torments multiplied, thy wounds made deepe, thy death most bitter and dolorous.

Great was that loue, whereby thou didst yeelde to appease thy Fathers wrath towards vs: when on the mount of Oliues, the extreame agonies of death did enforce a bloody sweat, which fell from thy amiable face, in greate drops vppon the ground. Alasse, deare Lord, thou
wert forsaken of all thy disciples, and willingly didst thou deliuer thy selfe (for vs) into the hands of the hard hearted Iewes: who most cruelly bound thee, and then (without any mercy) ledd thee from one wicked Iudge to another, where thou wert falsly accused, condemned, spet vppon, mocked and buffeted.

Thou wast wounded for our iniquities, and by the burden of our sinnes, wert beaten, whipped, crowned with thornes, and most miserably handled: resembling rather the true shape of wretchednes, then the glorious figure of a man.

For thou wast made most contemptible, despised, burdened with dolors and disgraces, and that in
such sort, as the heart of a very Pagane was moued to compassion, saying: Behold, what maner of man is this?
For our transgressions, thou wert reckoned among malefactors, and hanged betweene two of them, as a thing accurssed, hauing thy hands and feet pearced thorow with nailes.

Moreouer, in thy extreme drought, they gaue thee vineger and gaule to drinke, and thou didst render vp thy spirit in most woefull anguishes: only to satisfie for our offences, and that (in thy wounds) our sicke soules might be healed.

Wee render thee praise and thanks, from the bottome of our heartes, for these sufferings, and all other paines by thee endured,
beseeching thee neuer to permit, that thy holy and most bitter passion, may be as lost on our behalfe: But rather that we may make our glory therin, as hauing no other true comfort in the world beside.
Let vs consider and meditate thereon in such sort, that all wicked desires may bee quailde or quenched in vs. And contrariwise, all vertuous and good deliberations there deeply grounded.

Let such encrease arise thereby to vs and ours, that dying to sinne, wee may liue to righteousnes, following the trackes of our fore-leaders footing: supporting euery iniurie with patience, and suffering all outrages with a good conscience. So be it.

div.head: A Praier to haue true repentance.
div.p: O God most pittifull and mercifull, thou art patient, exceeding in kindnesse and fidelity. Thou callest vs dayly by the gracious preaching of thy word, to a Christian conuersation, proclaiming in thine owne name, repentance and remission of sins to all people and nations.

Thou hast been yet more patient with vs, by thy long forbearance and vnspeakable mercy, deferring to deale with sinners suddenly, or to punish them in thine indignation (according to thy iust iudgement) so soone as their transgressions are committed.
But thou hast giuen them leisure for their conuersion, so that no one can take occasion (any way) to complaine of thee: because it is no part of thy will, that any one should perish, but rather (by repentanc (e hee should conuert and haue eternall life.

O good GOD, thou knowest what the slownesse of our flesh is, as also the dulnesse of our harts: for we are become so corrupt in our nature, and falne so farre downe into the depth of sinne, that we are no way able (of our selues) to get backe or bee holpen. Wherefore we beseeche thee, in the wide wounds of our Lord and Sauiour Iesus Christ, to conuert vs vnto thee, and wee shal bee conuerted, heale vs, O Lord, and we
shall be healed, raise vs by thy hand, and we shall bee raised. Behold, wee are as scattered or lost sheep, seek after vs good shepheard, for wee are thy wandring, disobedient seruants, let vs neuer more bee vnmindfull of thy commandements.
Circumcise the foreskin of our hearts, cleanse vs from our sinnes, that wee may bee cleane, wash vs, and wee shall bee whiter then snow.
Create a newe heart within each of vs, and a spirit of assurance. Cast vs not away out of thy presence, neither take thy sanctified spirit from vs.

Look vpon vs (O God) as thou didst behold Marie Magdalen that penitent sinfull woman, when shee lay at thy feete, bitterly
mourning for her sinnes: Or as on the Publicane, that fell on his face in the Temple, beating his breast, and begging thy mercy.

Grant vs true contrition, and hearty sorrow in soule for our sinnes, make our faith stable, and giue vs firme confidence, to apprehend and lay hold on thy graces, and to bring foorth fruits worthy of repentance.

Assist vs, to acknowledge the time of our visitation, that we may not misprise the riches of thy graces: that wee neglect not the acceptable time, or day of saluation: that we be not slow in conuerting to thee our Lord and God neither put off our repentance from day to day. But that euen this verie
day, nay, this instant houre, and hence forward: we may repent and amend thorow Iesus Christ our only Redeemer. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer to haue patience in all times of tribulation.
div.p:
ALmightie God and louing Father, thou art the strength of the weake, the health of the sicke, the support of the miserable, the consolation of the afflicted, the ioy of the desolate, the refuge of the forsaken: the aide of such as are tempted: the life of the dying: and the God of patience and all comfort. Thou knowest, that by nature we are infirme, feeble, and of slender ability: So that we cannot
vndergoe any tribulation, without thy helpe and diuine assistance.

Therefore, whensoeuer thou visitest vs with sicknesse, or any other aduersity: wee haue recourse to none but thee. Entreating, that it would please thee, to make vs continue firme in faith, and constant in patience: that we may endure thy hand and fatherly visitations, with a patient heart and peaceable spirit.

Giue vs patience, for we haue great need thereof in times of affliction: to the end we may doe thy will, and receiue thy promise. Teach vs, O God, to be quiet in thy presence, when any aduersities doe come vpon vs.

Let vs esteeme or reckon tribulations, not to
be as signes of thy displeasure, neither let vs murmure in heart against thee or be any way impatient. Let vs acknowledge and confesse (O Lord) that such as thou louest, thou dost chastise for their amendment: Because tribulation produceth patience, patience proofe, proofe hope, and hope can neuer bee confounded.

Blessed is he (O God) whom thou dost chastise, for none ought to refuse the chastisements of the Almighty. Because thou makest the soare, and hindest it vp againe: thou woundest, and thy right hand healeth, thou deliuerest vs from six tribulations, and in the seuenth no euill shall touch vs.

Helpe vs then (O eternall and mercifull God) to
possesse our soules with patience, and to continue constant in hope, so that in the boldnesse of children, we may acknowledge thee our euerlasting Father, and remember the heauie burden thou didst beare for vs, vpon thy glorious Crosse.

Grant that we may be fortified in all strength, according to the greatnesse of thy glory, and that wee may perseuere in all sufferings, with a contented, patient and ioyfull spirit, rendring thee thankes in all necessities whatsoeuer. That suffering here beneath with our Master Christ, both we and all others may bee lifted vp with him into eternall glory. So be it.

div.head: For weomen great with child.
div.p: MOste mightie and euerliuing God, who in thy eternall wisedom, didst appoint, that weomen should bring foorth children in paine and trauaile. We pray vnto thee, that thou wouldst suffer such to know (as either are great with child, or neere their time of trauaile) thy holy and blessed will, that they may support with patience their dolors and distresses.

May it please thee also, to change their heauinesse into ioy: graunting them grace, with comfort to see the fruit of their trauaile, and to conquer their bitter
paines and anguishes with ioye, that a humane creature is borne into the world.
Help then (O most merciful God) both the mother and child, for without thy succour (whatsoeuer can else be done) all i • but in vaine: although the whole world were present there.

Vouchsafe that their children may come into the world aliue, healthfull, vnbrused, and without any defect or imperfection. Hinder the Diuell, who labours so much as he can that no child should come liuing into the world, because they may proue no enemies to his kingdome.

Preserue all Christian weomen trauelling with child, that their births bee not abortiue, or they bee terrified by the sight of anie
hideous shapes.
Bee gratious likewise to yong children, that after their naturall natiuity, they may receiue holie Baptisme, bee made new Creatures in Iesus Christ and ordained for the life eternall.

Bee mercifull to them that lie in childbed, or giue sucke, that hauing recouered their weakned strēgth, and being restored againe to perfect health: They may only praise thee therfore, as beeing that God, that hath beene their sole defender and helper, learning alwaies to put their trust in thee, who art euermore neare to them that truly call vpon thee.

But if (by thy permission, or secret and incomprehensible will) some disaster do happen in the childbirth:
Giue grace to the Father, Mother, and kindred, to endure with patience that heauye crosse, and not to distrust therefore thy mercy. But rather to receiue and entertaine it, as a triall of their faith and patience, holding and acknowledging thee alwaies, for their most gracious God, ready to pardon sinners: and that in midst of thine anger, euer thou remembrest mercie. For when thou afflictest any one, soone after thou makest him or her to reioice again. Because grace is alwaies found after chastisement, thorow the merites of Iesus Christ our Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: For Prisoners and Captaines.
div.p: ETernall & most mercifull Father, thou art the God of heauen, and Gouernour in all Kingdoms. Might and Maiesty is in thy hand, and there is none that can resist against thee. Wee humbly pray vnto thee, for all such as are Prisoners, either for the truth of thy holy word, or otherwise are detained as captiues, vnder the Turke, and such like Infidells, gricuouslie tormented, charged and oppressed with most painfull seruitude.

May it please thee to comforte them with thy blessed Spirit, and deliuer them by thy power and
mercy out of those wretched bonds, and ouerweighty yoake of woefull captiuity. Send them som meanes (according as thou canst, and best dost knowe how) • or their redemption and deliuerance. O Lord, gather together those prisoners, and such as are farre dispersed, for the loue of thy name: that they may render thankes vnto thee, and recount thy holy praises after their imprisonment. It is most certaine, that the Lord vnderstandeth poore prisoners sighings and deliuers such as are caried to death.

He can set at liberty his captiue people, so that the miserable or afflicted shall reioice, and (with greatnes of ioy) passe ouer griefe like a dreame. Their mouthes shall bee filled
with laughter, and their tongues, with thanksgiuing, that it may be said among all Nations: The Almightie hath done great things for vs: wee were in miserie, but now we reioyce.

Lord, take away captiuity from the afflicted, for thou art their only helper, and the God of hosts. But if there be any, who (according to thy diuine prouidence) are to endure a longer time of thraldome, for triall of their faith, and to exercise their patience: Deare Father comfort them, ease the burden that they beare, and let them finde some grace among them, to whom they are prisoners, with a certaine hope and full perswasion, that thou wilt not reiect them for euer.

And aboue all, continue
them in true Christian faith, against all false Doctrines and opinions: that they may most comfort themselues & reioyce, that thou hast deliuered their soules from eternall imprisonment, and from the chaines of hell and darknesse.

O good God, set free our soules likewise from the bonds of mistie errour, and captiuity of death: Because thou pronouncest deliuerance to captiues, and enlargement • o prisoners, hauing also commanded, that the gracious pleasing yeare of thy beneuolence, should be openly preached. Assist vs likewise that haue the benefit of liberty, whereby our Lord Christ did first enfranchise vs: And let vs neuer more fall vnder the yoake of seruitude,
to be as bond-slaues and vassailes to sinne and Sathan. So be it.

div.head: 7. Against the temptations of the flesh.
div.p: MErcifull God and gracious Father, we acknowledge & confesse, that no goodnes at all abideth in our flesh: because wee were altogether conceiued in iniquity, and engendred out of sinfull seede. Yea, our flesh and blood is in such sort depraued, as wee can neither vnderstand or comprehend (by our owne reason) any thing of the blessed Spirit.

We beseech thee therefore, to graunt vs true knowledge of thy beloued Sonne, to the end, that we
may not iudge by our carnall sense, of those affaires which are spirituall, or of thy word, neither suffer our affections to be guided by the flesh.

Helpe vs to bring our bodies in seruitude, and compell or crucifie our corrupted flesh, with all the delights and desires therof. That thy holy Spirit may leade vs, and we follow his footsteps in true righteousnes. Confessing, that wee (who appertaine to thy deare Sonne Iesus Christ) ought not to bee carnall, but spirituall: being debters, not to liue after the flesh, but according to the Spirit, to the end that wee may not die, as concerning our soules.

But because the flesh combatteth continually against the Spirit, and the
Spirit against the flesh, being euermore contrarie, battailing the one against the other: Helpe vs, O faithfull GOD, that the Spirit which thou gauest vs by thy blessed word in Baptisme, may reigne in vs ouer the flesh, and wee become subiect therto. And that by vertue thereof, we may mortifie the works of the flesh, with all the sinfull desires thereof: so that we may not walke hereafter according to our owne wil, or in the vanity of our weake vnderstanding.

If wee chaunce at any time, to be surprised by flesh and bloud, or (thorow infirmity) do fall into iniquity: Lift vs vp (Lord) with thy right hand, that by thine aide, and inspiration of thy holy Spirit, we may at length bee able to
rise vp againe.

Suffer not our bodies to be dissolute or out of order, but that by liuing soberly and modestly: wee may bring them vnder the yoake of thy sacred ordinances. And being truely humbled, thy grace may then cleanse vs, from all corruption of the flesh and spirit, perfecting our sanctification in thy feare. So that both our spirit, soule and body may be preserued vnreproueable, in the great day of our Lord Iesus Christ, & then to pertake with thee in thy eternall glory. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for the Euening.
div.p: GLorie bee to thee, O Eternall God, that onely workest wōderfull things, blessed for euer be thy glorious name, and let all the earth bee filled with thy might and Maiestie.

All the day long wil we celebrate thy praises, and in the euening our mouths shall render thee thankes continually. For when we cry vnto thee, thou hearest vs, and when wee make complaint, thou gently enclinest thine eare vnto vs. Thou listenest to our voice when we pray vnto thee, being our onely refuge, strength and succour in all our distresses. Gracious
God, wee giue thee praise and thanks, because thou hast so fatherly preserued vs this whole day, from all euill and mischances, which might haue happened vnto vs. Our harts are ioyfull, and our soules doe blesse thee, for all thy great gratuities and mercies. Let our tongues neuer cease to talke of thee daily, saying: Blessed bee the Lord our God, praised be his holy name.

Wee humbly beseech thee, to pardon all the sins which wee haue this day committed, and likewise to defend vs this night drawing on, with all them that doe appertaine vnto vs. Be thou our warrant, shield and safegard, preserue vs from all euils, keepe our soules in thy protection, and be fauourable
to vs. For our hope is in thee that art Eternal, and we call vpon thee, O Lord our God, who onely canst giue end to all our afflictions.

Hee that hath beene alwaies, and yet is our defender, sleepeth not at all, he that keepeth Israel, doth neuer slumber: he wil confirme our footing in a good way, to the end that wee may not swarue, and hee will not suffer our feete to slide, for his word is a lanthorne to our steps. Therfore when wee shall lay vs downe in our beds, wee will not bee dismayed or terrified: but sleepe foundly, without any dread of sudden astonishments, or any assaults of the wicked to come vpon vs.

O Lord our God, let the brightnesse of thy face
shine vpon vs, that wee may lie downe, rest and sleepe in peace: being assured of thy protection, because thou onely art our helper. Wee will lay vs downe in our beds, repose and close our eies in thy name, thou art our euerliuing Lord: Thy grace shall waken vs againe in the morning, to expresse the praise and glory of thy diuine Maiestie, through Iesus Christ thy deare Sonne our Sauiour, who liueth and reigneth with thee, in vnitie of the blessed Spirit. So be it.

div.head: Saturday.
1. A Prayer for the Morning.
div.p:
TRue and eternall God, Father of our Lorde Iesus Christ, we lift vp our spirits vnto thee, with harty thanksgiuing: for we cannot conceale thy righteousnes in our harts, but wee must declare thy faithfulnesse and sauing health, euen in the greatest congregations. And wee will neuer bee silent, but openly report what good
thou hast done vnto vs. For it is a commendable thing to celebrate thy praises, and sing Psalmes in thy name: That euery morning thy goodnes may be declared, and thy fidelity be spoken of, till darke nights approching.

Behold then wherefore our soules doe praise thee, because by thy great mercie, thou hast defended vs all this night. Lord God of Hostes & Armies, hallowed bee thy name, because thou shewest thy selfe gracious, to all such as seeke thee and loue thy saluation. Thy great name (which euer hath been our protection and succour) be blessed ouer all the world, and those workes which thou hast done for the children of mē, let them liue in endlesse holy remēbrance.
This day likewise Lord wee pray thee to preserue vs, that the wicked spirit worke no euill against vs, nor the hands of the vngodly doe any way touch vs.

Lord God our sauiour, we wake this morning to looke vpon thy wonders. From breake of day haue we cried vnto thee, to bee our helper: That with diligence and faithfulnesse, we may follow the works of our vocation, according as thou hast commanded: for thy honor, and the benefit of our neighbors.

Let vs no way misuse the light of this day, nor any of thy other creatures by sinfull meanes. Let our words and works be free from thy displeasure, and let vs not violate the league we made to thee in
Baptisme. Grant vs grace also, to keepe our selues from those sixe thinges which thou hatest, and from the seauenth, which is abhomination to thee: To wit: proude lofty lookes: a false deceitefull tongue: hands that shed innocent blood: a heart that deuiseth actions of outrage: feete swift and speedy in running to euill: a false witnesse, that dares boldly vtter lies: and hee that sets debate among his brethren. Oh good God, preserue vs from these sinnes, and from such as any waye doe resemble them: Giuing vs grace, that our life and deeds may be acceptable to thee, in Iesus Christ thy deare Sonne our Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: Thanksgiuing for the greate mercies of God.
div.p: HOly Trinitie, and true vnity in three distinct persons, thou art one sole essence, one Lord and God, of one and the selfe same Maiesty and excellencie.
We call vpon thee, and yeeld thee thanks from the depth of our harts, for all thy blessings bestowed vpon vs.

For it is a matter most wholsome and reasonable (O holy Father) that we should be thankfull to thee at all times, and in all places, by our Lord Iesus Christ: Because the Angels doe praise thee, the Archangels adore thee,
and all the heauenly Armies, powers, principalities of the celestiall regions, with all vertues on earth (especially thy holie Christian Church in all places of the world) incessantly doe laud and glorifie thee.

Graunt vs grace also, that our voices may bee ioyned with theirs, and that (with them) thou wilt bee pleased to receiue our praiers, praises and giuing of thankes: which now at this instant wee offer vnto thee, for thy manifold great mercies which euerye day are dewed down vpon vs, so high as heauen is from the earth.

For when we were dead in sinne, thou didst quicken vs againe together in Iesus Christ, and hast shewen vs the most excellent
treasures of thy grace, only in thy meere goodnesse O Lord. How great are thy mercies? And how kind art thou to them that turne vnto thee? Who can recount thy numberlesse benefits, or who can adde any iot vnto them? They doe euen equall thy selfe in greatnesse: for thou reprouest, chastnest, instructest, and hast care of such as are thine, euen as a good shepheard hath of his flocke.

Thou hast compassion on all them that first doe suffer themselues to bee drawen, and then are desirous to heare thy word. Euen as a deare Father is sweete in affection towards his children, so is the Lord our eternall Father, towards all them that feare him.

Lord who is like vnto
thee? Thou takest away iniquity, and passest ouer the misdeedes of the remnant of thy heritage. Thou delightest not to be angry for euer, because thou art mercifull, and wilt take pity againe vpon vs, treading downe our offences, and throwing our sinnes into the bottome of the Sea.

From generation to generation, will we remember and praise thy mercies, which haue been from the beginning of the world, and shall endure for euer. We will extoll thy name, because thou art gracious, louing, of infinit goodnesse and mercy: Which likewise (good Father) wee pray thee to bestow vpon vs, as we doubt not to obtaine the same, in the merits of Iesus Christ our
Lord and Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for a happy and blessed departing out of this Life.
div.p: MOST gentle God, thou hast set a limit on the life of man, which no one can exceede or go beyond: For his dayes are determined, and the number of his months is before thee. Thou hast counted all our daies, which neuerthelesse doe passe away suddenly like a stood of water, as if wee our selues did hasten his departure.

All our yeeres are as smoake, or like a shadow immediatelye vanishing. Man is equalled with the
hearbe, that presently drieth, or as the flower of the field, which forthwith withereth.

Teach vs then (O most gracious God) to knowe and consider that we must haue an ending: that our life is limited, and must be hence dislodged. Behold thou hast reduced our daies to the measure of a span, and the date of our life (before thee) is as nothing. It is most certaine, that all in man is but vanity, let him liue in neuer so confident assurance.
Teach vs therefore (O Lorde) to acknowledge and confesse, that death is ordained for vs, and that our walking here is but as on a Pilgrimage: for no permanent City is here appointed for vs.

Let vs truely vnderstand
the breuity and vncertainty of our life, and often to haue a care of our ending: that during the time of our abode here in this world, wee may liue, not properly to our selues, but rather liue and die to thee, attending alwaies in faith and ioy, the houre of our departure, and the comming of Iesus Christ thy beloued Sonne, in a perfect preparation thereunto, by holy conuersation and workes of piety.

O our God, grant vs grace to die happily, and when the day of our concluding commeth: to make our ending in vnderstanding, and true confessing of our sinnes: That our apprehension and senses may be no way wandring, whereby wee shall vtter most idle or blasphemous
words, against thee and our owne saluation.

Preserue vs from sudden and vnprouided death as also from eternall damnation, and suffer vs not to bee taken vnprepared: But by true repentance let vs dayly be in a readinesse, according to the instruction of thy holy word.
Assist vs when the houre shall come, to bee then chearefull and voide of feare: For we are to suffer but a temporall death, which shall be the gate of entrance into life eternall.

Let vs then with courage say as blessed Simeon did. Lorde now let vs thy poore seruantes depart in peace: For our eies haue seen thy saluation, which thou hast prepared for all thy people. A light to lighten the Gentiles, and to bee the glory
of Israell thy people.

Let our last words, be the very same, which thy deare Sonne our Sauior spake vpon the Crosse. Father into thy hands we commend our spirits. And when we shall be able to speake no more, in our latest sigh and gaspe, receiue our soules vp to thee in Iesus Christ. So be it.

div.head: For our dayly sustenance.
div.p:
ALmighty God, wee thy poore children, that are heere on earth, doe crie to thee our Father that art in Heauen, that (in thy infinite mercy) thou wouldst giue vs our daily bread, and all things requisite to supply our bodily necessities. Extend
thy benediction ouer all our tillage and haruest encrease, as also vpon all trades, labours, handycraftes and honest endeauours. Blesse the workes of our hands: For it is thy blessing onely that enricheth, and except thou build the house, all other that go about it, doe but labour in vaine.

Helpe vs, O God, that (in thy name) we may cast foorth the nets of our vocat • ons, and that our labours and endeuors may sort to good successe. Preserue all voyagers, that trauaile farre by land or by water, seeking their owne sustenance, and bringing vs home necessary merchandises: keepe them and their meanes from all distresse and danger.

Be aiding to all such as
deale in buying and selling, giue them grace to trade faithfully with a good conscience, without fraude and deceit: Let euerye one deale iustly in all good affaires, that God thereby may blesse them, to bestowe somewhat vpon the poore. Wee commend to thee in mercie, all thy faithfull seruants, vsing manuall trades, or any other kind of mystery: strengthen them in soule and body, and preserue them from false and vntrusty seruants.

Grant vs grace, to vse all thy blessings with thanksgiuing, that we ouercharge not our selues with vnrighteous Mammon, or with the wretched cares of this fraile life, as Infidells and misbeleeuing Pagans are
wont to doe.

Giue patience to the poore, in their want and indigence, least they should murmur against thy will: Let them carry no enuious spleene towards the rich, neither any way transgresse thy diuine commandements.

So rule likewise the hearts of rich men, that they may not be high minded, neither put any confidence in the vncertaintie of their riches: But onely in thee our euerliuing God, that giuest abundantly whatsoeuer we enioy. Assist them also, to do good with their goods, make them rich in good workes, ready in distributing, and communicating to thy Saints: enriching themselues with a good foundation to come hereafter,
that so they may bee assured of euerlasting life.

Two thinges (O our Lord God) we humbly desire of thee, and neuer to deny them vs during our liues. Vanity and speaking of lies set far off from vs: giue vs neither pouerty nor riches: Sustaine vs with the bread of our own earning. Least being glutted, we deny thee, faying: Who is the Almighty? Or being ouer poore, we fall to stealing, and so take the name of our God in vaine.
Preserue vs O Lord, from these extremities, for Iesus Christs sake, thy deare Sonne and our Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: For those that are in anguish or heauinesse.
div.p:
HEauenlye Lorde and Father, in regarde that the diuell our enemy hath sworne, neuer to leaue distressed heartes without his temptations, and hath made a custome of misusing our necessities, pressing them down more heauily vpon vs, for his owne vile aduantage: Tormenting vs also with straunge and vnusuall thoughts, to make our consciences fearefull, and thereby to get vs into his gulfe of despaire: Most humbly wee beseech thee, (in meere pity to vs poore distressed mortalls, for whom Iesus Christ suffered,
and did sweat that bloody sweat, which ran al ouer his most precious body,) to take compassion vpon all such as are anguished or tempted: asswaging (by thy sanctified word and spirit) the grieued consciences of the infirme and afflicted.

Prouide for their necessities, according to thy fatherly will: wipe away the teares from their eies. Glad their soules with thy inward consolation: arme their hearts with confidence and holy hope: That they may neuer be troden downe, either by the greatnesse of their afflictions, the subtill inspirations of the enemy, or the infirmity of their own flesh.

Let them not fall into any greate and spirituall danger of their soules: as
into incredulity, contempt despaire, or into any other grieuous sinne. O most faithfull God, that sufferest none to be tempted aboue their strength, but with the temptation hast also giuen the issue, in whatsoeuer griefe is to bee endured: we crie aloud to thee, praying thee to bruise vnder our feet, the malitious head of the old Serpent. Weaken, or bring to nothing, the violence and deuises of the diuell, which dayly he worketh against poore Christians: coueting to fift them like vnto corne. Assiste weake mankind, with the fauour of thy deare sonne, who was tempted for vs and for our good, in his own humane nature.

Aide vs, O most louing God, that in all necessities
whatsoeuer, our hearts may receiue consolation, by the most certaine promises of thy diuine succour. So that being really and thorowly prouided of thine assistance, by firme and immooueable faith, wee may repulse the violent assaultes of Sathan: valiantly surmount them by thy vertue: in the blood of the Lamb, and the word of our witnesse, to wit, by thy Gospell. To the end, that Kingdom, power and glory, may remaine onely to thee our God worlde without end. So be it.

div.head: For Widowes and Orphanes.
div.p:
GOod and gracious God, thou hast named thy selfe, Father of
the fatherlesse, and Iudge of widdowes, promising withall, to take their cause into thine owne hands, and to doe them iustice.
Thou hast also commanded vs in thy worde, that wee should not afflict them, neither doe them any euill: Because already they are too much tormented, and despised of the world.

Therefore wee beseech thee, graciously to receiue into thy blessed patronage, all poore widdowes and distressed Orphanes: To prouide them of sustenance raiment, and whatsoeuer else is necessary, to defend and maintaine them against their afflicters. Let them find grace before all Magistrates, that right may be done to the fatherlesse, and the widdowes
cause be kept from oppression. Let their true right bee no way wronged, but alwaies deliuered from their enemies, and finde lawfull defence in all equity.

Be so assistant to them, that their Tutors or Guardians may deale iustly for them in their affaires, and euery one doe good vnto them. Preserue vs also (O Lord) that we sinne not against them, or offer them any shame or disgrace: but rather to extend all amity to them. Considering, that it is true and vnblemishable Religion, to visit the fatherlesse and widowes in their tribulations, and to keepe our selues vntaxed of the world.

Giue grace to all widdowes, that in all their distresses
or temptations, they may euer trust in thee the liuing God, that art their Lord and Father: Let them day and nighte perseuere in prayer, thanksgiuing, and al good actions: as is seemely for widdowes that liue in Gods feare. Let them keep themselues from wanton allurements, giuing no scandall, or occasion of euill opinion towardes them, by lewd words, vnbefitting behauiour, or other euill examples, which may induce others to sin.

Helpe likewise all Orphanes, that they may bee brought vp honestly, in thy feare, piety, modesty, and all vertues. Make them obedient to their Tutors, Masters, and other Superiors: suffering themselues to bee instructed,
to encrease thereby in all honesty, and to make profitable vse of all good admonitions, faithfull counsels, or fatherly reprehensions, which are done vnto them, onely to preserue them from lewdnesse and dishonor.

In like manner, good Lord, defend all that are married, and their children: To the end, that in thy displeasure (by reason of their sinnes) neither by the sword, or otherwise by the ouer sudden death of father and mother, they may become either widdowes or Orphanes.
Good Lord take pittie vpon vs all, in the passion of thy deare sonne Iesus Christ. So be it.

div.head: Against Desperation.
div.p: MErcifull God, hauing often (thorow too much boldnesse) broken thy holy Commaundements, and hauing contemned, displeased, and grieuously offended thee our Lord and God: Our consciences are in such sort charged and wounded, as in extremity of anguish, we find our selues to bee vtterly desolate.

And yet we know, that (of thy meete mercy) forgiuenesse of our sinnes is promised vs in thy sacred word. But our faith beeing very weake, the wicked spirit is too too ready, to rent and teare out of our hearts, all comforte
and inward consolation. For this cause therefore, deare Father, we call vpon thee, humbly entreating thee, neuer to leaue vs in despaire, or destitute of thy heauenly grace: Least we fall and giue our consent to that grieuous sinne of infidelity and desperation.

Confirme vs so strongly, that euen in the midst of death, our hope may be in thee that art our life. Let vs neuer distrust thy succour and mercy, or say with cursed Caine: Our sins are so great, that they cannot be pardoned.

O Christ, Son of God, the liuing sourse of all grace, from whome the streames of mercy doe spread foorth on all sides: We beseech thee with all our soules, to augment in
vs that setled faith, which wee haue grounded vpon thy holy death & passion.

For it is a matter most cleare and euident, that one onely drop of thy precious blood, shed for our sake: is much more excellent in greatnesse of vertue, then all our haynous, foule & enormous sinnes are in pollution.

Look then (deare Lord) vpon vs with those eies of mercie, which thou didst cast back vpon S. Peter, after with execrations hee had denied thee: That we may not despaire with the traytour Iudas, nor sinne against the holy Ghost.

O blessed Spirit, the treasure of all sweetnesse, helpe vs in our latest necessities. When the foule fiend shall accuse vs, our owne consciences declare
vs guilty, hel terrors astonish vs, and we shall be enuironed on all sides, with horrible anguishes and temptations of death, the whole world forsaking vs, and all things turning against vs Then: Oh then deare Father comfort vs. and set our trust in thee neuer be confounded.

Enable our harts by thy seales & testimonies, that our hope in thee may not be doubtfull for the remission of our sins. For both to vs, and to all other, that depend vpon thy will and prouidence, they doe remaine in full and stedfast promise.

Let vs then also remember the bonde which wee made to thee, when wee receiued the Sacrament of Baptisme: And to comfort our selues euen
then, with thy blessed promise thereto annexed, namely: Whosoeuer beleeueth, and is baptized, shall be saued. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for the Euening.
div.p: MOST high and immortal GOD, thy name be praised, thy goodnes and mercy extolled for euer, thy wisedome and eternall truth alwaies remembred: because this day thou hast kept vs from all dangerous euils.
May it please thee to finish the good worke thou hast begun in vs, suffering vs this night to rest in thy safe protection, and vnder the wings of thy all-shielding mercy.

Let our safety be in the shaddow of thine armes, then can no harme happen vnto vs. Keepe vs as the apple of thine eye, for thou Lord art our portion and inheritance, our saluation consisteth onely in thy hands.

Assist vs by thy goodnes, that feare or trembling come not vpon vs, nor the dreades in darke nights do any way annoy vs: But take pitty vpon vs, for our soules wait only vpon thee, and gathers themselues vnder thy secret couerture.

We sought the Lord in our distresse, we put forth our hands in the night to finde him, and could take no rest: For our soules haue no other comfort, neither know wee any other assistance in heauen or on
earth, but onely thee O Lord.

When wee awake at midnight, wee remember thy name, because thou art gracious: And then thinking on thy euerlasting goodnes: wee hold it but right and iustice to praise thee therfore: Whensoeuer we are sad, wee call for thy comfort, when our hearts are in heauinesse, we speak to our Sauiour for succour: for thou drawest our soules out of perdition, and deliuerest them from the snares of death.

Night & day doe we cry vnto thee our Lord God, that in pittie it would please thee to pardon all the iniquities, wherby we haue sinned against thee this whole weeke past: As also whatsoeuer wee haue misdone this day. O
God, Father of lights, deliuer our soul • s from all deadly dangers. Thou art pitifull and iust, made all of mercy, and in that mercy preseruest the simple.

We becam as wretched caitiffes, yet thou broughtest vs back from straying. Therefore we will be ioyfull, and praise thy name walking and on our bed: Accounting it as our chiefest consolation, that thou art Lord both of our life and death.

Now therefore we commit both our soules and bodies into thy hands, be carefull of them this night and euermore: For thou God art faithful, and thou hast redeemed vs through Iesus Christ our onely Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: THE SECOND PART OF THE Princes Prayers. CONTAYNING DIVERS COMFORtable Prayers, to be vsed by and for such particuler persons: As their seuerall directions doe best declare themselues.
A Prayer for our gracious Lord King IAMES.
div.p:
GRatious God, and louing Father, who in thy sacred word hast cōmanded vs, to make prayers, intercessions and supplications, for Kings and Rulers vpon earth, and to yeeld thee continuall thankes, for their peaceable, godly and gracious gouernment. Wee (who haue more especiall cause, then any other Nation beside, in regard of thin • infinit blessings and mercies,
so long time continued vnto vs) doe giue thee most hearty thankes, for sending thy seruant and our dread Soueraigne King Iames, to rule and raigne ouer vs his owne appointed people.

Furthermore wee pray vnto thee, to blesse him with long life, health and happinesse for the aduancement of thy glorious gospell, the welfare of thy Church, and the endlesse comfort of all his true harted Subiects. Defend him as thou hast donc, from all forraine practises, homebred conspiracies, and all other treacherous intentions whatsoeuer. Let him for euer say with Dauid: The snare is broken, the bloud thirstie are disappointed, I will therefore reioyce in thy strength (O
my God) for euer and euer.

Be thou alwaies with him (Lord) wheresoeuer he rides or goes: thy holy angels protect him, and thy louing countenance shine vpon him. In his delights and exercises, let no euill come neer him, and waking or sleeping, let no harme befall him.

The king shall reioyce in thy strength, (O Lord) exceeding glad shall he be of thy saluation. Thou hast giuen him his harts desire, and not denied him the request of his lips. Thou shalt preuent him with the blessings of goodnesse, and shalt set a crowne of pure gold vpon his head. Thou shalt giue him euerlasting felicity, and make him glad with the ioy of thy countenance. And why? because
the King putteth his trust in the Lord, and in the mercy of the most high he shall not miscarry. Be thou (O Lord) for euer exalted in thine owne strength: So shall we sing and praise thy power. So be it.

div.head: For our most vertuous Queene Anne.
div.p: ALmightye and euerliuing God Heauenly Father, wee confesse and acknowledge, that euery good and perfect gift descendeth downe from thee, and we (wretched sinners) cannot bee capable of the very meanest of them, but only by thy gratious helpe and sufferance.

We know, that Kings
and Queenes are seated and established here vpon earth by thee, to be noursing Fathers and nursing Mothers to thy Church and people, to propagate thy truth, and to defend their subiects in peace and tranquility.

Therefore most humbly we do intreat thee, to blesse our royall and vertuous Queen Anne, whom thou hast giuen as a helpe and comfort to our Soueraigne Lord King Iames. Endue her with all thy gifts of grace, enable her in all good and godly actions: that she may make the King to reioice in thy blessings, and our Land to bee happy by her royall issue.

Let loue, concord, and sweet agreement, continually liue with the King
and her. Make her fruitfull like the Vine, and plenteous like the spreading Oliue tree: For therin are Kingdoms happy, and the people blessed.

Keepe treason and trechery far off from the king and her, let their daies be spent without greeuance, and their nights without the least annoyance. Let safety circle them abroade and at home, and wheresoeuer they be, thy blessed Angels be alwaies their defenders Make her a glad mother of many children. In the time of conception be helpfull to her, and till the houre of deliuerance still preserue her. That no harme happen to the Infant or her, but that then she may see the fruit of her trauaile with ioy, and the childe to bring comforte
both to Father and Mother. Heare vs (O heauenly Father) in these our requests, for thy deare Sons sake Iesus Christ, our Lord and Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: For the right royall and towardly yong Prince Henry, and the rest of his Maiesties Princelie Issue.
div.p:
O God of Gods, and King of kings, that dost dispose and order all things vpon earth, according to thy heauenly will & wisedom. Thou that blessest kingdoms with godly, religious and vertuous gouernors, and for the further comfort of them and their people, sendest them such children & issue, as may illustrate
thy glorye, and maintaine thy truth, euen from one generation to another.

We laud and magnifie thy gracious goodnesse, for bestowing vpon this our land, so hopefull a Prince as yong Henrie is, and such royall seede beside, as the residue of the King and Queenes most royall Issue are: Whereby such faire and chearefull comfort is promised, that peace for euer shall dwell within our walles, and plenty flourish in our Pallaces. Keepe them all (good Lord) as the apple of thine eie, or as the signet vpon thine owne finger. Enritch their young hearts with thy faith, feare and fauour. And as they shall growe in yeeres, so let them dayly wex older
and older in goodnesse, grace and all other vertues.

We must and doe confesse (O heauenly Father) that both to the King, Queen, all them, and vs, thou hast declared thy selfe a great and gracious God. Their and our deliuerance was wonderfull, beyond mens apprehension or expectation, and so euident a testimonye of thy might and mercy: that for euer we are bound (on our knees) to acknowledge it, and to yeeld thee thankes therefore, both we and our posterity.

O Lord, continue this care ouer them and vs stil: blesse them from all Traitors and treasons. Confound all diuelish deuises intended against them: and (as of late) so let vs alwaies
see, the downe-fall and destruction of such as seeke their harme. Giue the King thy iudgements, O God, and thy righteousnesse vnto the Kings Sonne.
Then shall he iudge the people according to right, and defend the poore that are oppressed.

The mountaines also shall bring peace, and the little hills righteousnesse vnto the people. In their time shall the righteous flourish, and peace shall abound so long as the Moone endureth. There shall bee heapes of corne in the earth high vpon the hills: his fruit shall shake like Libanus, and shall be greene in the City, like grasse vpon the earth.

Blessed bee the Lorde our God, euen the God of
Israel, who onely doth wonderfull things. And blessed be the name of his Maiesty for euer, & all the earth shall bee filled with his Maiesty. Amen. Amen.

div.head: A Prayer for him that is a Preacher or Minister.
div.p: MOst mercifull God, and louing Father, thou hast called mee (thy poore and vnworthy seruant) to the holy Ministery of thy word: Ordayning me to be a fisher for men, to catch and conduct many soules to the kingdom of heauen.

Thou hast separated me by thy ordinary meanes,
to bee a Preacher of thy Gospell to thy people. Wherefore I beseech thee, because I am vnapt and vnable of my selfe, to fit and furnish me with thy graces, to doe the duty of thy new Testament. To the end, that I may bee a faithfull Minister, and a true dispenser of thy sacred mysteries, to execute iustly my charge, not by constraint, but voluntarilie: not for dishonest gain, but with a chearefull courage, and for the loue of thy holy name.

With wholsome doctrine, and faithfulnesse in duty, let me feed thy poore flocke committed to my care: To strengthen the dismaied: to giue physicke to diseased consciences: to bind vp the griefes of such as are wounded: to bring
backe those that haue straied, to seeke them that are lost: and to recouer by the spirit of mildnesse, those that are taken in any transgression.
