Send mee thy sanctifying spirit, which is able to giue me vtterance and wisedome, for distinct deliuerance of thy word: That it may work powerfully by me thy pore instrumēt, & a bountiful increase to arise by my labours.

O good God, thou hast made mee a watchman ouer thy people, helpe me then I intreate thee, that I may admonish the wicked, and instruct the transgressors of thy holye waies: so that sinners may be conuerted to thee, and many wonne to eternall life.

Giue mee grace also, to liue conformablie to thy
blessed word, that I may be an example to my flock, not preaching saluation to others, and damnation to my selfe. Let me giue no occasion to aduersaries, to blaspheme thy sacred name, by any conuersation vnbeleeming a Christian, or any way to render them matter of scandall.

But grant both to mee and all my Auditors, thy holy Spirit: to the end, that we increasing in thy feare, true faith and charity: may continue to our liues end, firme in constant hope, which alwaies ought to bee accompanied with vnfaigned repentance.

So shall we receiue together, the precious and vnualuable Crowne of glory, when the Prince of
Pastours, Iesus Christ our Sauiour shal appeare in Maiestie: Who liueth and reigneth with thee, in vnitie of the blessed Spirit, worlde without end. So be it.

div.head: 3. A Prayer for him that is a hearer of Gods word.
div.p:
ETernall God and heauenly Father, I pray vnto thee for my Pastour and Teacher, that thou wilt graunt him grace, to preach thy Word with courage, chearefully and zealously: Against all errours, false Doctrine and abusiue instruction, so that he may let mee and others truly know, the mysteries of thy holy Gospell, and
roote vp all euill opinions out of our hearts.
Preserue him in the purity of Doctrine, & Christian conuersation, that he may shewe vs the way to eternall life.

Maintain him in health, that hee may long time instruct with faithfull encrease. Let him deliuer thy holy word without any doubting, feare, Hypocrisie, and without selfe-pleasing affection, hatred, malice, or greedy desire after particuler profit. Let him preach the truth purely, and reproue sinnes as becommeth him: So that I and many others, may thereby bee wun to thy euerduring Kingdome.

Open mine heart and eares, that I may take pleasure in hearing thy heauenly word, with deuotion,
attention, and cordiall affection: So to liue holily thereafter, according as I ought, and to bring forth fruites to thy diuine glory.
Grant mee grace, that thy holy word may neuer be deliuered to me in vain: But that it may worke thine owne will in me, and accomplish the issue which thou sendest it for.

Cleanse my heart from all negligence, slothfulnes and contempt. Make my spirit to haue a holy hunger, and a quenchlesse desire to the most ample riches of thy graces, as they are proposed in the pure preaching of thy word.

Let me haue a reuerend acknowledgement of my Pastour, and esteeme him as thy Minister, and dispenser of thy sacred mysteries:
Receiuing thy word from forth his mouth, euen as it were deliuered out of thine owne: shewing my selfe no way to misprise thy holy Ministery, albeit thou hast conferred it vpon weake fraile men.

Let mee neuer esteeme thy word the worse, for the imperfections or debility in such as deliuer it: But grant mee such assistance, that I may heare and imbrace it willingly, thankfully accepting all reprehensions, or Fatherly corrections & admonitions, which my Pastour shall think fittest for me.

Let me take all in good part, desisting from sinne, and pursuing a new conformity: For such corrections are most conuenient for me, and those kinde reproofes
are sweeter then kisses.

Keep vs all in true faith and Christian life, that beleeuing firmly, and growing strong daily, wee may hold on constantly to our ending: And obtaine saluation euerlastingly, in thy deare Sonne Iesus Christ our Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: 3. A Prayer for him that is a Magistrate, or placed in any degree of Authority.
div.p:
MOst high God, Lord of Heauen and earth, thou hast called mee to the charge of a Magistrate, and hast giuen mee power ouer such people,
as by thee I am appointed to gouerne. I beseech thee, to giue me also a wise and an vnderstanding heart, to the end I may iudge thy people, to discern between good and euill, and pursue that which is right, without any feare or acception of persons.
Giue mee counsell and strength, to doe what thou wouldst haue me: profitable for them vnder me, and alwaies tending to publique peace.

Grant me grace to consider, that from thy hand (O most high God) I receiued the authority which I haue, and that the iudgement which I exercise, is not from men, but of thee onely. Yea, thou art seated in iudgement with me, to ouer-see whatsoeuer I doe, and one day thou wilt
make a strickt inquiry, and looke into euery action of mine. In regard, that I am but an vnder-Officer of thy Kingdome, and cannot long liue or continue in so weighty a charge: for ordinarily it comes to passe, to day a King, to morrow dead.

Now because it is ordained, that more narrowe and seuere iudgement wil be had of vs that are aboue others, and do not execute our authority directly, or gouerne our selues according to thy will, O God. In regard also, that the mighty shall be rigorously punished, because thou (being Lord ouer all) makest spare of no person, neither dreadest the power of any one (considering thou madest both great and small, and hast an equall care of
all:) Helpe mee (O most merciful and eternal God) I beseech thee, that I may neuer goe proude or presumptuous, but suffer my selfe to be taught and corrected by thy word. That I may truly doe my duty, and not bee transported or led away, either in doing, or suffering shame & outrage to be done to any one. And that I may neuer consent to iniquity, neither decline or turne out of the right way.
I am thy seruant, Son of thy seruant, a weake man, of slender continuance, and very vnskilfull in the knowledge of thy right and lawes.

Therefore, send downe wisedom from thy heauenly throane, that she may be with me and aide me: that shee may instruct mee in
those things, which are acceptable in thy sight. To conduct me discreetly in all my doings, and keepe me euer in awe of thy Maiestie: that all my actions may be pleasing to thee, in Iesus Christ my Lord and Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: 4. A Prayer for a Subiect.
div.p:
MOst meek and merciful God, who hast established all Rulers and Magistrates, hauing cōfirmed them also by thy sacred word. I pray vnto thee for that body politique, vnder whose protectiō & gouernment thou hast appointed me to liue. May it please thee, to preserue the chiefe head & maine piller therof,
constant in true knowledge of the Christiā faith. Blesse him with long life, peaceable gouernement, and all other graces or prosperities of body and soule: To the end, that vnder his rule, wee may lead a tranquill and peacefull life, in all godlinesse and honestie, for the glory of thy blessed name. Grant good God to our Magistrate, wisedome & knowledge, to doe what thou likest, and leaue what thou hatest: to be alwaies readie in those things, that bring the benefit of peace, and are profitable for encreasing our general good.

Maintaine him in the charge thou hast committed to him, let thy grace defend him against all his enemies: that either openly doe endeuour, or priuately
practise to take away his life, or seeke to trouble the State by treasons and trecheries.

Helpe him, good Lord, patiently to endure all trauailes or afflictions, that may happen to him in so great a charge: And be as gracious to his children or heires, blessing them with long life, firme faith and feare of thee.

Grant vnto me, and all such as are subiects, as I am, obedient hearts, dutifull to acknowledge our Magistrate, and such Officers as he sendeth. Especially they that hold place in this estate, according to thine ordinance: Let vs honor them, respect them, obey them in all humility, and keepe our selues from offending or rising against them.
For they that resist the Magistrate, doe resist thy ordinance, and purchase condēnation against themselues.

Giue me grace likewise, to render to my superiours, and such as haue power ouer me, whatsoeuer is my duty to yeeld them, with a voluntary hart, and free from any falshoode. For it is saide vnto vs: Giue vnto all mē, that which yee owe them, tribute, to whom tribute belongeth. &c.

Preserue vs from mutinies, conuert such as are rebellious. Be assistant to vs, that we may render to thee our good God, obedience aboue all other, and next thee, to our Ruler and Magistrate: that departing out of this mortal life, we may come together into
thy Kingdome, through Iesus Christ our Lord. Amen.

div.head: 5. A Prayer for him that is a Husband.
div.p: ALmighty and most mercifull GOD, thou hast instituted holy mariage, and honoured it with the first miracle of Iesus christ thy deare Sonne. Approuing it an estate most acceptable to thee, and wherin many Patriarchs and Prophets liued holily, and to thy good liking.

Thou hast likewise called mee to this condition, and doost take delight in three things, namely: whē brethren liue in vnity together, when neighbours loue equally: and whē man
and wife agree in the bond of concord. I beseech thee then (frō the bottom of my heart) to grant mee grace, that I may liue with my wife in loue and Christian concord, behauing my selfe discreetly towards her, as being the weaker vessell. But yet in such sort to respect her, as being fellow heire with me to life eternall. Graunt that I may instruct her, with our children and family, in thy holy knowledge and feare, with all honesty & modestie: And so assist her, that she may be obedient to me in all thinges, tending to goodnes and godlines.

Keepe farre off from vs the enemy to mariage, that he raise not troubles or dissentions between vs. But if (through infirmity) wee fall at any time into some
houshold quarrell: Helpe vs, good God, wee beseech thee, to be soone reconciled again in thy feare, that our prayers may not be hindered, or wee giue scandale to any other. Gouerne so my heart, that I may beare no especiall affection to any, but my wife onely, or looke vpō a woman with a lustfull eye: but keepe me euer truly to mine owne. Preserue me, my wife, children and family, from hurtfull sicknesses and diseases, according to thine owne good pleasure.

And grant vnto me thy seruant, that I may carefully follow the workes of my vocation: to eate my bread in the sweate of my browes, and neuer to bee idle: because I was borne to worke and labour, according
to thine appointment.
Extend thy benediction ouer all my good meanes, that they may grow great and encrease, without wrong or preiudice to others.

Let mee haue such men-seruants, maid-seruants, and other worke-men, as are true and faithfull: both to keepe my house, and whatsoeuer else thou hast here lent me, from pilfery, robbery, and all other inconueniences. Helpe vs patiently to vnder-goe the burden of all crosses, and gather vs together (after this life) in thy heauenly Kingdome, with all those that haue here liued in honorable mariage. So be it.

div.head: 6. A Prayer for her that is a Wife.
div.p: MY God and faithfull Father, seeing thou hast bestowed so gret grace vpon mee, as to call me to the sanctified estate of mariage, wherin I may serue and be acceptable to thee: Be further yet gracious to mee thy poore seruant, that I may haue the feare of thy holy name continually before mine eies: that I may loue thee and (aboue all things) trust in thee my Creator and Redeemer.

Let mee be constant in thy faith, dilection, sanctification and feare, and (next vnto thee) that I may respect, honour, and loue my
husband, without bearing affection to any other.

Assist me good GOD, that following thy holy ordenance, my will may bee subiected to my husbands, to obey him in all vprightnesse: And that the inwarde part of my hart, may be adorned with a sweete and peacefull spirit, and all other holy vertues beside. Answerable to those holy women heretofore, who were wiues to the blessed Patriarches: going decently apparrelled, trusting in God, and alwaies beeing subiect to their owne husbands.

Grant vnto me thy seruant, a chast & honest conuersation, with true feare and humility, to the end: That in all pietie (with gentle and affable words) I may appease my husbands
displeasure, and appeare before him in all plesing manner.

Let me bring vp and instruct my childrē, with the rest of my family, for the glory of thy name: and let their hearts bee willingly obedient to me, in whatsoeuer is good, and I to proue stil a faithful helper to my husband. In the ordering of our houshold, & dispensation of those blessings, which by thy grace thou hast bestowed vpon vs: So gouerne mee, O Lord, that nothing may be lost through my negligence: But that I may be honestly sparing, helping my husband to labour, doing all things seemely for my vocation, that I may the better haue meanes, to respect others necessities, and open my hands
wide to them that be pore.
Preserue vs frō vnfaithfull followers, men-seruants or maide-seruants, who easily may waste and lessen our best meanes.

Giue mee grace also, equally to endure all aduersities incident to mariage: not ouer greeuously to bee sm tten downe, when tribulations come vpon vs: neither too proudly exalted, when prosperity shineth. Considering that by aduersities & temptations, our faith is best prooued, and our patience exercised.

O Lord my God, I commend my self, my husband, my children, and all my people into thy powerfull hands: Defiring thee to keepe vs from sin, shame, and all other inconueniences, for the loue of Iesus christ our sauiour. So be it.

div.head: 7. A Prayer for a Childe, Sonne or Daughter.
div.p: GRatious God, and heauenly Father, thou hast enioyned Children alwaies to honor their Fathers and Mothers, and takest delight (for thy deare Sons sake Iesus Christ) in the seruice & obedience they render vnto them: hauing promised to recompence this iust duty, with long life and other benedictions beside.

Therfore from the lowest depth of my heart, I most humbly intreat thee, to be so louingly gratious vnto me: as to blesse with long life my Father and Mother, and them whom
thou shalt thinke meete to succeede in their places: euermore defending them frō all dangerous diseases, and all other afflictions, casualties or dammages.

Giue me likewise an vnderstanding and willing hart, to obey them in al dutifull humility, and also all other, who (by their appointment) shall haue authority to commaund mee. Let me honour them with works, words & patience, that their blessing (begd of thee) may come vpon me.

Prouide so for me good Lord, that I may be able to compasse some honest means, wherby to succour my Father in his aged yeares, & neuer to greeue him al the daies of his life. Let me beare with his infirmities, and neuer dispise him, though hee fall into
childhood againe, and I be better able in giftes or knowledge then he.

Let mee likewise neuer make sad my deare Mothers heart, that bare mee with great pain and grieft so long in her wombe, and suffered much more care in bringing me vp. Let mee neuer forsake either of them any one day of my life, least their bitter curse doe fall vpon me.
Moreouer I beseech thee (O good God) that if heretofore I haue beene disobedient, or rebellious against my Father & Mother: it would please thee to pardon me in thy great mercy.

Impute not the sinnes and iniquities of my yonger daies vnto me, neither bee mindfull of my ignorances & stubborne transgressions:
But grant mee grace to acknowledge my folly, repenting whatsoeuer I haue displeased them in. Cōuerting now to thee by true faith, & an inward penitent heart: As hauing wary regard to that example, which our Sauiour Iesus gaue to all children, who in his youth was subiect to his Mother and Ioseph. Euen so let mee alwaies be found in Christian obedience.

Mercifull God, preserue me from the euil company of wicked people, that I may neuer be seene among them. But if they seeke to allure, draw, or forcibly cōpel me, that yet the feare of thee may keepe backe my feet, and I not walke with them the way of perdition. As thou encreasest my yeares, so (good God) blesse
me with increase of wisedome and grace towardes thee, and the loue of all good men, for thy deare Sons sake, Iesus Christ my Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: A Praier for a Man or Maid Seruant.
div.p:
MErcifull God thou hast redeemed mee, by the passion and death of thy dearly beloued Son from eternall seruitude, the dominion of sinne, the power of darknesse, and the most cruell tyranny of the Diuell, crowning thy selfe as Lord and Master, with victory ouer death and hell. I beseech thee to be so gracious to mee, as not to forsake me in this condition of bodily seruice
wherto thou hast appointed mee a while here on earth.

Let me not murmure (thorow impatience) against thine ordinance, nor cast an enuious eie at a place of higher reckoning, wherin (by thy wil) others are constituted. But let me willingly (and with a good heart) submit my selfe to thine appointment: as being perswaded, that my seruice is not done to men, but to thee my God, who art in Heauen.

Eternall and soueraign Lord of heauen and earth, be helpfull to me, that I may serue, obey, feare, and loue thee, aboue all other thinges in this world, reposing the whole hope of my saluation in thee.

Let me also be obedient
in all things (that are not against thine ordenance) to my Master and Mistresse: not onely when they be kind and gentle, but likewise when passion makes them fierce and angry. Rendring them my seruice in dutifull feare and true simplicity of heart, as to my Lorde and Master Christ: Not with anye eye-seruice, as desirous to please men, but with a faithfull heart, in regarde of thine ordenance and commandement.
Graunt mee grace, to bee true and loyall in whatsoeuer is commanded mee, that I waste not or destroy any thing, and that no losse or damage happen by my improuidence.

Let me neuer be desirous of others goods, being
but giuen mee in charge, and not (by me) to be impaired or iniured dishonestly.

Preserue me in health, and all the parts of my body, giue me also wisedome and vnderstanding, to doe the businesse of my Master or Mistresse as I ought, & to increase their meanes by thine aide and furtherance. So that they (being blessed by my diligence, multiplied, and no way diminished) may also haue comforte of mine honest endeuors. And that whatsoeuer I take in hand or execute, may redound to the glory of thy blessed name, and make an holy exercising of my faith, thorow Iesus Christ our Lord and Sauiour, who liueth with thee in the vnity of Spirite, world
without end. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for a young Man, or a yong Maide.
div.p: LOrd God Almighty, who art pure in essence, eternally chaste, without spot or blemish, and takest delight in cleane hearts, and sanctified conuersation. I humbly beseech thee, to create in me a pure heart, and a setled spirit of assurance: to the end, that I may serue thee in true faith and feare, and loue thee withall my heart and strength.

Preserue me from all wicked desires, and from all immodest or vnchaste behauiour. Let me meddle with no vaine commixtious, or be couetous
after strange beauty and complexion: neither let mee bee licentious, in affecting carnall pleasures which make waye to sinne, and nourish vncleannesse.

Stifle all inordinate desires in my heart, and quench in me the flames of fleshly concupiscence: that I may alwaies turne mine eies from corrupt entiseings, and gaze vpon noface to bee lustfully kindled.

When thou sufferest me to walke abroad, let me meet with no euill disposed company, that giue themselues to impudencie and blushlesse behauiour: Neither let me then fall by surfetting and drunkennesse, wherin is no meane but all dissolutenesse.

Stop mine eares against
vaine words, vile proffers, and vnciuill communication, which better doth beseeme the Heathen, then to be vsed in Christian assemblies.

Keepe me from pride, rioting, negligence and slothfulnesse, which are the trappes and snares of Sathan. Guard me from those places, persons and all occasions, that may mooue and sollicite me to vnshamefastnesse: Least by such wicked conuersation, I make the members of Christ no better then an harlots.

Assist me then, that I may render thee seruice in true faith, with an vndefiled soule, and a spotlesse body, like as chast Ioseph did in Egypte. At what time (in thy good pleasure) thou shalt like to
call mee to the blessed estate of mariage: then let thy grace so guide me, that I may enter the same in thy feare. Not for vaine affection, or immodest curiosity, but according to thy sanctified ordenance, and for the loue of children, to magnifie here below thine euerliuing name.

Graunt me a good and honest yoake-fellow, with whom I may liue happily in peace and concord: For thou knowest the hearts, and vnderstandest the thoughts, properties and conditions of all humane creatures. Houses and riches, they doe commonly come from the inheritance of Parents: But a wise husband or wife, doe come from thee O Lord, it is a gift which thou bestowest vpon none, but them that
feare thee.
For this cause therefore I cry vnto thee, beseeching thee in mercy, to keep me from the wicked, riotous, and such as are addicted to sinne: for Iesus Christs sake, my Lord and Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for a woman greate with child.
div.p: ALmightye and most mercifull God, Creator of heauen and earth, it was thy will (by reason of sinne) that I and all other women, should bring soorth children with paine and trauaile, and in that kind to encrease the world.

Now albeit this thy will is irreprehensible, good and holy, in regarde
that whatsoeuer thou didst make or ordaine, is most good: yet I humbly beseech thee (poore wretched creature as I am) to be so gracious vnto mee, that I may retaine thy faith firme and constantly, which is grounded vpon thy great mercy, in Iesus Christ my Sauioure, that so neuer distrusting thy grace, thy right hand alwaies may bee my helper.

Assist me with patience to support all mine anguishes, and in the needfull time, benignely deliuer me of the burden wherewith I am laden. Let me see (with ioy after griefe) the fruit which thou hast created in my wombe, thereby to conuert my moanes into mirth. But in meane space, preserue both mee
and mine infant, from all euill and inconueniences.
Turne away mine eies, that I may neuer see anye deformed shape, and that (thorowe ouer great or violent imagination) my selfe prooue not the cause, that my fruit shal be imperfect or mishapen.

So order my behauiour, that (by neglect in slipping or falling) I receiue no hurt any waye, neither let me (thorow extreame choler or otherwise) bring any preiudice to the poore infant in my belly, or disasterous chance any way to annoy it.

Let mee haue a care, how I goe or walke abroad. And when the hour for deliuerance commeth,
be thou then strongest of all for me. That I may lie downe in ioy, without any feare: and calling truly vpon thy name, I may comfort my selfe in thy holy promises of assistance bringing into the worlde a liuing humane creature, well formed and fashioned after thine owne Image.

Graunt the child such grace, that it may receiue blessed Baptisme: to the end, that beeing regenerated by water and the holy Ghost, for life euerlasting: It may also be an heire of thy heauenly kingdome, seruing thee in true knowledge and sanctified conuersation.

O Lord God, most gracious Father, preserue me from all vntimely and abortiue childbirth. Thou art my God and faithfull
Sauiour, in all necessities whatsoeuer, my hope and life is onely in thee, and though thou shouldst kill me, yet will I trust in thee.

Therfore I commit my selfe wholly to thy will, which is euermore the best for me: Entreating thee to haue care of me, and the fruit in my womb, for loue of the most bitter passion, and innocent bloodshedding of Christ my Redeemer. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for a man or woman, being in the estate of Widowhood.
div.p:
TRue, faithfull and eternall God, Father of our Lorde Iesus Christ,
by whose will it is, that I should fall into the miserable estate of widdowhood, in taking my deare yoake-fellow from me by death. I crie vnto thee in this mine affliction, humbly intreating thee, that thou wouldst take compassion vpon me, and (in thy great goodnesse) pardon all the sinnes which I haue committed against thee. Confirme my faith by thy blessed spirit, that it may neuer be weakned, for thou art my eternall Sauiour and comfort.
Turne thy louing countenance, and be mercifull to me, because I am alone and afflicted, which am to bee holpen by none but thee.

Send me maintenance, as thou didst prouide for the widdow of Sarepta, to
whome thou didst send the Prophet Elias, and miraculously gauest her nourishment in the time of famine.

Haue care of me, and be my comforter, vnderstand my need, and deliuer me in aduersity. Let me finde grace among all Magistrates, that they knowing and iudging of my affaires rightly, may defend me from all iniurie and violence.

Raise me vp such friends and benefactors, as either in charity or fidelity, may take my cause into their hands, and assist me thorowly with counsel in my necessities. Preserue mee from lying tongues, which are sharpened like a Rasor, or resemble an arrow, let loose with great strength. Deliuer mee
from the calamities and wicked speeches, of such as giue themselues to vanity: who deliuer lewde words as out of a bow, hauing taught or accustomed their tongues to detecting.
I desire of thee also (O my Lord God) that I may carry my selfe well and holily in my widowhood, keeping a chast conuersation, and yeelding good example to others.

In all aduersities, let my trust be onely in thee my Sauiour: without any impatient behauiour, incredulity, or weaknesse of courage in mine afflictions: but rather strengthned in faith, praying euer to thee both night and day. As the eies of the handmaid waiteth on the hand of her Mistresse: so do mine eies attend vpon thee
the eternall God, vntill thou shalt take pitty vpon me. Therefore (O Lord) take pitty on me: For I haue my fill of contempt. My soule is ouerglutted with mockes and scornes, which proud men, (wallowing on their beds of case) doe dayly throw at me. Heare then my requests, for thy deare Sons sake Iesus Christ. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for a Trauailer by Sea or Land.
div.p:
ALmighty God in thy name will I trauaile vpon the way, beginning the voyage which I haue vndertaken, with inuocating thy great mercie. For thou art our God, that lookest vnto the
beginning and ending, thou settest our feete in the right path, to the end wee should not slide or fall. Leade mee then on the waye in thine own ordinances, and preserue mee from all false opinions.

May it please thee, to accompany me with thy holy Angells, giuing them charge and commaundement, to keep me whersoeuer I goe: Conducting me by good waies, to mine in tended place of trauaile, and then to bring me back safe and sound, to mine owne dwelling, louers and friends.
Deale with me as thou didst with young Tobias, who was guided by thy Angell Raphael to Rages in Medea, and afterward safely returned home againe.

O Lord my God, so order my footsteps, that I neither slip, slide, or hurt my selfe by falling. Let me not wander out of my way, and so be endangered by waters, woods, theeues, or any lewd company: Keepe wild beastes far off from me, and all other molestations of body or soule.

Let me meet with honest people, that may kindly entertaine, lodge, and exercise the works of mercy towards me. Yea, so assist me, that I may well and happily accomplish mine affaires, and afterward (in peace) returne home to my house.

Be neere vnto mee, in all my foorth-gooings and backe returninges. Euen as thou wast with the holy Patriarche Iacob,
when he iournyed into Mesopotamia: And as thou spakest to him, when he went into Egypt, saying: I will descend with thee, and also cause thee to bee brought backe againe.

Or as thou diddest accompany the children of Israell thorow the red Sea, and likewise all along the inhabitable comfortlesse desert: walking before them all daye in the piller of the cloude, and in a fiery piller by night, to direct them their way. May it please thee (in like maner) to be with me, walking before me in all this iourney: accompanying and defending me from loosing my way, from meeting with any euil accident, and from all other dangers whatsoeuer.
Prouide all necessarie occasions for mee, and neuer doe thou abandon or forsake me: but alwaies be my good shepheard and conducter.

I recommend my body and soule into thy hands, my wife, children, house and houshold family, and all that else appertaineth to me. Be gracious to me, that I may returne safely, to find all mine in health, and my goods in security. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for any one, that is grieuously anguished or afflicted.
div.p: LOrd, rebuke me not in thine indignation, neyther punish me in thy heauy displeasure.
For thyne arrowes are fixed fast in me, and thine hand presseth mee downe.

There is no health at all in my body, by reason of thy threatnings, neither is there any rest in my bones, in regard of my sinnes. My heart trembleth, my strength forsaketh me, and my sight faileth mee for very trouble.
Afflictions (without meane) haue round engirt mee, my sinnes haue ensnared mee, exceeding in number the haires on my head.
The chaines of death haue bound me fast, and the paines of hell enclosed me about.

Behold, mine own conscience witnesseth against me, I feele nothing else but the sorrowes of death: nor
can I take any rest, in fearfull consideration of hell torments. I am as in deep waters, where I feele no bottome, or as sticking fast in the mudde, and no way able to get out.

My soule is ouer-charged with miseries, and my life drawes neere to hell gates. I am accounted as one of those that go downe into the pit: My heart is anguished within my body, and the feare of death is falne vpon me.

O Lorde God deliuer me, hast, hast, hast thee to helpe me. Plucke backe my soule frō the torments of hell, pardon me all my sinnes, and those greeuous iniquities which I haue committed against thee: For Sathan makes great mountaines of them, to the end that I may gain no
sight of thy grace.

Suffer me (at least) to haue some vnderstanding of thy mercy, and leaue me not vnprouided of thy fatherly fauour. Comfort me againe, O my God, that my heart may be appeased and quieted, for thou art much greater then my heart. And although it doe accuse me, yet by the blessed tidings of thy Euangelicall Doctrine, thou canst assuredly comforte and strengthen me. Albeit my sinnes are without measure, and as red as blood: yet art thou far more mighty, & hast the means to mak them as white as snow.

Rest thy selfe then, O my soule, wherefore art thou astonished, and so troubled within me? Awaite on the Lord thy God and helper, hee will drawe thee out
of anguish, and lodge thee in a more spatious place. He will bestow all goodnes vpon thee, because in him alone grace, succour & deliuerance aboundeth.

Hee takes no delight in the death of a sinner, but rather that hee should conuert and liue. He hath redeemed thee from all thy sinnes, and will preserue thee from euery euill: in Iesus Christ his deare Sonne, and thy Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer to be vsed when it Lightens, Thunders, or in any other dangerous Tempests.
div.p:
ALmighty God, it behooueth that all those that holde any authority vpō
earth, should glorifie thee, and reuerendly prostrate themselues dayly before thee.

For thou beeing Eternall, and mounted vpon the throne of thy Holinesse dost shew thy might and power in all places. The voice of the Lord soundeth like vnto greate waters, the God of glory maketh thunder. The voice of the Eternall is strong and magnificent, the earth is shaken and trembleth, and the foundations of the mountaines are remoued.

Smoake commeth forth of his nostrils, and a deuouring fire out of his mouth, euen as when it lightens and thunders. Thy tabernacle is round enuironed with darkenesse, and cloudes which are both thicke and blacke:
Wherein thou hidest thy selfe, treading all obscurity vnderneath thy feete, and from the brightnesse which is before thee, the cloudes are scattered and dispearsed.

Great God, thou thunderest in Heauen, and makest thy voice to be heard on earth: thou driuest the winds out of their secret caues, and makest them returne into their places, after they haue executed thy command. All things are subiect to thee, they acknowledge thee for their Creator, and they tremble before thy most high Maiesty.

The loftiest mountains and the very lowest deeps, are amazed when thou wexest to bee displeased: the whole earth quaketh, the Sea and all other
waters flie before thine anger.

The voyce of the Eternall shiuers the flames of fire in sunder, hee makes the Deserts tremble, and the Lord is King for euer. He wil giue strength vnto his people, and (with peace) extend his blessings vpon them.

Gratious God, preserue vs from thy insupportable anger, pardon vs our sins, let thine amiable countenance shine vpon vs, and alwaies be neare vnto vs. Spare vs good Lord, that this greeuous, sudden and terrible tempest may passe away, without doing any dammage. Keepe our bodies, our houses and al our goods, from lightening, fiering or any such like destruction.

Preserue the fruites of
the earth, that they may not bee spoiled by frostes, stormes, floods of water, or any other inconueniences: And blesse vs all from euill, sudden and vnprepared death. O God the Father, who didst cause thy deare Sonne to suffer the torments of the Crosse for me: be my defender.
Iesus king of the Iewes, that dyedst a most bitter death for mee: be my protector.
Holy Ghost, which art the Spirit of adoption, and rendrest testimonie to my spirit, that I am the Child of God: be euer my keeper, that no harme or mischance happen vnto mee. Amen.

div.head: A Praier to be vsed in the time of Pestilence or any other mortality.
div.p:
EVerliuing God, we humbly confesse, that by our sinnes we haue too often offended against thee, iustly deseruing all kindes of punishmentes whatsoeuer. For alasse, we haue altogether gone astray, and are become vtterly vnprofitable: in that neither our fathers, or we haue kept thy commandements, lawes, and statutes: But with most contrite and repentant hearts, wee doe now intreate thy great mercie, in fauour of Iesus Christe thy deare Sonne: And not to deale with vs as our
sinnes doe deserue, but (according to thy long forbearance and compassion) to take pitty vpon vs.

Come a little neerer Lord, and (in thy fatherly affection) withdraw from vs this horrible plague of pestilence, and let vs not die of this dreadfull death. Take vs not away in thine anger, neither assemble our soules among sinners, or our liues with the wicked, but let thy fury and indignation cease and bee appeased. What, wilt thou be angry with vs for euer? And shall thy rage passe so violently against vs, as to make an end of vs altogether? Wilt thou not restore vs againe, that thy people once more may reioice in thee? Lord shewe vs thy fauour and wonted assistance, remember thine
olde louing kindnesse and mercy: euen for thine own names sake bee mindfull of it.
O good God, thou art iust, and all thy iudgments are vnreproueable: For we haue sinned, and prouoked thy iust displeasure against vs, so that (euen in meere right) this heauie rod is come vpon vs.

But pardon the transgressions of thy people, and take away from vs this sudden contagion. In regard of the most greeuous passion of Iesus Christ, preserue vs from al euill, sudden death & euerlasting damnation. But if it bee thy blessed will, by this plague to chastise vs yet more for our iniquities: Giue vs grace & strength, patiently to endure thy fatherly hand, and no way
to dispaire by reason of thy punishment. For when we are iudged, we are then taught by thee O Lord, to the end, wee should not be cōdemned with the world. And much better it is for vs to be temporally corrected, then eternally in the other life to come.

Wee rather desire then (most louing Father) to fall into thy hands, then the hands of men, because thy grace and mercy is great. Let vs therefore continually holde firme faith in Iesus Christ, who is the euerlasting propitiation, and most perfect sacrifice for all our sinnes. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer against the Turke, or other persecutors.
div.p: ALmighty God, King of Kings, Lord of heauen and earth, wee acknowledge, that we and our fathers haue committed multitudes of sinnes against thee. We haue fild vp the mouth of iniquity, and shewne our selues so wicked, that (hauing prouoked thee to wrath) wee haue not onelye merited temporall, but also eternal punishments.

But yet wee beseeche thee with penitent hearts, that (in grace) it woulde please thee, and for thy deare Sons sake: to pardon all our sinnes, and defend vs against the horrid tyranny, and mighty power
of the Turke.

Thou seest Lord, how far he is entred vpon thine inheritance, hoping to defile thy Church, and reduce whole Cities and townes into heapes of stones. The bodies of thy seruants, hath he giuen to bee fed on by the fowles of the heauen: and the flesh of thy Saints, to the beasts of the field. He hath powred out the bloud of Christians like water, not suffering any one to bury their bodies. Permit not vs (Lord) in like maner to be a by-word, mockery, and contempt to our neighbours.

How long (O Lorde) wilt thou bee offended? shall thine anger consume like a quenchlesse fire? Remember not our precedent iniquities, but hastily
take compassion vpon vs, for we are become but few and poore.

O God of our saluation assist vs, reuenge vs, and discharge vs of our sinnes, euen for the loue of thy glorious name. Why dost thou suffer Pagans to say: Where is now their God? Let vengeance for the bloode of thy seruants (which hath beene so lauishly shed by them) bee manifested vpon them in our presence. Let the sighings of poore Christian prisoners, come vp before thee, and by thy great power, preserue them that are markt out for death. Let Turkes loose their courage, as hauing neither hart or hardines, and shrink vp the sinnewes in their armes.

De • end thou vs, O
great God of battailes, shew vs thy succour: to the end, that there may be matter of reioycing by the well doing of thy people, and wee with thy whole heritage, to glorifie thee. Be alwaies at hand with vs, for thy names sake, because there is no other that can fight for vs, but onely thou O God.
Lift vp thy strong arme against those strangers, to the ende, that they may knowe what wee knowe, namely: That there is no other God beside thee. So be it.

div.head: A generall Confession of sinnes, with prayer to obtaine pardon for them.
div.p:
IVst God and merciful father, I confesse that
not only I was conceiued and borne in sinne: but that all the whole time of my life (euen from mine infancie vntil this present) I haue (alas) committed many and most great iniquities.

For I haue not (O my God) neither loued, feared nor obeyed thee, as I ought to haue done: nor haue I put my trust in thee, with all my heart, with all my soule, with al my strength, and with all my vnderstanding faculties.

I haue not called vpon thy name, neither glorified thy sacred Maiestie: but rather haue abused it, by cursing, swearing, lying and euill speaking. I haue often neglected the preaching of thy holy word, Or when I haue beene attentiue therto, my amendment
of life hath beene little bettered thereby.
I haue been disobedient to my Father, Mother and Superiours: Nor haue I loued my neighbor as my selfe, but rather haue hated, despised, and done him much dammage.

I haue shewen my selfe vnshamefaced in wordes and deeds, and in my practise or vocation, I haue addicted my selfe to sundry deceits and subtill beguilings: contrary to the charity due to my neighbor. I haue defamed, & slandered those that haue conuersed with me, & haue bin couetous of many thinges not appertaining to me.

I haue beene proud, auaritious, vnchaste, cholerick, gluttenous, enuious and slothfull. Nay, I haue giuē occasion to my neighbours
whereby to sinne, & haue violated the league or bonde made to thee in my Baptisme. I confesse then (with forrow and vnfaigned repentance) the sins which I haue directly committed against thee, in wordes, workes, or thoughts, openly or priuately: yea, all my secret faults, wherein thou knowest, better then I doe, how guilty I am.

I am an vnprofitable seruant, that haue trespassed against heauen and before thee, I am not worthy to be called thy childe, neither to lift mine eyes vp vnto thee. For I haue offended thee by many great and enormous iniquities. I haue charged my soule and conscience, with a weightier burden then I am able to beare.

Yet notwithstanding all this, I humbly appeare before thy throne of grace, appealing from thy seuere iustice, to thy more mighty mercie. O Lord my God, be neere to mee a poore wretched sinner, pardon my transgressions, and receiue as a full satisfaction for them, the innocent death of thy dearely beloued Sonne Iesus Christ. Graunting me grace hereafter, and hence forward to amend my sinfull life. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer to be saide before receiuing the blessed Sacrament of the Lords Supper.
div.p:
LOrde Iesus Christ, eternall Sonne of GOD, who diddest suffer
death in thy humane nature, to redeeme vs from sinne and endlesse destruction.
In the last supper which thou hadst with thy Disciples, it pleased thee to ordaine and establish, a perpetual memorie of this thy louing faithfulnes. To the end, that it might neuer be forgotten.

There thou didst institute a new league or bond, whereby the sinnes of the faithfull are for euer cancelled. And didst likewise appoint vs, to eate in the bread (by faith) thy true body, and to drinke in the wine, thy precious blood: Adding thereunto a gracious promise, of full forgiuenes of all our sinnes.

Wee poore and miserable humaine creatures, come now vnto thee (as
to the sourse or fountaine of all grace) Entreating that it would please thee, to wash vs from all our sinfull blemishes, to make clean our soules, and new create them. To the end, that with true penitence, in firme faith, honour and reuerence (being worthily prepared) wee may receiue those blessed viands of our saluation.

Grant that by this mysterie of the new Testament, our faith may be encreased, our hope strengthened, our charity enflamed, our weake consciences cōforted, and all temptations surmounted. So that being throughly assured in our soules, of thy diuine fauour and eternall saluation, wee may feele that supernal grace, which is veyled or hidden vnder
this blessed Sacrament.

Most gentle Lord, let the eies of our spirits bee illumined, to know what the hope of our inheritance is, and the vnualuable riches of this most excellent banquet. Wherein, with thy precious bodie and blood, thou communicatest vnto vs, and freely appropriatest to euerie one of vs, all the treasures of celestiall happinesse: To wit, remission of sinnes, true righteousnesse, and life euerlasting. Assist vs, that with good desires and holy affections, wee may often and worthilie pertake of this blessed Sacrament.

Roote out of our harts all corruptions that displease thee, and may impeach
or turne vs away from thee. Enlarge the way of thy g • ace before vs, for our more neere approching to thee. To the end, that being partakers of the fruite of this holy Table: Our soules (famished and ouerpressed with hunger before) may be filled and fully satisfied. And eate with thee likewise (in the life to come) the bread celestiall in thy Heauenly Kingdome. So be it.

div.head: Another Prayer for the same purpose.
div.p:
LOrde Iesus christ, I am vnworthy to open my mouth, & receiue the blessed Sacrament of thy body & blood. For I am a
poore sinner, and thou art such a Lord, as the Heauen of Heauens cannot comprehend thee.

How is it possible then, that a wretched humaine creature, who is but dust and ashes, should any way be worthie to receiue thy precious body and blood? I knowe very well, and doe confesse it, that the multitude of my sinnes is great, and euen (for this occasion) I am most vnworthy of all other, to present my selfe at this celestiall Banquet.

In the meane while neuerthelesse, I beleeue in my heart, and confesse it with my mouth, that (by thy grace) thou canst make and render mee worthie. For thou art Almightie, mercifull, & hast the means to make pure and holy,
whatsoeuer cōmeth from vncleane seede.
Men and women, that are wretched sinners by nature, thou canst deliuer them for iust and holy: When (by grace) thou hast quitted their sinnes, and renewed them by thy sanctifying Spirit.

Therefore I most humbly entreate thee, that by thy vertue and diuine charity, thou wilt graunt me grace to bee prepared, or poorely worthy, to present my selfe before thy Table. Not to presume thither as an intruder, for so I should come most vnworthily, and bee guiltie of thy bodie and blood, and receiue death in stead of life. Assist me then, that I may acknowledge my selfe to be a poo • e wretched sinner, and that I may
take a true examination of my selfe: Whether I haue hearty contrition for my sinnes or no, and whether I discerne rightly thy pretious body and blood.

O my God, let mee alwaies submit my reason, sense and vnderstanding, to thy diuine word, and strengthen mee by thine aide, with all my might to amend my sinfull life. To the end, that in this blessed Sacrament, I may not receiue onely by my mouth thy bodie and blood: But that in true faith, I may also receiue my Sauiour and Redeemer, locking him vp fast in my heart, as hauing in him all life and saluation.

For thou art the liuing bread, that didst descend downe from Heauen, and
giuest life to all men. They that come to thee, shall neuer more be hungry: they that beleeue in thee, shall neuer more thirst: and they which eate thy flesh and drinke thy blood, shall remaine in thee, and thou in them, and to haue life eternally.

Most gracious Lorde, like as the Hart desireth the water brooke: euen so my soule longeth after thee. My soule is thiestie for my God, who is the liuing God, when shall I come to the place, where I may see thy face? O my GOD, replenish mee with thy heauenly fauour. Amen.

div.head: Thanksgiuing to be vsed after receiuing the blessed Sacrament.
div.p: IEsus Christ, our true soueraign and eternall Sacrifice, thou art seated at the right hand of God, vpon the throne of Maiesty in Heauen: hauing the administration of all goodnesse to come, and of the true Tabernacle, which is not made by hands.

Thou entredst once (by thy precious blood) into the holy places, and hast obtained eternal Redemption: when without any spot (by the blessed Spirit) thou didst sacrifice thy selfe vnto the Father: to clense
our consciences from all dead works, to the end that we might serue the liuing God.

Therefore we giue thee thanks with all our harts, because, by wiliing obedience to thy Father (euen in ardent charity, mighty integrity, and vnspeakable patient humility) thou didst suffer a most ignominious death on the Crosse for vs poore miserable and wretched sinners.

Moreouer, thou hast instituted this blessed Sacrament, for an eternall memory of thy faithfulnes and fauour on our behalfe: Leauing it likewise, as an earnest penny, seale or testimony, for the remission of our sinners.

Thou hast called and brought vs to the Communion of this wonderful
feeding. To the end, that we might refresh our hungrie soules, languishing thirstily after life euerlasting.

O Lord my God, great is thy loue, thy mercy vnexpressable, and thy grace incomprehensible. Thou despisest no persons comming to this heauēly banquet, except they exclude themselues, or intrude thither vnworthily.

If any one doe hunger or thirst, here he is fully satisfied. Such as are in necessitie, may here finde the riches and treasures of life. The desolate, heere meete with comfort: The sicke, heere finde physicke and health for their soules. Such as are ouerladen with their sinnes, are here disburdened in their consciences: And they which
are assaild by death, doe heere meete with life that cannot be molested.

Helpe vs then, O good God, that this blessed Sacrament which wee haue receiued, may auaile to our saluation: And that heereafter, wee may retaine the fulnesse of our hope: without any wauering, because thou art faithfull in all thy promises. And let vs haue care one of another, such as may incite vs to charity and good works, neuer forsaking our holy assembly, but alwaies comforting one another therein.

And this is to be done so much the more respectiuely (because we see the day draweth on, and the end of our life approacheth neere) Onely to make vs the more able, to awaite (in ioyfull expectation)
thy blessed and most gracious comming. So be it.

div.head: Another Thanksgiuing to the same purpose.
div.p: LORDE Iesus Christ, Lambe of God, I render thee most hearty thankes, because thou didst offer thy selfe to thy louing Father, a sweet smelling Sacrifice for our sins, and hast appeased all the wrath and displeasure, which was iustly heaped vp against vs.

Thou didst institute this blessed Sacrament, to make vs remember and assure our selues thereof: By giuing vs therein thy true body to eat, and thy very blood to drinke, to
the faithfull receiuer.

Thou didst speake it: Doe this at all times in remembrance of me. Giuing vs thereby to vnderstand, that so oftentimes as wee eat of this bread and drink of this Cup, we are bound to declare thy death. As also to publish and make known, what thou hast won and conquered for vs: namely, forgiuenesse of our sinnes, endlesse life and saluation.

I beseech thee by thy bitter passion and death, to assist me, that I may pertake more often in deuotion, true zeale, and worth of this holy Banquet. And that I may consider, how much thou hast labored for me: what paines thou hast suffered to redeeme me, and how great charity thou hast shewed vnto me.

So that I may bee the more excited thereby, with heart and mouth daily to thanke thee, for all thy graces & benifits. Louing thee reciprocallie, with all my might and vttermost power, and so bee found vnreproueable in the path of thine ordenances.

If I chance to slip or fall by infirmitie, giue mee grace to rise againe quickly to thee. And that I may bee throughly comforted in this newe and perpetuall league, or couenaunt of thy Heauenly charity and goodnesse towards me.

Grant that by this blessed Sacrament, I may bee vnited and incorporated, into one selfe same flesh and blood with thee. That I may followe thee patiently in all aduersities,
continually seeking those thinges which are aboue, and adhering by firme faith to thee, as to my only head and Lord.

Moreouer, because (by this Sacrament) wee are bound to brotherly loue, and to bee faithfull one to another, (in regard, that as the bread and wine is made of many grains and grapes, so we in like maner (beeing many) ought also to be vnited with thee, in one and the same spirituall bodie) Strengthen vs, that we participating of one bread, and of one Cup: may likewise intirely loue one another, euen as thy true members. And that (aboue all things) we may throw off all anger, hatred, or enuie, hartelie pardoning others, as thou already hast pardoned vs.

To the end, that liuing henceforth together in brotherly loue and loyall affection: We may enter at the last day, with thee our Bride-groome, to the eternall Banquet in thy heauenly Kingdome. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for one that is Sicke.
div.p: LOrd and heauenly Father, thou art a iust God, and sufferest none to be tempted beyond their power: But with the temptation thou giuest the issue, so that with patience they may support it. I heartely pray vnto thee, that in my greate necessities and griefes, my burden may not be ouer big or waighty

Strengthen me in such sort, that I may patiently beare all, and neuer bee distrustfull of thy mercie. Iesus Christ, Son of the liuing God, who for mee didst suffer the torments of the Crosse, and last of all dyedst a most bitter death f •• my sinnes: I cry vnto •• ee from the depth of my heart, to take pitty on mee a poore miserable sinner.

Pardon me al my transgressions, which in my whole life time I haue committed against thee, and let mee neuer faile in faith towards thee. God the holy Ghost, in all distresses the truest comforter, preserue me in patience and right calling vppon thee, sanctifie me by stedfast confidence. And neuer leaue mee in my latest necessities: but then leade me
out of this vale of miserie, to thy heauenly Kingdom my true home. So be it.

div.head: Another to the same effect.
div.p: ALmighty God and Heauenlie Father, thou hast commaunded vs, to call vpon thee in all our necessities, and hast promised to heare vs, and giue vs cause to glorifie thee. I call vnto thee now in my grieuous affliction, desiring thee in Iesus Christ thy deare Son, neuer to forsake me a poore miserable sinner.

And if this sicknesse of mine be not deadly, giue me grace to recouer again by thy mercy. To the end, I may tell and recount to others, the power and vertue
thou hast exercised on me.
But if it bee better for me, to dye speedily, then longer time to abide in this miserable life: Lord let thy will bee done on earth, as it is in Heauen.

Let mee alwaies (as is best for mee) commit my selfe wholly to thy wil, and preserue me to my ending, in true faith, memory, and Christian knowledge. Let me neuer be sundred from thee, but receiue my soule vp into thy Kingdome: for thy deare Sonnes sake Iesus Christ my Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
MOst powerful GOD, that art gracious, mercifull, patient, of great goodnesse and faithfulnes, in pardoning our sinnes and iniquities: I humbly beseech thee, (in grace) to forgiue me all mine offences, confirming and keeping my soule, against all temptations whatsoeuer. Come to mine aide and assistance, that my faith wauer not: my hope faile me not, nor my charity wexe colde: neither suffer mee through humaine infirmitie, to fall by the dreadfull terrors of death. Likewise, when mine houre shall be come, let mee depart in peace, for mine eies haue
seene thy sauing health: which thou didst prepare before all peoples faces: a light to lighten the Gentiles, and to be the glory of thy people Israel.

I hope and trust in thee my Sauiour, Lord let mee neuer fall into confusion, for thou art my helpe and strength. Behold me with the eies of thy mercy, and turne thy fatherly countenance towards me: in Iesus Christ thy Sonne, who by his passion and death, purchased eternal redemption for me. So be it.

div.head: Another.
div.p:
FAther of all grace, take pittie on my pore soule, pardon all the sinnes, which I haue committed
against thee.
Despise not thy poore creature, neither cast me away, that am the worke of thy hands, let not that bee lost, which thou hast made and created.

For I trust in thee, thou art my GOD and helper. Christ my true Sauiour, the Lambe of God, that takest away the sinnes of the worlde, and hast washed and cleansed mee in thy blood: I pray thee by thy passion, which thou didst principally suffer, when thy noble soule departed out of thy most holy body: to take compassion likewise on my poore soule, when it shall part hence, and be led by thee to euerlasting life. God the holy Ghost, thou most kinde cōforter, preserue my hart against all temptations of
the wicked enemie: and so confirme my confidence, that I may vndoubtedly beleeue, the forgiuenesse of my sinnes, and hope for life eternall. O blessed Trinity, I commend my spirit into thy hands: thou God art faithfull, and thou that hast redeemed mee, liuest and reignest in all eternitie. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for such as do come to visite the sicke person in his extremitie.
div.p:
GOod and omnipotent God, that preseruest our liues in death, we pray that it would please thee, to turn the eies of thy mercie towards this poore sick man, ease his afflictions
in soule and body, and (in grace) forgiue him all his sinnes. Accept the sacrifice, of the innocent death of thy deare Sonne Iesus Christ, as a full satisfaction for all his iniquities: For hee was baptized in his name, and is washed and made cleane in his precious blood.

Asswage his paines and anguishes, keep him from all accusations of conscience, and the subtill temptations of the wicked aduersarie: that he may valiantly fight in firme faith, holde out to the end, and obtaine the victorie.
Grant him a happy entrance into endlesse life, & send thine Angels to conduct him into the assembly of thine elect, through Iesus Christ our Lord and Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: OTHER GODLY AND CHRISTIAN Prayers, for particular purposes.
1. For Souldiers that serue as Sentinels, or keepe watch in the Court of guard.
div.p:
O Our GOD, Father and Sauiour, since it hath pleased thee to bee so gracious to vs, in safety to suffer vs to ouerpasse this night, and bring vs once more to behold the chearefull day light: wee render
thee thanks therfore, from the bottome of our hearts. And humbly beseech thee, that as thou sufferest the Sunne to shine vpon the earth, lending vs thereby our bodily light: so thou wouldst illuminate & prepare our soules, by the bright splendor of thy blessed Spirit, to followe the direct way of righteousnesse, vnder thy holy conduct and protection all our whole life time, pardoning vs all our passed offences, for Iesus Christes sake our Lord and Sauiour.

Moreouer, since it pleaseth thee to imploy vs this day, as guard to this Cittie, Towne or place, let thy grace effectually perswade vs. that this is an acceptable seruice to thee: in discharging the same so faithfully as wee ought to
doe, and not grudging, that wee watch when others are at quiet rest, who likewise are readie to doe as much for vs. Seeing also, that we are taught and assured by thy holy word, that all vigilancie, industrie and might of men is vnprofitable, and can serue to no vse, except thou (O God of Hostes) lay too thy helping hand, for without thy sacred prouidence, wee can neither watch, warde nor warre: May it therefore please thee, to be the Chieftaine in our company, as well to giue vs wisedome, aduise and direction, for the better ordering of our charge: as also to make benefit of our labour, thou continuing still with vs, and day by day defending vs vnder thy protection.

So shall we haue cause, to blesse. thy sacred name here below in thy Church, and afterward (aboue) in all perpetuitie. Through our Lorde Iesus Christ: who hath taught vs how to aske these thinges, and all other that are needefull for vs, and generally for all of Christian faith, in saying: O our Father. &c.

div.head: For the Euening.
div.p: LOrd God and Father, wee render thee hartie thanks, because (by thy goodnesse) we haue so well passed this present day, following the charge whereunto it pleased thee to call vs.

But because there are many defaillanees in vs, and that if thou shouldst
iudge vs according to thine owne vprightnesse, thou wouldest finde vs guiltie of manie greate faults: wee doe therefore here humble our selues in thy presence, confessing, that we are poore and miserable sinners.

We beseech thee also, according to thine owne blessed promise, in the name of Iesus Christ, thy onely Sonne and our onely Mediatour: to couer and hide all our iniquities, euen as now thou wrappest vp the earth in the cloudie obscuritie of dark night, giuing vs grace, that during this dim season, and the whole remainder of our liues hereafter, we may walk in the feare and reuerence of thy holy name.

Moreouer, in regard we are to watch this night, to
giue leysure and respite for the whole body of the Cittie to repose themselues: wee beseech thee to enable vs, to performe our dutie chearfully and with good courage, that the watching appointed to vs, may not seeme painfull or burdenous: but each one to keep his order peaceably, and all to holde good agreement together.

O thou great GOD of Armies, suffer vs not to vse the darknesse of this night dishonestly, vnfaithfully, or as a cloake to idle slothfulnesse: but let vs know that thou art an eye witnesse of all mens actions, in all places where & howsoeuer, let vs walk then in thy feare, according to the direction of thy holy word.

Because also thou reseruest
vnto thy selfe, the honor of garding Towns and Citties, as in meere right it appertaineth onely to thee: we intreat thee, to bee President in the midst of vs, giue direction to our Vigilance, and make it so prosperous, that wee may acknowledge in all humilitie, we neither can or ought to depend vpon any, but only thee.

Sende downe thy holy Angels, and let them pitch their Tents round about this Towne and vs all, to preserue it and vs from forrain inuasion: Let their mighty power protect and guide vs, least it and we be vanquished, and ouer-run by the enemie.
Let them watch also with vs, and keepe vs in safety.

Defend and preserue vs, from the hands of our enemies visible and inuisible, and keepe vs continually in thy safegard: that wee may euermore praise thy name, and render thee thankes in Iesus Christ our Lord. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer to be said before a man begins his worke, or any Labour.
div.p:
O LORD, our good God and Father, since it hath pleased thee to command, that all humaine Creatures shall labour, and eate their bread in the sweat of their browes, while they remaine in this life, & yet seeing (without thy blessing) no one cā prosper, or receiue any good
successe in his affaires: we humbly beseech thee, that thou wouldst blesse our labours in such sort, as therby wee may haue iust occasion to confesse the goodnesse, assistance, and fatherly care which thou takest of vs.

Moreouer Lord, let thy holy Spirit be our directer, to the end wee may faithfully exercise the workes of our estate & vocation, without any fraud, collusion or deceipt. And giue vs grace, rather to regard the following of thine ordenance, then to satisfie the appetite of our owne sinfull flesh, which couets to inrich it selfe by any meanes whatsoeuer.

Neuerthelesse, and if it be thy pleasure, to prosper our endeuours, graunt vs also chearfull dispositions,
to helpe and succour such as are needy, according to thy talents bestowed vpon vs. And let vs keepe within the bounds of humility, not puffing our selues vp aboue the poore, by that which we inioy, but by thy bounty and goodnesse. But if it be thy will so to deale with vs, as to abase and impouerish vs, farre beyond the fraile affections of fleshly nature: yet vouchsafe to enrich vs another way, with cleauing faithfully to thy promises, whereby wee shall no way fall into distrust, but rather be more certainly assured, that thou wilt neuer forsake vs in the extremity of our wants.

Enable vs patiently to attend thy leysure, when thou shalt againe replenish vs with thy graces,
not only temporall, but also those which are Spirituall: receiuing thereby daily more ample occasion, to giue thee praise and thanks, and to expect all things from thee. Heare vs Father of mercy, in Iesus Christ, thy Sonne and our Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: Thanksgiuing to be vsed after his labour or worke is finished.
div.p:
O Lord my God, I render thee harty thanks, because thou hast preserued me from infinite dangers, which might haue happened to oppresse and ou • rwhelme me, all the while I haue beene about my businesse, if thou (Lord) hadst not carefullie regarded,
and kept me from any euil inconueniences.

Nowe therefore, most louing Father, I humbly entreate thee for Iesus Christes sake, to pardon all the faults which I haue offended thee in, during the time of my labour, or otherwise. Punish me not in thine anger, nor reprehend mee in thy heauie displeasure: although I haue shewen my selfe worse then I ought to haue done, both towards thee, and on my neighbours behalfe.

Worke in mee so by the efficacie of thy blessed Spirit, that henceforward I may walke in much greater integritie, and re • pectiuely performe those duties, which are required in the vocation of true Christians: to the ende, that though I trauaile in body,
yet in spirit and affection I may serue thee O God, and glorifie thy name in all mine actions.
Giue mee grace (willingly) to offend no person, but rather let mee endeuour to edifie euery one, by those meanes which (in this life) thou hast lent me.

Leade and guide me by thy word and sanctifying Spirit, in all truth and honest conuersation, neuer swaruing from the direct path of thy commaundements: that finally, it may bring mee to life euerlasting, through Iesus Christ my Lord and Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for a young man, that prepares himselfe for Mariage.
div.p:
LOrd God, Eternall & most powerfull Father, heere I prostrate my •… e befrre thee, giuing •… ee thanks with hart and •… uth: for forming me in •… e wombe of my Mother, •… d suffering mee to bee •… me such as I am, main
•… ning me likewise from •… outh to this instant, 〈…〉 preseruing mee from infinite euils. For it is 〈…〉 thy prouidence •… nd Fatherly blessing, that I haue attained to the yea • es I now am in: and in that time by thy holy word • thou hast taught me to kn • we, thy beloued
Sonne Iesus Christ, the onely happinesse that a Christian can haue, because (in the true knowledge of him) eternal life consisteth, and therefore I cannot sufficiently praise thee, 〈◊〉 all the great benefits thou hast bestowed on me.
Neuerthelesse, because thou hast commanded vs, to call vpon thee in all our necessities, & most louingly also hast promised to heare vs, let it now please thee graciously to helpe me.

For I haue found and proued, that in regarde of mine owne natures corruption, I cannot continue chaste and blamelesse: except I vse the meanes which thou hast instituted, and by thy holy word hast also approoued the same, saying: To auoyde whoredome,
let euery man haue his wife, and euery woman her husband. Then I beseech thee, in mercie, to lend me thy helping hand, and so to blesse me and my Parents, that in this intended matter, we may not be abused by any exteriour appearance, either of beauty, riches or deceiuing speeches, which may fore-runne or precede this businesse. But, as thy word saith: A vertuous wife is a gift which comes onely from thee: And as it is most certaine, that not onely thou gauest Eue to Adam: but didst likewise conioyne Abraham with Sara, Isaack with Rebecca, and Iaacob, with his best esteemed Rachel: Euen so I entreat thee, O Father of lights (from whom euery good and perfect gift proceedeth) not onely to be
my Father, but also to appoint me my fellow-partner, in regard, thou oughtest to be the authour and actor in so weighty a businesse. Send downe thy holy Angels, to bee my guide and leader towarde her, whom thou hast prepared for me, as thou madest them (in like case) seruants to Abraham & young Tobias. Then let me meet her, enioy her, and liue with her, in thy feare and fauour. O Lorde Iesus Christ, may it please thee with thy benediction, to be present at my mariage, as thou didst vouchsafe to honour that at Cana in Galilee.

Graunt that those waters of miserie, affliction and temptation, which may seeke to drowne so blessed a dignitie: by thy
power and most gracious goodnesse, may bee changed into good and delicious wines, to beare vs aboue all extremities with patience. Chase away Asmodeus, the enemie to mariage, and all other malitious fiends farre from our dwelling, & giue vs grace, that wee fearing thee, O Father, Sonne and holy Ghost, may walke faithfully in thy waies. To the end, that we may obtaine the largesse of those things from thee, which thou knowest much better then wee can, or doe, to be necessarie for this life, and that which is to come. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for a young Maiden, or a Widdow preparing to mariage.
div.p:
ALmighty God, who onely makest mens endeuours to prosper in this worlde: for without thine aide and blessing, whatsoeuer they doe, cannot come to good. I thy poore creature, whō neuerthelesse thou hast vouchsafed, to receiue into thine alliance, by the holy Sacrament of Baptisme: doe heere present my selfe before thee, beseeching thee, in the name of Iesus thy beloued Sonne, to stretch forth thy hand and helpe me. To the end, that if it bee thy will I shall marrie, thou mayest guide and lead me to a vertuous
yoake-fellow, with whom I may liue according to thy wil, so long as we shal continue together. It was thou O God, that gauest Eue to Adam, and didst addresse the seruant of Abraham towards Rebecca, that shee might bee wife to the Patriarch Isaack.

Thou didst sende thine Angel with young Tobias, to deliuer Sara the daughter of Raguell, out of the poore, desolate and opprobrious condition wherein she then liued, and to match her in mariage with the said Tobias. This is not a case of chaunce or fortune, neither guided by mens wisedome, or heaping vp goods together. It often comes to passe, that after one hath plodded, and carefully considered all circumstances and causes
〈4 pages missing〉
ther, Lord, and Sauiour of all Christian women, and wilt make them partakers of thy graces ioyes and comforts eternall: wherefore my husband, my s • lfe, my children and all mine, I commend now and euermore into thy hands. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for a Childe, when his Parents prouide him or her a Maister or Mistresse, to learne any Mysterie.
div.p:
ETernall Son of God, who was borne in pouertie and miserie, to the end we might be inriched, and in thy youth did willingly humble thy selfe, to learn and exercise the trade of a Carpenter, submitting
thy selfe there in to Ioseph, and to the most blessed virgin thy Mother. My deare Parents, at this instant, are likewise appointing mee to a mysterie and seruice, which I besech thee (good-God) that I may learne diligently, labour in faithfully, behauing my selfe alwaies like an honest childe: and that (in recompence of my Parents loue and paines) I may be able to stand them in some helpful stead, when they growe into yeares or other infirmities, to repay backe some small portion of their tender care ouer me, in my younger yeares. Thou gatherest and asemblest thy Church by thy word, euen of all sorts of people, & thou wilt be serued, honoured and praised, as well by men of trade or
occupation, as any other beside, because thou hast no respect of persons by outward appearance. Therefo • e I assure my selfe, that thou wilt not reiect my prayer, but listen vnto it in thy mercy, and in the name of Iesus Christ my alone Sauiour. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer befitting any Father and Mother, sending their Children forth to Schoole.
div.p:
O God, Creator of heauen and earth, the ordainer & preseruer of mariage, since in thy great mercie thou hast giuen vs children, and hast likewise receiued them into thine alliance, regenerating them by water & the holy Ghost in
blessed Baptisme, to the end, that they might be thy children. And in regard withall, thou hast very seriously commanded, that they should be brought vp in thy feare, and according to thine instruction: Behold Lord, those children which thou hast giuen me, I am sending them forth to Schoole, to be taught and instructed as best becommeth them. But because without thine aid • , we can doe nothing, Lord God, Father of lights, to thee I commend their studies: for it is onely thou that canst make them wise, learned and happy. Giue them thy sancified Spirit, and make them organes of good endeuours, to glorifie thee, serue in thy Church, and raise vp to vs comfort and contentment. Thou didst
teach and enstruct the Prophet Samuel, in the Schoole of Heli, and madest him become an excellent personage: as thou didst the like by King Salomon, enstructing him in the schoole of the Prophet Nathan. Then safely may I recommend to thee, (thou Lord of all learning) these children of mine: in the name of thy deare Sonne Iesus Christ, the principall Doctour of all the faithfull, who blesse and bring them vp in his feare and truth. So be it.

div.head: A man Seruants Prayer.
div.p:
LOrd God, euerliuing Father, who hast appointed, since sinne first entred into the world, that there should be Maisters
and Seruants, and didst heare Abrahams seruant crying to thee: I now addresse my selfe to thy diuine Maiestie, because seruice is necessarie for me, to maintaine mee in this life, and beseech thee, O most louing Father, to prouide for mee among good people, that may not hinder me from hearing thy word, but rather giue mee occasion by their good example, to seeke those things which appertaine to my saluation. Assist mee also by thy holy Spirit, that I may render them good & faithfull seruice, and truly take charge of whatsoeuer they trust me withall.

Blesse (O God) my labours, and extend thy benediction on those affaires I shall manage: that thy grace gouerning me, while
I serue heere on earth, I may afterward be an heire and fellowe Cittizen (by Iesus Christes meanes) in the Kingdome of Heauen. Thy mercie was so great, to the Centurions seruant of Capernaum, that hee found a good Maister. Thou didst likewise so louingly respect poore Ioseph, when hee was a seruant, that all thinges prospered vnder his handes: I say no more, deare Sauiour, but be as merc • full to me a poore willing Seruant, and as thou hast appointed, let me rest contented. So be it.

div.head: A Maid Seruants Prayer.
div.p:
MY Lord and Sauiour seeing thou hast called mee to this estate and cōdition, that I must serue to sustaine life, and gaine those benefites necessarily belonging thereto: I submit my selfe gladly to thy prouidence and appointment. For I knowe, thou didst not dispise to speake to poore. Hagar, who was Abrahams seruant, & thou didst likewise prouide good Mistresses for Billha and Zilpha. Let mee then poore Maide entreat thy Maiestie, to prouide an honest place for me, where too much rigour, seueritie and hard vsage may not be shewen mee. Giue mee
grace also, to render them faithfull seruice, carying alwaies a good conscience, and keeping my selfe chast and honest: with dutifull obedience to my Mistresse, vsing her children louingly, and ordering my Maisters businesse as it becommeth me. Extend thy blessing on all my endeuors, that I neither wast, spoile or destroy any thing. Let fire or other casualties (through my negligence) no way harme my Maisters house, and set a locke vpon my lips, that by euill words, I giue no occasion of strife or dissention, but rather, that I may procure peace, amitie and concord, so much as lieth in my power to doe. Thou knowest, O God, much better then I, what is needfull for me, and thy word teacheth
mee, that with th • e there is no respect of persons: but thou hearest the small, as well as the great, the poore as the rich, when they pray vnto thee, in the mediation of Iesus Christ. So be it.

div.head: A Prayer for Children to vse, when their Father is forth on any voyage or iourney.
div.p:
ALmighty God, heauenly Father, who hast graciously promised vs, that whatsoeuer we aske in the name of thy Sonne Iesus Christ, it shall be graunted vs: Thou knowest and perceiuest, that wee haue now very great occasion to pray vnto thee: because our louing and deare Father,
is at this instant from his owne home, and in what perill or danger wee know not, only to support his honest vocation, and to supply what we shall haue need of. We intreat therefore thy heauenly Maiesty, to blesse and keepe him in all his waies, in euerie place where hee trauailes, and all occasions he is imployed in. Sende downe thy holy Angels, to preserue him from harmes, and as young Tobias was assisted by Raphaell the Archangel: so giue grace to our kinde Father, that hee may well and happily perfect his affaires, and then returne home safe and in health to his house. For hee hath instructed, and brought vs vp in thy feare, and prouides at all times what is expedient for vs.

Sende him home succesfully (O Father of Heauen) let our Mother meete him louingly, our kinred greete him heartily, our selues and his whole houshold welcome him dutifully, and all of vs liue together in ioy and prosperity, through Iesus Christ our Lord. So be it.
